loans.use: Purchasing young cattle

loans.name: Sènoumè Anne

texts.fr: Sènoumè Anne est née le 26/07/1970. Anne est mariée à Noël, un couturier de profession. Anne et Noël ont six enfants à charge. C’est ensemble avec son mari que Anne assure les dépenses de la famille. Auparavant, Anne vendait des œufs. Mais depuis quatre ans, Anne vend à manger. Anne vend en effet la pâte de maïs et la pâte de manioc accompagnées de la sauce de viande de porc. C’est à Djeffa que Anne vend ses repas. Anne fait ses provisions à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin. Anne a déjà bénéficié de six crédits de la part de ALIDé pour ses activités ; crédits que Anne a bien remboursés. Anne sollicite un septième crédit de la part de ALIDé pour développer d’avantage son activité.
texts.en:
Sènoumè Anne was born on 26 July 1970. Anne is married to Noël, a dressmaker by profession. Anne and Noël have six children in their care. Together with her husband, Anne provides for the family. Earlier, Anne used to sell eggs. But for the past four years, Anne has been selling ready-to-eat meals. Anne actually sells maize paste and manioc paste accompanied by a sauce made from pork. Anne sells her meals at Djeffa. Anne obtains her supplies at Dantokpa, the grand international market in Benin. Anne has already received six loans through ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners) for her business; Anne has repaid all of these loans properly. Anne is seeking a seventh loan through ALIDÉ to further develop her business.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bags of maize, bags of manoic flour, and pork

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa A. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 45 years old. Theresa is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Theresa owns and operates a tailoring business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing women's tailoring services to local community members. Theresa has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Theresa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Theresa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from PMPC. Theresa is requesting a new loan of 10,500 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. This will be the 8th loan taken out by Theresa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics and materials

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 40 year married with four children aged between 4 and 18 years. All her children go to school. She resides and owns a four roomed house where she is staying with six people. Margaret doesn’t take care of any additional family members There is electricity and piped water at her home.  The family gets two meals a day. She resides and works in a semi urban area selling second hand clothes in one of Kampala suburbs.  She uses public transport to and from shopping. Margaret sells to an average of 10 people a day and sells to all categories of people. She works seven days a week. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and She has been in this business for the last eight years Margaret has been with MCDT for nine years and servicing her twentieth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more bales of clothes  Margaret is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and owning a house in the available plot she bought from previous profits 
 

.

loans.use: To buy more bales of clothes

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is already 50 years old, she is married to Jessie A.. The couple is blessed with two children namely: Jonalyn - 26 years old, a domestic helper in Abu Dhabi; and Joker - 21 years old is a college undergraduate. They are residing at the Christine Village of Cauayan City. People in the village struggle a lot to give their family a good and comfortable living. 

She manages a humble eatery business in the village for almost a year. Her weekly income from the said business is around PHP1, 500 utilized for her family’s daily needs. She wanted to borrow loan amounting to PHP10, 000 from Kiva lenders to improve her business and somehow, able to convert her humble eatery into a bigger one to accommodate bigger number of customers.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Jackielyn

texts.en:
Jackielyn is a direct seller of Personal Collection products at Christine Village of Cauayan City. She is already 27 years old and is doing her best to become successful in her new business. She earns a monthly income of PHP1, 000 in the business and aside from that, she is also managing a food processing business. She would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP8, 000 as additional business capital. Jackielyn hopes to fulfill her dream which is to become successful in her direct selling business in the future with the financial support from Kiva lenders. 

She is very patient in dealing with her customers and as much as possible she give quality service them. She is married to Reynaldo D. who is also trying his best in earning income through a tricycle transport business in their town. They have two children namely; Raymark - 9 years old and Mark Joseph - 6 years of age, who are in the primary level of education.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Ameen

texts.en:
Ameen is 29 years old. He is single and lives with his parents in their own home. He is the source of economic support for their family. He makes a living buying and selling shoes to provide a greater income for his family.

Ameen would like to request a loan of US$ 1500 in order to restock his inventory and purchase more merchandise for the new season. Be an important part of the growth of Ameen's business! He sincerely thanks you.

loans.use: Restock his inventory and purchase more merchandise for the new season

loans.name: Tapongot

texts.en:
Tapongot A. is from the village of Jasaan, Misamis Oriental. She is 24 years old. Tapongot is married. To make a living, Tapongot owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from cultivating and selling a variety of flowers in the local community. Tapongot has been engaged in her business for a long time and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Tapongot joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tapongot is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Tapongot from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Seat

texts.en: Seat H. is 37-year-old and a resident of Siem Reap Province, where he has established a small family home with others family members. He is a fisherman who depends on fish in and around Tunle Sap River on which he normally generates an income of $2 or $3 a day. His wife’s name is Chann Sam, 38, who is a wine distiller and pig raiser, who appears in the picture over. This couple has given birth to two teenage children who are not so long in school and work in construction. Seat H. will be used his loan to buy fertilizer for growing a rice crop during this farming season.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for growing a rice crop

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is a 25-year-old food manufacturer in her simple way. She is married to Redentor P. and they are blessed with a child named Jon Andrei, who is 4 years old. They are peacefully residing in Christine Village of Cauayan City. The place is very simple.

She has managed a food-processing business and at the same time sold cooked snacks in their village for three years. She requests a loan amounting to PHP8,000 that will serve as additional business capital to further establish her store, which is located at their house. This is where she could also display her homemade processed frozen foods and her cooked snacks. Her husband works in a certain company somewhere in Mindanao.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.fr: Elisabeth est née vers 1960 à Cotonou, Capitale Economique du Bénin. Elisabeth est mariée à Gabriel, un agent Commercial. Elisabeth est mère de trois enfants. Elisabeth supporte avec son mari les charges de la famille. Elisabeth vend de la farine de manioc, de poissons fumés et des condiments de sauce chez elle à la maison. Elisabeth a déjà quinze  ans d’expérience dans cette activité. Elisabeth a déjà bénéficié de quatre crédits de la part de ALIDé pour ses activités ; crédits que Elisabeth a bien remboursés. Elisabeth sollicite un cinquième crédit pour constituer de grands stocks de ses produits.
texts.en:
Elisabeth was born around 1960 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Elisabeth is married to Gabriel, a commercial agent. Elisabeth is the mother of three children. With her husband, Elisabeth provides for her family. Elisabeth sells manioc flour, smoked fish, and sauce condiments, all at her house. Elisabeth has gained fifteen years of experience in this business. Elisabeth has already received four loans through ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners) for her business; these loans were all repaid properly. Elisabeth is seeking a fifth loan to generate large stockpiles of her products.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy manioc flour, boxes of fish, and sauce condiments

loans.name: Antiponan

texts.en:
Antiponan R. is from the village of Jasaan, Misamis Oriental. She is 39 years old. Antiponan is married and has eight school-aged children. To make a living, Antiponan raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting flowers for sale. Antiponan has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2009, Antiponan joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Antiponan is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Antiponan from HSPFI.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
For Ofelia, who has had a hog-raising business for almost ten years, “patience is the key to success”. She earns an income of PHP 5,000 for every sale of her raised pigs to buyers.

Ofelia is asking for a loan from Kiva lenders of PHP 12,000 in order to maintain the daily feed supply of her hogs. She hopes that her business continuously grows because her income in the business is really a big help to her family. Hog-raising is a good business to develop, said Ofelia. Thus she is doing her best to further improve the business into a bigger piggery.
 
Ofelia is married to Reynaldo Domingo who is a tricycle driver in the city. She is a good mother to their children and a good wife to her husband. Her three children are Esteban - 15 years old, followed by Florencio - 12 years of age, and Ever - 6 years old. The family currently lives in the simple place of Christine Village, Cauayan City. Ofelia hopes to maintain her family’s good camaraderie and become a more responsible resident of their community as well.

loans.use: To use as additional business capital

loans.name: Magelyn

texts.en:
Magelyn is already 41 years old. She is married to Melvito who happens to be a Barangay treasurer in their village. They are blessed with four children of whom two are still studying, one in college and one in high school. Their family lives in the mountainside of Barangay Capellan, Ilagan, Isabela.

Magelyn manages her improving direct-selling business in which she invites most of her neighbors and friends to place their orders from her Avon, Natasha and MSE brochures. She generates 25% commission for every PHP 100 of sold products. To further increase her credit line with these companies, she is requesting a loan of PHP 16,000 from Kiva lenders.

Magelyn also wants to help her husband to purchase other necessary items for their farm, like fertilizers, pesticides and so on, by increasing her commission from her direct-selling business. They are hoping to have development and growth both in her direct-selling business and in their agriculture business managed by her husband. They also hope to give their children a complete education, especially for those who are interested in studying.

loans.use: To use as additional business capital

loans.name: Kan

texts.en:
Kan K., age 60, is married and has two children. He lives with his wife and children in Phnom Penh City. To make a living, he rents spare rooms of his house to the other people, earning approximately US $10 per day. This amount of income is the primary source of income of the family. The family is also assisted by the two children: one of them is a grocery seller, and another one works as a soldier to serve the country.

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, K. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, K. is seeking to increase his income. He is asking for a loan of US $500 to purchase construction materials to build more rent house for his customers. By doing so, he hopes he will be able to generate more income to raise a good standard of living for his family.

loans.use: buy construction materials

loans.name: Daigdigan

texts.en: Daigdigan M. G. is from the village of Jasaan, Misamis Oriental. She is 23 years old, is married, and has one school-aged child. Daigdigan owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting flowers for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Daigdigan joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. -

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz started to manage a variety store when she got married to Melquiades. She is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 from Kiva lenders in order to improve her business. She believes that by having a complete range of items to sell, more customers will come and buy.

Beatriz is already 38 years old and is a woman of strong determination, despite the disability of her leg. She is thankful that her husband helps her earn income by working in the field and by engaging in his poultry business. The couple has no children yet but it did not hinder them from keeping on growing and saving for their future children. Presently, the couple is residing in the distant village of Antagan 1st of Tumauini, Isabela.

Beatriz dreams of having a stable business in the future. Her variety store which she manages at present will hopefully grow and be expanded someday. She is very optimistic that, through her determination and with the perseverance of her husband, they will be able to uplift their life.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Suo

texts.en:
Suo J., 25, is a local pig-raiser, and is the good mother devoted to her one young child who is still not yet enrolled in school. Suo J. is married to Mr. Sok Thai, age 24, who is a construction worker in the village. The family usually generates their daily income of $7 each day to meet their family’s financial crisis.

Suo J.’s husband is facing difficulty with transportation to work. He needs to pay a lot of money to taxi drivers because he doesn’t have his own vehicle for traveling to work. Because of this, Suo J. requested a loan to add to her little savings in order to buy a used motorbike for her husband to drive to his workplace.

loans.use: To buy a used motorbike for her husband to drive to work

loans.name: Meoun

texts.en:
Meoun P., age 45, is married and has two children. She lives with her husband and children in Phnom Penh City. To make a living, she makes the wholesale of wooden beds, earning approximately US $4 per day. Her husband works as a soldier for the government, earning an income of US $4 per day.

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, P. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, P. is seeking to increase her income. She is asking for a loan of US $1000 to purchase more wooden beds and windows to resell. By doing so, she hopes she will be able to generate more income and save more money for her children's education.

loans.use: buy more wooden beds and windows

loans.name: Charlita

texts.en:
Charlita is a retailer of cell phone loads in their village at Barangay Antagan 1st of Tumauini, Isabela. She wants to borrow PHP 6,000 from Kiva lenders for her load-retailing business. Both SMART and GLOBE subscribers are being served by Charlita in their village, bringing easier communication for relatives, friends and lovers that are away from their loved ones.

Sometimes, due to other financial needs of her family, Charlita was not able to buy load wallets for the retailing of cell phone loads. Thus, she wants to borrow from Kiva lenders to maintain the business and someday be able to expand in other networks like Sun Cellular. She plans to utilize the entire loan for her business if her request is granted.

Charlita is already 47 years old. She is married to a farmer who also works as a house carpenter. They have four children namely: Ferdinand, the eldest, a high school graduate and already married; the same with their second child Ryan;  third is Romer, who has stopped studying; and lastly is Grave, their youngest, who is currently enrolled in third year high school. Charlita really wanted to send them to finish their schooling in college, but it is their own decision to stop in their studies. She is hoping that her youngest child will earn a degree in college to be able to have a much better future than what they have at present.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Porras

texts.en:
Porras E. is from the village of Jasaan, Misamis Oriental. She is 49 years old. Porras is married and has two grown children. To make a living, Porras raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling bananas in the local community. Porras has been engaged in her business for more than 19 years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2009, Porras joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Porras is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Porras from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Va

texts.en:
Va S., age 51, is married and has four children. She lives with her husband and children in Phnom Penh City. To make a living, she operates a business selling food (Chinese noodles) for breakfast, earning approximately $4 per day. Her husband is on the staff of a public water-supply department and has a reasonable to income to support his family. The family is also assisted by three of her children, who are employed at different workplaces in the city.

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, S. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, S. is seeking to increase her income. She is asking for a loan of $500 to purchase more ingredients to expand her food shop. By doing so, she hopes she will be able to generate more income and raise a good standard of living for her family.

loans.use: Buy more ingredients to expand the food shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To use as additional business capital

loans.name: Kak

texts.en:
Kak L. N., age 26, is a widow and has a school-aged child. She lives with her sister and her child in Phnom Penh City. To make a living, she works in a local garment factory, earning approximately US $3 per day. The family is also assisted by her sister who sells various kinds of fruit and grilled corns.

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, N. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, N. is seeking to increase her income. She is asking for a loan of US $200 to purchase more various kinds of fruit to expand her sister's business. By doing so, she hopes she will be able to generate more income and raise a good standard of living.

loans.use: buy more fruit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Business capital for her food sales business

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 39 years old. She is married to Abelardo Sta. A., who works as a factory worker abroad to provide his family with enough financial support. Because of life difficulties, the couple decided to sacrifice by being far from each other for about two to three years to sustain the needs of their children. They have two children, one of whom is in school. Their youngest will be entering school by the next school year, thus Teresita is really doing her best to maintain her general store.  

Wanting to develop and sustain her business, she decided to borrow a loan amounting to PHP 7,000 to have additional business capital. This will be very helpful for the sustainability of their daily needs.

loans.use: To finance her general store

loans.name: Navales

texts.en:
Navales R. is from the village of Jasaan, Misamis Oriental. She is 22 years old. Navales is married and has two infant children. To make a living, Navales grows crops, planting and harvesting flowers for sale. Navales has been in business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Navales joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Navales is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Navales from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further expand and improve the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business of growing and selling flowers

loans.name: Sarabusing

texts.en:
Sarabusing N. is from the village of Jasaan, Misamis Oriental. She is 58 years old. Sarabusing is married and has one adult child. To make a living, Sarabusing owns and operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling  bananas in the local community. Sarabusing has been in business for over 18 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Sarabusing joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sarabusing is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Sarabusing from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her food sales business

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Being a widow did not hinder Francisca to become successful in life. She is a business minded woman at her retiring age. She started her tailoring shop business since year 2003. She has four children who are already finished with their studies and she is very thankful that all of them now have their own jobs and businesses. She is living peacefully in the village of Calamagui 1st Ilagan, Isabela with her own expense. She enjoys her tailoring business and gives her satisfaction in life. 

Currently, Francisca has expanded a dress shop business in their village. Due to lack of capital, she is now requesting to avail a loan of to PHP8, 000. Aside from tailoring, Francisca also ventured into direct selling of FERN – C (vitamin C) in their village.  She hopes that her loan will make her become more progressive.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en:
Divorced with four children, Augustina is a 30-year-old businesswoman. She believes that hard work and dedication are a way of minimizing poverty, and, for that reason, she is very serious with her business. She trades in cassava and plantain. She has been trading for the past five years, and has since been very resourceful to her family. She treks to the farming communities in the eastern region and supplies to the market women at Agbobloshie. 

She wants to use the loan to buy a larger supply of cassava and plantain to serve her customers throughout the season, especially in the face of increasing prices due to the current food crisis in the country. She is a member of the trust group called Galilea. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral and provide support for themselves to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy a large stock of cassava and plantain

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 50 years old. She is a resident of Barangy Calamagui Ilagan, Isabela. She is happily living with her husband, Leonardo D., a traffic enforcer, and their three boys. Their eldest son is a soldier, the second operates a passenger tricycle and the third is studying in high school. Leonida hopes to provide for the school needs of her youngest so that he will be able to pursue his education up to college. In this regard, she is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 5,000, which will be used for the maintenance of the motor vehicle used in her transportation business. She hopes that Kiva lenders will allow her to be part of the Kiva loans. 

Wanting to have an extra income, Leonida also wants to venture into beauty service. According to her, instead of waiting for the daily boundary transport of PHP 200 in their house, she can give manicure/pedicure services to her neighbors. She is very positive that her plans will help her to have a better living.

loans.use: Transport vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Bana

texts.en:
Bana E. is from the village of Lagonglong, Misamis Oriental. She is 48 years old. Bana is married and has seven school-age children. To make a living, Bana owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Bana is just starting this business.

In 2009, Bana joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bana is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Bana from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further improve and expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products for resale at her store

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline J. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 35 years old. Evangeline is married and has four school-age children. To make a living, Evangeline raises livestock (pigs) for sale. Evangeline has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In 2006, Evangeline joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evangeline has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in a new business of buying and selling jewelriy in the local community. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Evangeline from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in a new business of buying and selling jewelry

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth P. is a 42-year old rice grower and at the sametime a mother of seven children. She is previously having  her 4th loan in CEVI and wishes to avail hopefully her 6th loan and be able to support the growth of her business.

She requested a loan of Php 11,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides and pay the laborers who  helped prepare the land.

She said, she likes the services of CEVI because its only 2% interest rate which she thinks very affordable to repay.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and payment for farm laborers

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.en:
Antoinette, 35, is married with two children who are currently in school. Antoinette sells groceries and kenkey. Kenkey, a very popular Ghanaian dish, is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and eaten with hot pepper and fried fish.

Antoinette will be using the loan to purchase maize, vegetable oil, vegetables and firewood, which are the major raw ingredients, in bulk. This will help reduce costs very significantly to enable her to raise more income to support her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy raw ingredients for making and selling kenkey (Ghanian dish)

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is thirty nine years old. She is divorced and has 2 children. They are all in school and doing very well. She has taken full responsibility for her two children since her husband left her. She is a trader who trades in used clothes, dry fish and polythene bags at kasoa new market. However, with small capital, she can barely buy more quantity to make good profit. She wants to use the loan therefore to buy more bales of used clothes that come with variety to meet the desire of her customers, dry fish and polythene bags so she can raise good income to support her children’s education. Florence would be appreciate for your support.

loans.use: To purchase stock.

loans.name: Nuriddin

texts.en: Vegetable sales are a flourishing business in Tajikistan for the simple reason that every home needs vegetables. Nuriddin has been selling fruits and vegetables in Dushanbe city for the past three years. Nuriddin began his own stall with his hard-earned savings as he had always wanted to be an entrepreneur. He began selling in “Ganj” market with very little stock to offer his clients. Slowly he began to increase the goods offered until he managed to get a permanent market stall. Currently his stall is his pride and joy with a zinc roof and ceramic tiles on the floor. Nuriddin is the father of three children who are in school. As any father, he is doing his best in order to ensure his children have the best future and to make them well-educated. Now, Nuriddin needs a loan of 5,000 Somoni in order to increase the range of his stock. He expresses his gratitude to everyone supporting him. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To increase the range of his vegetables

loans.name: Nazira

texts.en:
B. Nazira started a grocery business 7 years ago. She started off with few products, but her business has grown as she has many frequent clients. Nazira would like a loan of 6400 Somoni to buy merchandise so that she can offer a wider variety of products and so that her business can grow, as clients are always asking her for new things. Nazira and her family thank you very much for your support, which means that her business can grow and she can fulfill her goal of providing for her family.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Buy more foodstuffs to increase of the range of goods sold.

loans.name: Dela Cruz

texts.en:
Dela Cruz S. is from the village of Lagonglong, Misamis Oriental. She is 50 years old. Dela Cruz is separated from her spouse and has 4 adult children. To make a living Dela Cruz makes and sells specialty food products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Dela Cruz joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dela Cruz is requesting her first loan which she will use to purchase raw ingredients she needs to make her products. Dela Cruz plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note
To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients to make food to sell.

loans.name: Ilhom

texts.en:
S. Ilhom is a talented entrepreneur with a successful business selling teenagers' footwear in the market. He is married with two children. Ilhom started his business 10 years ago out of a desire to earn a living and meet people's clothing needs. He sells footwear that are both popular and affordable, which helps to ensure a strong demand for his products. Ilhom is a serious business-owner who wants his business to be the best it can be while continuing to grow and be profitable.

Ilhom has requested a loan of $1050 to purchase new inventory. The change of seasons makes this a busy time of year for business-owners like Ilhom. This loan will help him keep a good supply of inventory on hand so he can meet customer demand and make a good profit.

loans.use: To purchase new footwear to sell.

loans.name: Tansukoy

texts.en:
For the last four years, Tansukoy has dedicated herself to selling clothing in the market. She began her business selling small quantities of her products, but through the years she has gone on to acquire greater quantities for sale.

Tansukoy began her business due to the need her family found itself in for a long time. Her husband's income did not suffice to cover the household expenses, which is why she decided to invest in this business. As the years went by, two children were born, and her responsibility blossomed, since it was necessary to work harder to maintain her humble home.

Currently Tansukoy requests 5000 Somoni in order to re-stock her clothing. She counts on your help and thanks all of you for your support.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase clothing to sell.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen A. is 43 years old and a rice grower. She has one child. She said that her only dream is to be successsful in her business to be able to provide for the needs of her family. Currently, she is actively attending the cluster meetings in CEVI, and she is happy doing it because she learns a lot from other entrepreneurs who also obtained CEVI's services. 

She would like to request a loan of PHP 15,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. she will use the loan to buy quality rice seeds, pesticides, fertilizers and provide payment to the laborers. 

Now that she is in her seventh loan in CEVI, she wished to obtain more of its services. She likes CEVI so much because it has only 2% interest rate, which she thinks is very affordable to repay.

loans.use: To buy quality rice seeds, pesticides, fertilizers and provide payment to laborers

loans.name: Mariana

texts.en: Mariama is forty years old. She is a wife and mother of five children who are currently in school. She is a retailer of charcoal at her local community. Charcoal is a very popular source of energy for cooking in almost all the traditional Ghanaian homes. Mariama obtains her supply of charcoal from the villages and retail them to her customers. She wants to use the loan to buy more supply of charcoal to increase her stock and believes she would be able to make better income to support her family.

loans.use: To buy more supply of charcoal

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is 20 years old. He is single and independent. Eric is a dealer in electrical and electronic parts like speakers, transistors, transformers, screwdrivers, wires, television cords, antennas, etc. He also sells groceries along with his electrical business. He buys his supplies from importers at wholesale prices and sells them to his customers at retail prices. 

He requests for a loan to enable him to procure an increased stock of electrical and electronic parts and also to buy more groceries to sell. He hopes to increase his savings to expand both his electrical and grocery shops. Eric is a young man full of dreams and he believes that with perseverance, hard work and your support, he will go far.

loans.use: To increase his stock of electrical goods

loans.name: Cagumbay

texts.en:
Cagumbay H. is from the village of Tinagaan, Salay Misamis Oriental. She is 39 years old. Cagumbay is married and has three school-age children. To make a living, Cagumbay owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Cagumbay has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Cagumbay joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cagumbay has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Cagumbay is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her store's product offering. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Cagumbay from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her store's product offering

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel F. is 56-years old farmer in Trento, Agusan del Sur. He is a father of only one child and dreamed of having more farms in the future to support his family. Currently, he has three hectares and all he wanted to do is make to flourish and  grow.

He owuld like to ask aloan of Php 15,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. He will use the loan to buy fertilizers and other farming needs.

He likes CEVI services so much. Infact, he is now on his 7th loan. He likes CEVI because it has only 2% interest rate which is very low and very affordable to repay.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farming needs

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua, 54 years old, is married with four children. She is a petty trader who supplies plantains to local food vendors and restaurant operators. With good customer relations, she has many customers. However, she buys her supplies on credit at a relatively high price for lack of adequate working capital. 

With this loan, she wants to purchase bulk plantains to serve her customers. Akua believes in her ability to improve her income when she receives the loan to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To buy plantains in bulk for resale

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 42 years old and a trader. She is married with five children. Elizabeth owns and operates a grocery store, selling items like rice, canned foods and drinks, assorted cooking oil, assorted biscuits, candies, evaporated milk, etc. She wants to use the loan to buy cartons of evaporated milk, bags of rice, canned foods and drinks and cooking oil to increase her stock of goods. With increased stock of a different variety, she hopes to make more income to provide for the educational needs of her children.

loans.use: To increase the stock of goods at her store

loans.name: Cagumbay

texts.en:
Cagumbay E. is from the village of Tinagaan, Salay Misamis Oriental. She is 48 years old. Cagumbay is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Cagumbay owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Cagumbay has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Cagumbay joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cagumbay has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Cagumbay is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her store's product offering. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Cagumbay from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further improve and expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Fati

texts.en: Fati is 35 years old. She is a wife and mother of four children who are currently in school. She is a food vendor and sells kenkey. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and eaten with hot peppers and fried fish. She has many customers since many Ghanaians enjoy kenkey as breakfast, lunch and supper. She wants to use the loan to buy more ingredients like bags of maize, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to increase her income to support her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy raw ingredients for making kenkey (Ghanian dish)

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha is 30 years old. She is married and has three children, two girls and a boy, who are in primary school at the moment. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town. She is a trader. She trades in utensils, plastics, plates, bathroom slippers and cosmetics. She buys her stock from the city's central market, where prices are affordable and sells to her customers. She has her stall just in front of her house. Martha has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and give her children the best education.

loans.use: To buy goods in bulk for resale

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en: Leticia is 39 years old. She is married with a child who is currently in school. She lives with her husband and child in a rented apartment in her community. Leticia trades in soft drinks like Coca Cola, Fanta, Sprite, Pepsi, etc. She buys the drinks from wholesale points and sells them to her customers. She has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to buy drinks in bulk to expand her business. She desires to give her child a quality education.

loans.use: To buy more soft drinks for resale

loans.name: Echalico

texts.en:
Echalico V. is from the village of Tinagaan, Salay Misamis Oriental. She is 31 years old. Echalico is married and has two school-age children. To make a living, Echalico owns and operates a specialized retail store where she buys and sells charcoal made of coco shells in the local community. Echalico is just starting this business.

In 2009, Echalico joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Echalico has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand her store's product offering. Echalico is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Echalico from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further improve and expand the business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her store

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is a forty-two-year-old woman who is married with three children who are currently in school.

Comfort is a food vendor and sells banku. Banku a local Ghanaian dish prepared from milled maize grains and it is taken with hot pepper or soup. It is believe to be a native food for the Ewe tribe in Ghana but other tribes enjoy it too. Comfort has many customers since it is enjoyed by many Ghanaian as breakfast, lunch and supper.

Comfort wants to use the loan to buy more ingredients like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to raise more income to support her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials for making banku

loans.name: Barikisu

texts.en: Barikisu is a forty-three year old business woman. She is wife and mother of four children. Currently two of her children are in school and the other two are working. She trades in native sandals, kente, smocks, stools, beads etc. these items are mostly used by chiefs in Ghana. She wants to use the loan to purchase bulk kente, smocks, royal stools,etc. She hopes to use part of her profit to provide her children with quality education.

loans.use: To buy kente, smocks, native sandals.

loans.name: Dumaloan

texts.en: Dumaloan S. is from the village of Tinagaan, Salay, Misamis Oriental. She is 36 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Dumaloan owns and operates a specialized retail store, primarily buying and selling bananas in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Dumaloan joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding her business. Dumaloan is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is thirty-seven years old. She is married and has three children who are currently in school.

Joyce is a dealer in hardware like assorted paint, nails, roofing sheets, hammers, PVC pipes, etc. She buys her supplies from importers in Accra at wholesale prices and sells to her customers at retail prices. She requests the loan to enable her to procure an increased stock of paints, nails, hammers, etc. to accelerate her business progress.

With the loan, Joyce hopes to increase her savings and to expand her business to include the sale of cement. She would be very grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her store

loans.name: Mejos

texts.en: Mejos M. is from the village of Tinagaan, Salay, Misamis Oriental. She is 32 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Mejos owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. She is just starting this business. In 2009, Mejos joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: John Mugo

texts.en:
John C. is 34-years-old, married to Mary and they have two children. He has been in the vehicle repairs business for the past 15 years now. His business is located along Eldoret- kisumu highway road and his clients include farmers and residences within Eldoret Town.

John was a founder of a group and he was among the first clients of KADET.With the loan he is taking from KADET he intends to buy a cylinder and pistons.

In future he wants to grow his business to a large manufacturing shop and to diversify by opening another branch at Kapsabet town 62 km from Eldoret Town.



About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to  relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: Purchasing spare parts which include pistons.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en: Benjamin is 48 years old. He is married with three children, who are currently in school. Benjamin is a taxi driver; he has been driving for the past 12 years. Taxi driving has been his major occupation and the main source of livelihood for his family. He picks passengers up from the local lorry station and drives to the nearby towns at a transport fare of 50pesewas (0.5 cedis) per head. He requests a loan to enable him to maintain his taxi so he can make daily income to support his family and pay his kids' school fees.

loans.use: To buy an engine

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary N. is married to Luke N. and they are blessed with two children, Joel and Monicah. Mary is 53 and runs a nursery school in Chaani, Kiembeni. She has been operating the school for a year and has 41 pupils so far. The location of her school is strategic and she hopes to improve in recruitment of new children with time.

This will mark Mary's first borrowing from KADET and with the money, she plans to buy desks, tables and office stationery for her pupils. 

She says that it is her passion to work with children and she hopes to one day own a modern schooling facility in the locality.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: Buying desks, tables and office stationery

loans.name: Lydiah

texts.en:
Lydiah K. is a single mother of two grown-up children, Muthoni and Mwangi. She is 49 and in the business of poultry-keeping. She has been a poultry farmer for two years.

Lydiah learned about KADET through a marketing activity by the officers and is glad to be accessing her first KADET loan. With the money, she plans to buy chicken feed and chicken drugs and to pay for the labor of an employee tending to the chickens. Lydiah supplements her income through rental houses she owns in Miritini and is also a dealer in scrap metals.

Her dream is to one day be able to rear a thousand chicken or more.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to  relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: Buying chicken feed and chicken drugs and to pay for labor

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha is twenty-six years old. She recently got married.  She sells fresh rice and has been doing this business for the past four years. She obtains her supply of rice from wholesalers and retails it to her customers who are mostly food vendors. She wants to use her loan to buy bulk quantities of rice to cater for the demands of her customers. She wants to use the proceeds from her operation to build a small stall to start selling groceries.

loans.use: To buy rice for resale

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius K. is 44 years old and is a married father of three children. He lives with his family in Mikindani, a town in the coastal province of Kenya. Julius runs an electrical and hardware shop in the same area and has been able to serve his customers for the last two years.

He was introduced to KADET by a friend who is also a client and this will be his first time borrowing from KADET to finance his business. He plans to buy square metal bars for construction and to also purchase a variety of hardware materials for the hardware business. His business is centrally located and being the only hardware in the area, Julius has been able to have many customers.

He hopes to open an even bigger hardware and electrical shop and to start supplying the goods wholesale.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: Buying  square metal bars for construction and to also purchase a variety of hardware materials

loans.name: Cañete

texts.en:
Cañete R. is from the village of Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 33 years old. Cañete is married and has 3 children. To make a living, Cañete owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. Cañete has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Cañete joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cañete has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand product offering. Cañete is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used in the same way. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Cañete from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is thirty seven year old woman. She is divorced and has two children, one in junior high school and the other just completed senior high and is waiting to enter the university. She is a food vendor and sells banku. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains cooked and taken with hot pepper or soup. She has many customers since it is enjoyed by many customers as breakfast, lunch and supper. She wants to use the loan to buy more ingredients like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to raise increased income to support her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy raw materials.

loans.name: Ngoja Mwero

texts.en:
N. Mwero N. is 30 years old and a married father of one. He lives with his family in Likoni but he operates a rented stall in Mombasa's Kongowea market. He sells bedding, curtains, and towels for a living. He has been in the business for the last four years.

N. was introduced to KADET by an officer during a field marketing activity and is now glad to be accessing his first loan. With the money he plans to purchase more curtains, bedsheets, and towels for his stall.

He plans to move from the rented store and open his own permanent store soon. He also hopes to diversify his business and open a cafe to supplement his current income.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: Purchasing curtains, bedsheets and towels for resale

loans.name: Lawrencia

texts.en:
Lawrencia is a mother of two children, who are currently in school. She is twenty-nine years old and married. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in their community. She is a petty trader. She sells fresh and smoked fish in her community. She supplies fish to retailers and food vendors.

Lawrencia buys cartons of fresh fish from big cold stores in the city. She has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy fish in bulk. She desires to expand her business, increase her profits, and to give her children the best of education.

loans.use: To buy fish in bulk

loans.name: Gonzales , Jr

texts.en:
Gonzales Jr B. is from the village of Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 23 years old. Gonzales Jr is single. To make a living, Gonzales Jr owns and operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcycle services to local community members. Gonzales Jr has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Gonzales Jr joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gonzales Jr is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Gonzales Jr from HSPFI.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a thirty-three year old local producer of polythene (rubber) bags. He is married with a child who is currently in school. Joseph is a young man with a vision to serve humanity with his talent and skills. He dreams of a well established company of his own which produces bulk polythene bags to serve all kinds of purposes. He produces and supplies to food vendors, market sellers and super markets operators to wrap bought items for their customers. Joseph is constrained by capital to produce on large scale to meet the demands of his customers. He wants to use the loan to buy large quantities of rubbers and another machine to facilitate his production to meet demand.

loans.use: To buy raw materials.

loans.name: Helena

texts.en: Helena is thirty three years old. She is married with a child. She lives with her family in their community. Helena is a  hair dresser. She has three apprentices who are currently under training. Aside her hairdressing business she also sells hair products like pomades, shampoos and various kinds of weavons. Helena buys her working materials such as artificial hair, shampoo, pomade, lotion, etc. from the city central market. She has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to buy materials in bulk to be able to render quality services to her cherished clients. Helena aspires to expand her business and use proceeds to improve upon her standard of living

loans.use: To buy Hair products.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses K. is 44 years old and a married father of four children. He lives in Changamwe, in coast province. Moses owns one motorbike which he uses for passenger service. He has been in business for the last two years.

This marks Moses' first borrowing from KADET and he plans to top up the money with his own savings and purchase a new motorbike.

Moses intends to expand his transport business by acquiring a nissan matatu in future.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to  relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: Purchase a new motorbike

loans.name: Gunaron

texts.en:
Gunaron V. is from the village of Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 54 years old. Gunaron is married and has 3 children. To make a living, Gunaron owns and operates a business selling primary goods to local community members. Gunaron has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for this activity.

In 2009, Gunaron joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gunaron is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Gunaron from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Pagaran

texts.en:
Pagaran B. is from the village of Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 28 years old. Pagaran is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Pagaran owns and operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcycle services to local community members. Pagaran has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Pagaran joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pagaran is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Pagaran from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson M. is a 35-year-old married father of one child. He lives with his family in Kongowea, Mombasa. He has been running a shoe selling stall in the Kongowea market for the last four years.

This Kenyan shillings loan in the amount of 20,000 marks Benson's first time borrowing from KADET, and with it he plans to make some repairs and refurbishments on the shoes he sells and also plans to increase the stock of shoes in his shop.

Benson hopes to expand his current shoe stall and to later open an additional stall in the same market to maximize his income.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: buying more materials for repairs and refurbishments of shoes

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es: Reina Isabel M. D. H. resiD. en Cojutepeque municipio del departamento D. Ahuachapán. Reina tiene 38 años D. edad, vive con su esposo Marco quien trabaja como motorista generando 200$ mensuales los cuales aporta a su casa para los gastos D. su familia, también viven con ellos, sus dos hijos D. 15 y 8 años D. edad  estudiantes. Reina ayuda a su esposo, ella posee un negocio D. venta D. ropa hace diez años; la mayoría D. sus ventas las hace D. forma ambulante ya que va a ofrecer todos sus productos en colonias y cantones D. todo Cojutepeque y sus alrededores, el destino del crédito que solicita en esta oportunidad Reina es para surtir su negocio comprando ropa al por mayor, la cual le dejara mayores márgenes D. ganancia.
texts.en:
Reina Isabel M. D. H. lives in Cojutepeque, municipality in the department of Ahuachapán. Reina is 38 years old, she lives with her husband Marco who works as a motorist earning 200$ monthly which are used for the family expenses. They have two children, 15 and 8, who live with them and go to school. Reina helps her husband with a clothing business she has owned for ten years. Most of her sales are by traveling to all the neighborhoods in Cojutepeque and its surroundings. The loan that Reina is now requesting will be used to purchase wholesale clothing, which will give her better profit margins.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wholesale clothing

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis M. is 29 and a married father of two children, aged nine and seven. He lives with his family in Shimanzi town in the coast province of Kenya, and he has been in the business of selling 'Tiens' products for the last five years. He also offers taxi service in the evening as a way to supplement his income.

Francis has good marketing skills through word of mouth and has been able to build a large network of 'Tiens' products and thus earns a lot of commission.

He came to learn about KADET through a friend who is a client and this will mark his first time borrowing. He plans to purchase 'Tiens' products and also use some money for transport to market his products.

He has a drive to expand and diversify his business and in future hopes to own a pharmacy.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To purchase 'Tiens' products and for transport to market the products

loans.name: Tinah

texts.en:
Tinah G. is 37 years old, and a single mother of one child. She lives with her daughter Joyce in Mikindani, Mombasa. Tinah is a food vendor in the busy Kongowea market and has been able to attract many customers in the area. She has been in the business for 10 years. 

She is accessing her second loan from KADET and she plans to improve her hotel's look by buying furniture, painting the hotel and by also purchasing a microwave. This way she will be able to maintain her customers and attract more, thus improving her earnings.

Tinah hopes to run a hotel in Mombasa's City centre in future.  

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to  relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To buy furniture, paint the hotel and also purchase a microwave.

loans.name: Ana Elizabeth

texts.es: Ana Elizabeth M. D. M. vive en Colon municipio del departamento D. La Libertad. Ana tienen 34 años D. edad, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos aun menores D. edad. Ana Elizabeth posee gran experiencia en belleza con 19 años trabajando D. esta profesión D. cosmetóloga, pero  no fue hasta hace cinco años que se embarco a manejar su propio negocio, el cual ahora atienD.; en el salón D. Ana se ofrece todos los servicios básicos como corte D. cabello, tintes para cabello, tratamientos entre otros, pero en esta oportunidad Ana está solicitando un crédito, ya que desea invertir en productos para vender en su salón , los cuales le ayudaran a ella a lograr ganancias extras y seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Ana Elizabeth M. D. M. lives in Colon, municipality in the department of La Libertad. Ana is 34 years old, lives with her husband and two young children. Ana Elizabeth has a lot of experience in the beauty business having worked as a cosmetologist for 19 years. But it wasn’t until five years ago that she started her own beauty salon. Ana’s salon offers all the basic services such as hair cut, color, and treatments. Ana is now requesting a loan to buy products to sell in her salon, which will help her get additional earnings to continue to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products for her beauty salon

loans.name: Caren Akinyi

texts.en:
Caren Akinyi is 37 years old, married to Patrick and they have five children. Her animal feed business is located at Racecourse in Langas Estate in Eldoret Town. She has been in the animal feed business for the past eight years now.
