Caren was introduced to KADET by an existing client and with the loan she has applied for she intends to add more stock, which includes wheat, maize and cotton cake.

In the future she intends to open a wholesale business of selling animal feed and to be able to educate her children at higher institutions of learning.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To add animal feed stock.

loans.name: Amanda Yanira

texts.es: Amanda Yanira M. R. reside en Tacuba en el departamento de Ahuachapán, tiene 24 años de edad, vive con su esposo Carlos de 20 años edad quien trabaja como agricultor. El sueño de esta joven pareja es fortalecer los ingresos de su negocio,  es un molino que da sus servicios en la zona donde la afluencia de clientes es mucha ya que varios poseen negocios de tortillería o pupuserias entonces necesitan de un molino, Amanda pasa al frente de su negocio todo el día, posee tres años de experiencia. Ahora Amanda solicita este crédito para invertir en su negocio, de esta manera podrá solidificarlo y obtener mayores ingresos que serán de gran utilidad para ellos y su bebé que viene en camino.
texts.en:
Amanda Yanira Monteroso R. lives in Tacuba in the district of Ahuachapán. She is 24 years old and lives with her husband Carlos, who is 20 years old and works as a farmer. This young couples' dream is to strengthen the income of their business. Currently, she provides milling services for her customers. She works in an area where many people have tortillerías and/or pupuserías, so they need someone to mill their grains. Amanda works every day and has three years of experience. Now, Amanda is asking for this loan so she can invest in her business so that she will be able to establish it better and obtain the higher profits that will be of great use both for them and their baby who is on its way.

Translated from Spanish by Colleen Godfrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Ruth Avoga

texts.en:
Ruth Avoga H. is 28 years old, married to Francis Mugodo, and together they have two little children. Her clothing business is located within Eldoret Town in West Market. She has been in the clothing business for the past two years now.

Ruth was introduced to KADET by a group member and with the loan she has applied for she intends to add stock which includes clothing for children and adults. 

In the future she intends to diversify to a bigger store for her clothing business and also get more money to buy a plot. She would like to use the extra profits to build a residential house for her family and increase her income base so that she can educate her children.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To add more clothes stock for both children and adults.

loans.name: Marie Claire

texts.en:
Greetings from Kigali-Rwanda. U. Marie claire is 40 years old, married, and has been a paint seller since 2004.

Marie claire is requesting her first loan from Vision Finance Company. With this loan, she plans to expand her business through purchasing more jerry cans of paint in order to earn more profits than before.

By earning more profit from the requested loan, Marie claire hopes to help people by creating jobs for them and to help her husband to build their own house.

Through accessing this new loan, Marie claire has hope for the future.

loans.use: To purchase more jerry cans of paint

loans.name: Rose Akinyi

texts.en:
Rose A. is 29 years old, married to Carreh A. Owour who is also a businessman and both are blessed with two children aged between one and half years to nine years old. Her animal feed shop is located in the surburb of Langas Estate along Kisumu Eldoret highway. She has been in this animals feeds sale business for the past eight years now.

Rose was introduced to KADET by a group member and with the loan she is taking she intends to add more animal feeds as stock for her business. 

In future she intends to grow her business to a wholesale and also improve her living standards for her family by educating her children.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to  relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: Adding more animal feed for her animal feeds shop.

loans.name: Ulices

texts.en:
Ulices is a member of the Force and Power village bank. He is 42 years-old and has three children who are 22, 15, and 9 years-old. All three of his children go to the local public school. 
Ulices is from Huancayo where he went to school until he dropped out because he had to work more hours in order to support his family. He works as a driver  in his van and also owns a space in the market that he rents out. 

Ulices needs a loan of 1,000 soles to replace some parts in his van. His dream is to keep working to give the best to his children and maybe buy another van

loans.use: To replace some parts for her van

loans.name: Blanca Julia

texts.es: Blanca Julia L. de 60 años de edad vive en Soyapango municipio del departamento de San Salvador. Blanca es madre soltera de una sola niña. A Blanca se le ha hecho muy difícil salir adelante maneja un inventario muy mínimo en su negocio, pero piensa que ahora es la oportunidad para crecer con su tienda ya que donde vive no hay competencia de otro negocio y todos sus vecinos llegan a su tienda es por eso que solicita un crédito para hacer crecer su negocio surtiéndolo de muchos productos de los cuales no posee.

loans.use: Surtir su negocio

loans.name: Mariana Luz

texts.es: Mariana Luz C. D. G. D. 43 años D. edad vive en Soyapango municipio  del departamento D. San Salvador. Mariana vive con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos. Mariana y su esposo se dedican a la carpintería, poseen un negocio hace 10 años donD. ofrecen variedad D. productos en madera, manejan un promedio D. ventas D. 300$ mensuales. El  deseo D. Mariana es ofertar D. sus productos a tiendas D. electrodomésticos, para poder obtener mayores ingresos, es por eso que solita este crédito ya que desea invertirlo compra D. materia prima para aumentar su producción.
texts.en:
Mariana Luz C. D. G., 43, lives in the Soyapango municipality in the San Salvador department. Mariana lives with her husband and their four children. Mariana and her husband have had a carpentry business for ten years. They offer a variety of wood products. Their average monthly sales are $300. Mariana wants to offer her products in domestic appliance stores. This way she will increase her earnings. That is why she is asking for a loan to buy raw material to increase her production.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw materials

loans.name: Felicita

texts.en:
Felicita is a member of the Force and Power village bank. She is 44 years-old and has three children who are 23, 22, and 16 years-old.  

Felicita owns a beauty salon where she works in the afternoons. Also, Felicita has a conveniece store at home where she sells goods in the mornings with her children's help. 

Felicita needs a loan of 1,400 soles to buy electric clippers for cutting hair and a vaporizer for skin care. Her dream is to open another hair salon in a more commercial zone and to continue growing her current business.

loans.use: To buy electric clippers for cutting hair and a vaporizer for skin care

loans.name: Gema

texts.en:
Gema P. is from the village of Brgy. 3, Talakag Bukidnon. She is 27 years old, married, with 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Gema wants to own and operate a business venture in the retail sector, selling everyday products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Gema is just starting this business. As soon as this loan be disbursed, she will then buy stock to sell.

In 2009, Gema joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gema is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Gema from HSPFI. She plans to use the revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell.

loans.name: Tania

texts.es: Tania tiene 37 años de edad, es madre soltera de 3 hijos y trabaja muy duro para salir adelante. Desde hace 6 años se dedica a la venta de comida, vende desayunos y almuerzos, los cueles complementa con la venta de bebidas gasificadas. Este negocio lo realiza en su casa, en un espacio que implementó con algunas mesas y sillas, y afortunadamente cuenta con el apoyo de su hija mayor, quien le ayuda en la preparación de la comida y atención de los clientes. A Tania le gusta mucho su trabajo porque le hace sentir útil y se mantiene ocupada, además le es muy rentable porque se encuentra ubicada en una zona clave (paradero de carros de trasporte público) por donde transitan muchas personas y tiene a varios transportistas como comensales regulares. Para un futuro cercano, Tania quiere ampliar su negocio y constituir su propio restaurante. Este es su segundo préstamos con MFP y está muy contenta de ser parte de un banco comunal porque todos sus compañeros y compañeras son coordinados y muy responsables con sus pagos. Con el dinero que viene solicitando mandará a construir un local adecuado para continuar vendiendo su comida, pero con mayor comodidad.
texts.en:
Tania, 37, is a single mother with three children. She works very hard to get ahead. She has been selling food for six years. She sells breakfast and lunch, which she sells with carbonated drinks. The business is in a space in her house, which is set up with some tables and chairs. Fortunately, her oldest daughter helps her prepare the food and wait on the customers. Tania really likes her work because she feels useful, and she keeps busy. Also, it is very profitable for her because she is in a key area (final stop for public transportation cars). Lots of people travel there and various drivers are regular customers. In the near future Tania would like to expand her business and make her own restaurant. This is her second loan with MFP. She is very happy to be part of a community bank because all of her colleagues work well together, and they are very responsible with their payments. She will use the money she is asking for to build an adequate location to sell her food more comfortably.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a place for her business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es: Ruth tiene 24 años, es madre de una niña de 5 añitos que ya empezó con sus estudios iniciales, también vive junto a su pareja, quien se dedica al cultivo de palmitos. Desde hace un año es propietaria de un motocarro, para el que contrata una persona que lo maneje y realice transporte de pasajeros, en especial durante las horas punta (mayor demanda), que son de 6 a 10 de la mañana y 4 de la tarde a 8 de la noche. Ruth está contenta con su negocio porque las ganancias le permiten solventar los gastos diarios de la familia. La rentabilidad de su negocio es debido a que por su zona no tiene mucha competencia, pues sólo hay otros 2 motocarros, por lo que sus ganancias son muy buenas. Este es su 3er préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta de trabajar con su grupo es que todos son personas solidarias y cuando hay un problema todos colaboran para solucionarlo. Con el dinero que solicita comprará un motor nuevo para su motocarro, el cual le costará 500 soles. Otros 200 soles, invertirá en la compra de ropa para venderla entre sus vecinos y con lo restante adquirirá materiales de construcción para mejorar los ambientes de su casa.
texts.en:
Ruth, 24, has a 5 year old daughter who has started school. She lives with her husband who grows palmettos trees. She has owned a “motocarro” (three wheeled motorized cart) for a year. She pays someone to drive it and transport passengers, especially during the hours of greatest demand. These are from six to ten in the morning and from four until eight in the evening. Ruth is happy with the business because the income allows her to pay the family’s daily expenses. The business’ profitability is due to the fact that there is not much competition in the area. There are only two other motocarros, so her earnings are very good. This is her third loan with MFP. What she likes about working with her group is that all of the members are supportive. When there is a problem, they collaborate on solving it. With the money she is asking for she will buy clothes to sell to her neighbors. With the rest she will buy construction materials to improve the atmosphere of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a new motor for her motorcycle

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: Rocío tiene 34 años, es madre de 3 hijos, siendo 2 de ellos estudiantes y el mayor acaba de culminar sus estudios secundarios y por el momento la apoya en su negocio. Su esposo es albañil y todos viven en su casa propia. Hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y productos comestibles en un pequeño ambiente al frente de su casa. Adicionalmente, y con lo que obtiene mayores ganancias, vende verduras regionales a otros lugares fuera de su ciudad. El comercio es una actividad que le agrada mucho a Rocío porque puede conocer a mucha gente, a quienes les brinda un trato amable al momento de vender sus productos, pero sobre todo, le agrada ver que día a día sigue progresando, pues gracias a este negocio y a su carisma al atender cuenta con una gran clientela y tiene buenos ingresos diarios. Para más adelante, Rocío quiere incursionar en el negocio de la distribución, al por mayor, de bebidas gaseosas. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que está muy entusiasmada de trabajar con su banco comunal porque ha notado que son personas responsables. Con el dinero que solicita comprará abarrotes y productos comestibles de primera necesidad, haciendo un gasto de 200 soles, con el resto, adquirirá verduras para llevarlas a vender a otros lugares.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Milka

texts.es:
Milka tiene 25 años, es soltera, vive con sus padres y sus 2 hermanos. Su actividad diaria es la venta de bebidas (gaseosas y cervezas), negocio que lo tiene en su propia casa y logra que Milka salga adelante. Este trabajo lo viene realizando desde hace 3 años, a razón de encontrarse en una zona muy concurrida y cerca de un lugar turístico, donde acuden personas de todo lugar y debido al calor de la región consumen frecuentemente de las bebidas que ella ofrece. A Milka le gusta su trabajo porque por medio del mismo conoce a muchas personas con quienes mantiene amenas conversaciones, además que con las ganancias que le genera este negocio puede solventar sus estudios profesionales. 

Este es su 3er préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta de trabajar con su grupo es que todos demuestran responsabilidad, por lo que hay confianza y unión. Con el dinero que Milka viene solicitando comprará sillas, mesas y más bebidas para su negocio.
texts.en:
Milka is 25, single, and she lives with her parents and two siblings. Her daily work is selling drinks (soft drinks and beer). She has the business in her own house, and it enables Milka to get ahead. She has been doing this work for three years. She is located in a busy area and near a tourist place. People from all over frequently buy her drinks due to the regional heat. Milka likes her work because she gets to know a lot of people and have friendly conversations with them. Also, she is able to pay for her professional studies with the income generated from this business. This is her third loan with MFP. What she likes about working with her group is that they all demonstrate responsibility, which has led to confidence and unity. Milka will use the money she is asking for to buy chairs, tables, and more drinks for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy furniture for her business and increase merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 38 años, es madre de 3 hijos que cursan estudios técnicos, vive con su pareja, quien se dedica trabajar con madera. Desde hace 4 años ella se dedica a la venta de perfumes, cosméticos y joyas de varias líneas de belleza. Estos productos son muy demandados por las personas que viven en su zona, por lo que ella los vende al crédito para cobrar cada día durante la semana, según acuerda con cada uno de sus clientes en particular. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es aprender a dar cada día un mejor trato mejor a sus clientes y le es rentable porque tiene pedidos regulares cada mes. Para el futuro, María quiere tener una tienda de ropa muy grande y con mucha mercadería qué ofrecer. Este es su 7mo préstamo con MFP, ella nos cuenta que le gusta su banco comunal porque es muy agradable trabajar en equipo, a lo que ya se ha acostumbrado y sobre todo, existe mucho compañerismo y responsabilidad en todos sus compañeros. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprara más productos de belleza y una vitrina para exhibir y proteger a sus productos.
texts.en:
María, 38, is the mother of 3 children who are in technical schools. She lives with her spouse who is a woodworker. For 4 years she has sold perfumes, cosmetics and jewelry from various beauty product lines. These products are much in demand by the people who live in her area, since she sells to them on credit so she can be earning every day of the week, according to the particular agreement she has with each client. What she enjoys about her work is learning how to give her customers the very best treatment every day, and this is profitable because she receives regular orders every month. For the future, María would like to have a large clothing shop with lots of merchandise on offer. This is her seventh loan through MFP, she tells us that she likes her communal bank because it is so agreeable to work in a team, which she is already accustomed to, and above all because there is a lot of companionship and sense of responsibility among all her teammates. With the money she is requesting today, she will buy more beauty products as well as a display case to display and protect her products.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Additional merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: Luz Marina tiene 41 años, es soltera y madre de 4 hijos, los cuales viven lejos, pero le brindan apoyo desde donde están. Ella es profesora del nivel primario y trabaja desde hace 28 años en una institución educativa. Sin embargo, no es la única actividad a la que se dedica, pues ya que al vivir sola, decidió alquilar las habitaciones vacías que tiene en su casa (hace 8 meses) y también vende cosméticos y ropa desde hace 10 años. Estos productos que los lleva a vender por diferentes lugares durante sus ratos libres y le va muy bien. Lo que le gusta de su labor es sentirse ocupada y olvidarse que está sola, además le es rentable porque sus ingresos son fijos. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque ha notado que existe compañerismo y mucha responsabilidad por parte de todos. Con el dinero que está solicitando comprará más productos de belleza y prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
Luz Marina, 41, is a single mother of 4 children who live far away but who send help from where they are. She is a primary school teacher and has been working in an educational institution for 28 years. This, however, is not her only activity, because since she has been living alone, she decided to rent out the empty rooms in her house (for the last 8 months) and she has also been selling cosmetics and clothing for 10 years. During her free time, she brings these products to various places to sell and it has gone very well. What she likes about her work is keeping occupied and forgetting that she is alone, as well as the profit because she is on a fixed income. This is the first time that she has taken a loan through MFP. She enjoys working with her communal bank because she has found companionship and responsibility among all the members. With the money she is requesting, she will buy more beauty products and garments.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Additional merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 40 year old woman who is married with five children aged between 22 and 28 years. None of her children go to school. She resides in a three room house where she stays with four people. Mariam doesn’t take care of any additional family members. There is no electricity or piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day.

She resides and works in a semi-urban area. She doesn’t incur any extra transport costs, as she buys from her place of work. She buys her bananas from delivery vans, and sells to 30 customers a day, both retail and wholesale.  Mariam works seven days a week. Her major monthly expenses include rent for her business and residence plus medication costs. She has been in this business for the last ten years. Mariam has been with MCDT for five years and is now servicing her tenth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more bananas for resale. Mariam aspires to see her business grow bigger, as well as own a permanent business premise and home.

loans.use: To buy more bananas for resale.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.es: Lilia tiene 57 años de edad, vive con su esposo y su hija quien le apoya en todo. La casa donde habitan es propia. Lilia es una mujer muy trabajadora, durante las mañanas, desde hace 9 años, labora como empleada doméstica para una familia. Por las tardes se dedica a la venta de bebidas (cervezas y gaseosas), actividad que viene realizando desde hace 12 años atrás en un espacio pequeño al frente de su casa. A Lilia le gusta mucho su trabajo de la venta de bebidas porque se mantiene activa, además le es muy rentable porque vende todos los productos que compra cada mes. Aunque no cuenta con un local apropiado, sus clientes no dejan de consumir sus bebidas, pues ella les brinda un muy buen trato, y ellos se sienten muy satisfechos por esa acogida que les brinda. Este es su 8vo préstamo con MFP y lo que más le gusta de su banco comunal son sus compañeros, pues todos son personas responsables con sus pagos y no son egoístas. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará más cervezas y gaseosas, además mandará a refaccionar algunas estructuras de su casa.
texts.en:
Lilia, 57, lives with her husband and her daughter who helps her in everything. The house where they live belongs to them. Lilia is a hard-working woman. For 9 years she has worked in the mornings as a domestic employee for a family. In the afternoon she sells beverages (beer and soft drinks), which she has been doing for the last 12 years from a small space at the front of her house. Lilia really likes beverage sales because she keeps busy, and it is profitable, because she sells everything she buys every month. Although she does not have a suitable shop, her clients don't sotp drinking her beverages, because she treats them very well, and they are well-satisfied with the welcome she gives them. This is her eighth loan through MFP, and what she enjoys about her communal bank are her companions, because they are all responsible about their payments and are not selfish. With the money that she is requesting, she will buy more beers and soft drinks, and she will have certain areas of her house refurbished as well.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Additional merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita D. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 39 years old. Lita is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Lita owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and everyday use products in the local community. Lita has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from these activities. Lita  wants to buy more products to sell to cater to the demands of her customers, especially her neighbors.

In 2008, Lita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Lita is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Lita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Lida

texts.es: Lida tiene 34 años, es madre soltera y vive con sus dos hijos, quienes son estudiante y la apoyan en lo posible. Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de comida al paso en la parte de fuera de su vivienda, actividad que realiza sólo por las noches, contando con la ayuda de sus hijos. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que muchas personas degustan de su buena sazón, por ello es importante para Lida darles una buena atención. Como ella no tiene pareja, quiere demostrar que sola también se puede progresar en la vida, pues gracias a su carisma, esfuerzo y perseverancia está sacando a delante a sus hijos. Por otro lado, la ubicación de su casa le es muy favorable, pues es una zona por donde transitan muchas personas. El sueño a futuro de Lida es tener un restaurante y seguirá trabajado duro para lograrlo. Este es su 6to crédito con MFP, le gusta trabajar con su grupo porque son personas responsables donde ha encontrado a muy buenas compañeras. Con el dinero que solicita comprará sillas y mesas, también mandará a construir un pequeño kiosco donde atenderá con mayor comodidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Lida, 34 years old, is a single mother. She lives with her two children who are students and who support her as much as possible. For 4 years she has been involved nonstop in the sale of food from just outside her house. This is an activity she carries out only at nights, counting on help from her children.

What she likes about her work is that many people taste her good food, and it’s because of this that it is important for Lida to give them good service. Since she doesn’t have a partner she wants to demonstrate that a single person can also get ahead in life. Thanks to her charisma, effort and perseverance, she is getting ahead with her children. In addition, the location of her house is very favorable since it is in an area through which many people travel.

Lida’s dream for the future is to have a restaurant, and she will continue working hard so that her dream is realized. This is her sixth loan with MFP. She likes working with her group because they are responsible people, and she has met very good friends there. With the money she is applying for she will buy chairs and tables and will also order the construction of a small kiosk where she can wait on her customers in greater comfort.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a kiosk and the purchase of furniture for her business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 31-year-old married woman with six children between the ages of two and fourteen years, five of whom go to school. Mariam also takes care of additional family members.

Mariam’s family eats three meals a day. She rents a four-room house where she is staying with seven people. There is electricity but no plumbing at her home.

For the last five years Mariam has worked seven days a week running a shop carrying home goods in a semi-urban area. She has approximately thirty customers a day. She goes to Kamapala to buy her merchandise. Her major monthly expenses include rent for her store and house, plus medication. She also incurs travel expenses.

Mariam has been with MCDT for two years. She is servicing her fourth loan, working with the same group. She wants to use this loan to buy more merchandise for her shop. Mariam hopes to see her business grow bigger so she can own her own shop and home. .

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for her shop

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José tiene 43 años, vive junto a su pareja quien lo apoya mucho, no tienen hijos y la casa donde habitan es propia. Anteriormente tenía el negocio de cabinas de internet público, pero no obtuvo las ganancias esperadas, por tal motivo, hace 9 meses optó por construir 4 habitaciones en el espacio donde estaban sus computadoras, y desde ese entonces se dedica al alquiler de habitaciones. Negocio donde le está yendo muy bien porque ya cuenta con 4 inquilinos. Sin embargo, José no solo se dedica a esa actividad, ya que es profesor de primaria en una institución educativa desde hace 17 años y le va muy bien. Lo que le gusta de sus labores, tanto independiente como dependiente, es que lo mantienen ocupado y le son rentables, porque ambos le permiten tener ingresos fijos mensuales. Este es su 3er préstamo con MFP, él está muy contento y agradecido con su banco comunal porque cuanto tuvo algunos problemas, todos le ayudaron a resolverlos. Asimismo sabe que todos son personas responsables con sus respectivos negocios y con el pago de sus créditos. Con el dinero que viene solicitando mandará a refaccionar sus habitaciones; las pintará, le colocará un mejor piso y construirá lavatorios.
texts.en:
José is 43 years old and live with his partner, who is very supportive. They do not have children and live in their own home. Previously, José operated a public Internet café but did not generate enough revenue as he expected. Nine months ago, he decided to build 4 rooms in the space that previously housed his computer terminals and rent them out to tenants. Business is doing well because all 4 rooms are occupied. In addition, José is a primary school teacher at an educational institution and has been in this profession for the past 17 years. He enjoys both of his jobs, being an employee and a small business owner, because it keeps him busy and he is able to earn additional profits instead of relying on a fixed monthly income.

José is requesting his 3rd loan with MFP. He is very happy and grateful to his Communal Bank because they supported him whenever he faced difficulties. He knows that everyone is responsible in their own businesses and with their loan payments. The funds he requested will be used to perform renovations to his rental rooms, including painting and installation of new floors and sinks.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Renovations to his rental space

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es: Jenny tiene 27 años, es madre de 4 hijos, vive con su pareja quien trabaja en obras de construcción. Desde hace un año se dedica a la venta de ropa para los distintos géneros, esta actividad la realiza de manera ambulante, pues no cuenta con un local propio. Su mercadería la adquiere en su propia ciudad y posteriormente la lleva a ofrecer por distintos lugares, vendiéndola al crédito o al contado. Jenny está contenta con esta actividad porque le está yendo muy bien, pues anteriormente vendía comida, pero no le producía buenas ganancias. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es mantenerse activa y apoyar en algunos gastos familiares a su pareja. Para más adelante quiere comprarse una moto para visitar a sus clientes y vender sus prendas con mayor rapidez y facilidad, ya que actualmente lo hace caminando. Este es su 8vo préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta de trabajar con su banco comunal es que todos los integrantes son colaboradores y se conocen entre sí. Con el dinero que solicita invertirá en la compra de más ropa y algunos zapatos para dama.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 34 years old, married, with seven children aged between 22 and 28 years. None of her children go to school. She resides in a three roomed house where she stays with four people. Florence doesn’t take care of any additional family members. There is no electricity or piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day. 

She resides and works in a semi-urban area. She incurs extra transport costs to and from work. She buys her clothes from Owino market, one of the busiest markets in Uganda. She sells to 30 customers a day, both retail and wholesale. Florence works seven days a week. Her major monthly expenses include rent for her business and residence, plus medication costs. She has been in this business for the last ten years. Florence has been with MCDT for five years and is servicing her tenth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more bales of clothes for resale. Florence hopes to see her business grow bigger, and own a permanent business premise and home.

loans.use: To buy more bales of clothes.

loans.name: Lermie

texts.en:
Lermie T. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 32 years old, married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Lermie owns and runs a sari-sari (variety) shop where she sells both food and daily necessities to the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Lermie joined HSPFI to make use of its financial services. Lermie has successfully repaid a previous loan from HSPFI of 11,000 PHP that she used to purchase additional merchandise for her shop. Lermie is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP that will also be used to purchase additional inventory. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Lermie from HSPFI. She plans to use her profits to supplement the family’s income.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that translation of entrepreneur profiles by bilingual speakers is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Kuru Momoh Ii Group

texts.en:
These women are Mamusu M., Kadiatu K., Kadiatu M. and Hawanatu S.. They named their group Kuru Momoh II, a Temne phrase meaning thank you God. This will be their third loan from SMT/Kiva. The previous loans have made meaningful impacts in the lives of these women. The last loan they each received from Kiva through SMT was for Le 400,000.00. Now, they are each requesting a loan of Le 600,000.00 to enable them to further strengthen their businesses.

Mamusu M. (middle) is the leader of the group. Mamusu is forty-three years of age. She was born in Freetown, but lives in Magburaka town with her husband, who is a tailor, and their two children. Mamusu’s children are attending school. One is in Junior Secondary School II, and the other is in class V. Mamusu sells rice. With this loan, she will expand her business by buying different varieties of rice wholesale, and reselling them in the Magburaka town market. Mamusu has been in this business for fifteen years.

loans.use: Invest in their businessses

loans.name: Gina

texts.es: La señora Gina tiene 62 años, vive con su esposo, quien es agricultor, y con sus dos hijos que están estudiando. Ella tiene una pequeña bodega que instaló en su casa, donde vende productos comestibles de primera necesidad (huevos, fideos, arroz, leche, pan, etc.), además de diversas bebidas. En esta actividad ya lleva un periodo de 2 años, atendiendo su negocio todos los días a cualquier hora del día. Lo que le gusta a Gina de su tienda es que mediante ella se relaciona con muchas personas y darles una buena atención es lo principal para ella, además que es una labor que la mantiene ocupada y se siente muy útil. Por otro lado, es un negocio rentable, ya que por donde ella vive es la única bodega. Adicionalmente, Gina es propietaria de un motocarro, el cual también le genera buenos ingresos diarios, pues lo alquila para que realicen transporte de pasajeros. Para más adelante quiere ampliar su tienda y contar con un local más grande que le permita tener minimarket y así facilitar a sus vecinos con sus necesidades diarias. Ese es su 6to préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta de trabajar con su banco comunal es que todos los integrantes se ayudan entre sí y son muy responsables con sus pagos. Con el dinero que viene solicitando invertirá en la compra de diversos productos para implementar su negocio y ofrecer diversidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Gina is 62 years old and lives with her husband -- a farmer -- and her two children who are students. She has a small grocery store that she installed in her house, where she sells basic foods, such as eggs noodles, rice, milk, bread, etc., as well as drinks. She has been engaged in this activity for two years, attending her business everyday at whatever hour of the day.

What Gina likes most about her store is that it enables her to have contact with many people and give them good service. Moreover, it keeps her occupied and makes her feel very useful. Besides, it is a profitable business, since it is the only store where she lives.

In addition, Gina owns a motor car, which also generates good daily income. She rents it out to carry passengers. In the future, she wants to expand her store and acquire a larger space that will permit her to have a mini-market and, thus, better supply her neighbors with their daily necessities.

This is Gina's sixth loan from MFP. What she likes about working with her community bank is that all the members help each other and are very responsible about their payments. With this money she will invest in buying products to expand her business and offer more variety to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: EXPAND HER MERCHANDISE

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Araceli

texts.es: A sus 30 años, Araceli es madre de 2 niños que aun cursan estudios primarios, vive con su pareja quien la apoya en su negocio. La casa donde viven es propia. Ella cuenta con dos botes a motor, con los cuales se dedican al transporte de pasajeros haciendo tres viajes por semana, ya que la zona a donde van está a ubicada a un día y una noche por río. En esta labor lleva 10 años y cuenta con el apoyo de su pareja quien se encarga del manejo y buen funcionamiento de los botes, mientras ella, en tierra, es la encargada de administrar y abastecer los productos y repuestos necesarios para cada viaje. Lo que le gusta a Araceli de su negocio es que le es muy rentable porque tiene buenos ingresos, además aprovecha los viajes para encargar a su pareja comprar plátanos, yucas y pescado para venderlos en su ciudad, obteniendo ganancias extras por estos productos. Para más adelante, Araceli quiere mandar a construir otro bote para ir incrementando su flota. Con MFP ya tiene 10 créditos y lo que le gusta de trabajar con su grupo es que existe mucha responsabilidad y todos son solidarios unos con otros. Con el dinero que ahora solicita mandará a refaccionar sus botes, especialmente los motores, para que trabajen en óptimas condiciones.
texts.en:
At 30 years of age, Araceli is the mother of 2 children who are in primary school. She lives with her partner who supports her in her business. The house where they live is their own. She has two motor boats with which she is engaged in the transportation of passengers, making three trips per week since the area to which they go is located one day and one night away by river. She has carried on this business for 10 years and counts on the support of her partner who is in charge of the management and good functioning of the boats, while she takes care of administering and supplying the goods and spare parts necessary for each trip.

What Araceli likes about her business is that it is very profitable because she has good income. She also takes advantage of the trips to commission her partner to buy bananas, yucca, and fish in order to sell them in her city, obtaining extra profits from these products.

Looking ahead, Araceli wants to order the construction of another boat in order to increase her fleet. She already has 10 loans with MFP, and what she likes about working with her group is that there is a lot of responsibility and everyone is jointly liable with one another. With the money that she is now applying for she will order to repair of her boats, especially the motors, so that they work in the best condition. .

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair of her motor boats

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Triangle Solidarity Group

texts.es: El grupo Solidario llamado El Triangulo está conformado por Tamara Patricia L. T., Paulita Mercedes Rojas T. Pérez y Lucia T. Pérez. A pesar de las diversas actividades económica que ellas tienen como es venta de cosméticos, venta de comida y pulpería. Todas tienen  el mismo objetivo de salir adelante porque sus negocios les han propiciado los estudios necesarios a sus hijos. A pesar de los desafíos que han enfrentado juntas ya que no poseen el capital suficiente, pero con el paso del tiempo han aprendido a manejar muy bien sus negocios. El financiamiento que solicitan es para capital de trabajo para la compra de productos que corresponden a cada una de sus actividades económicas y ampliar su producción con fin de mejorar sus ingresos y brindarles mejoras económicas a su hogar.
texts.en:
The Triangle solidarity group is made up of Tamara Patricia L. T., Paulita Mercedes Rojas T. Pérez, and Lucia T. Pérez. Despite the range of activities that the women engage in, from selling cosmetics, selling food, and owning a small corner shop, all of them have the same objective of moving forward, especially because their businesses have allowed them to provide schooling for their children. In spite of the challenges that they have encountered due to insufficient capital, with time they have learned how to manage their businesses better. The loan that they request is for the purchase of products that correspond to each of their businesses in order to increase their production and income and bring an improved economic state to their homes.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase materials/products for their businesses

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica O. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. Monica is 33-years-old, married, and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Monica owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and everyday products to the local community. Monica has run her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Monica joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Monica has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. The previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Monica is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP that will be used to invest in expanding her business. This is the 4th loan Monica has requested from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by the loan to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Expand the business

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Kuru Momoo Group

texts.en:
This is Mohamed T. S., Alpha K. and M’Balu K.. They are entrepreneurs in Magburaka town, who sell petroleum products and tea. They named their group Kuru Momo, a Temne phrase meaning Thank You God. They have received several loans from SMT/Kiva. The previous loans have made a big impact on the lives of these entrepreneurs, allowing them to afford the cost of their households.

Mohamed T. S. (left) is the leader of this group. He was born twenty-nine years ago in the town of Magburaka, which is in northern Sierra Leone. He is married with one child, who is in secondary school. Mohamed has been a businessman for five years. He sells petrol, kerosene, diesel, and engine oil. Mohamed and the other group members will use this loan to expand their businesses.

loans.use: Invest in his business

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: Deborah is 45 years old and married with a child. She lives in Warri with her family. She sells second-hand shoes and belts. She is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more second-hand shoes and belts to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more second-hand shoes and belts to sell

loans.name: Sandra Patricia

texts.es:
La señora SANDRA PATRICIA A. A. , tiene 38años, vive en el distrito del Porvenir  , provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal CIELO II.
La empresaria presenta estudios superiores, es profesora de ciencias naturales (primaria), tiene  un hijo de 2 años de edad quien depende económicamente de ella.
SANDRA   se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza como: cremas, talcos, colonias, perfumes, etc
Su primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invirtió en la compra de útiles escolares que vendía en la tienda de su casa, pero debido a la bajas ventas cerró su local y se dedicó a la venta de productos de belleza.
Este crédito de 500 nuevos soles lo utilizará para comprar mas productos de belleza que venderá a sus amistades, vecinos, familiares y también en la tienda de su casa. 
Sandra sueña con tener una tienda de productos alimenticios para obtener mayor dinero y educar a su hijo ya que no cuenta con el apoyo económico del padre.
texts.en:
Mrs SANDRA PATRICIA A. A. is 38 years old and lives in the district of Porvenir, a province of Trujillo in the department of La Libertad in Peru.She belongs to the communal bank CIELO II.

A businesswoman with tertiary studies, Sandra is a primary school teacher of natural science. She has a two year old child who is economically dependent on her.Sandra sells beauty products such as creams, talcs, colognes, perfumes, etc.

She invested her first loan of 300 nuevos soles in the purchase of school stationery, however due to low sales she closed her store and concentrated on selling beauty products. She will utilise this loan of 500 nuevos soles to buy more beauty products that she will sell to friends, neighbours and relatives, as well as through home sales. Sandra dreams of having a grocery store to increase her income and educate her child as she no longer has the economic support of her child's father.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beauty products

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es: Vicente M. tiene 51 años. Tiene 4 hijos y solamente 1 está a su cargo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es brindar los servicios de taxi. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio. con estos ingresos mantiene a su familia él ha logrado salir adelante con mucho esfuerzo ya que algunas veces no tiene tiempo de comer en el tiempo que es debido a que tiene una gran demanda de clientes y esto le proporciona mucho cansancio. El destino del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de batería, llantas, focos y amortiguadores. Sus sueños para un futuro son de obtener otro vehículo, ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Vicente is a 51-year-old father of four children, one of whom is still under his care. For over seven years he has made a living as a taxi driver, using the income he makes to to keep his family moving forward. Vicente works so hard that many times he does not have time to eat because of large customer demand, which makes him very tired. The loan that he requests is for the purchase of a car battery, tires, bulbs, and shock absorbers. His dreams for the future are to buy another vehicle so that he can offer better services to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase car batteries, tires, bulbs, and shock absorbers

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is 53 years old. She is married with five children. Rosemary and her family live in Warri. 

Rosemary sells household items to take care of her family. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more household items to sell. Rosemary says Thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more household items to sell.

loans.name: God Is With Us Group

texts.en:
This is Fatmata K. S., Ya Namina S. and Isatu B.. They are local businesswomen in Magburaka town. They named their group God is With Us. They have received several loans from Kiva through SMT. Previous loans have made tremendous impacts into the lives of these borrowers. They were able to use the proceeds to look after themselves and their families. Having repaid their previous loan successfully, they are now requesting a new loan to further expand their businesses.

Fatmata K. S. (right) sells jewelries. She is the leader of this group. She was born in Magburaka, in Tonkolili district, in northern Sierra Leone. She is age thirty-four, married to a farmer and they have three children. One of her children is in secondary school, the other in primary school and the last is still not of school going age. Fatmata has got more than ten years of experience in business. With this loan, she will be able to further strengthen her business.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Rosalina Alejandra

texts.es: Rosalina Alejandra L. tiene 52 años. Es una mujer muy responsable tiene 3 hijos que ya no dependen de ella. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella dio inicio a este negocio porque su hijo mayor le ayudo para que comprara ciertos productos como calzado y telas y al ver que obtenía suficiente ganancias con esta actividad decide seguir adelante. Ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo y comprar productos como sandalias, zapatos deportivos, zapatillas y telas. El sueño de Rosalina es seguirle proporcionado mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Rosalina Alejandra López is 52. She is a very responsible woman, and she has three independent children. She has been selling general merchandise for over five years. She started the business because her oldest son helped her buy certain products like footwear and material. Upon seeing that she got enough income from this activity, she decided to keep going. She is asking for this loan for working capital to buy products like sandals, athletic shoes, shoes, and fabric. Rosalina’s dream is to keep making improvements on her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Resty

texts.en:
Resty D. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 38 years old. Resty is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Resty engages in a traditional gold mining activity called Pamiling. He sells mined gold dusts in the local community. Resty has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month.

In 2008, Resty joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Resty successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from HSPFI that he used to to pay for the fabrication of equipment used in his gold mining.

Resty is requesting his 4th loan from HSPFI for 13000 PHP to repair his house. He plans to use the additional revenue to completely repair his house and to support the education of his children.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note
To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in his business and repair his house.

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Together As One Group

texts.en:
This is Fatmata K., Fatmata Bangura, and Isatu K.. They are local entrepreneurs in Magburaka town, in northern Sierra Leone. They call their group Together As One. 

Fatmata K. (right) is the leader of the group. She was born in Magburaka, Tonkolili district, in northern Sierra Leone. She is age 40, married to a goldsmith and they have three children. Two are in secondary school and one is in primary school. Fatmata has been a businesswoman since childhood. She sells market food – rice, tomatoes, pepper, groundnuts, etc.

This will be the fourth loan Together As One has received from SMT/Kiva. SMT/Kiva loans have made massive contributions toward the well-being and development of these entrepreneurs. Having repaid their last loan successfully, they now request a loan for each to further strengthen their businesses.

loans.use: Invest in their businesses.

loans.name: Blanca Rita

texts.es: La Señora Blanca Rita B. P. tiene 55 años. Tiene 4 hijos de los cuales solamente 1 depende de ella. Su actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 13 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella no pudo finalizar sus estudios y no quería que sus hijos atravesaran por lo mismo, por lo que con mucho esfuerzo comienza a vender refrescos naturales, pan y golosinas por lo que fue de mucha ayuda ya que no hay muchas pulperías que ofrecieran  lo que Blanca vendía además del buen carisma que ofrece a sus clientes y así decide invertir en muchos productos para proporcionarles a sus clientes una gran variedad de productos. Ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de golosinas, pan, galletas, refrescos naturales, jugos, detergentes y granos básicos. Su deseo es establecer una tienda de ropa para aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Blanca Rita B. P. is 55. She has four children, but only one is still dependent upon her. She has a mini market. She has had this business for over 13 years. She could not finish her education, and she did not want the same to happen to her children. She put much effort into starting to sell natural soft drinks, bread, and sweets. It really helped that there are not many stores that offer what Blanca sells with great charisma. She decided to invest in a lot of products to give her customers a greater variety of products. She is asking for this loan to buy sweets, bread, crackers, natural soft drinks, juice, detergent, and basic grains. Her wish is to establish a clothing store to increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Titi

texts.en: Titi E. is 70 years old and married with six children. She lives in Warri with her family. She sells provisions. She is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. Thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Na We This Ii Group

texts.en:
This is Alhaji M. T., Memunatu C., Mariatu K., Kadiatu S. and Fatmata S.. They called their group Na We This II. They are requesting a loan of Le 500,000 for each to enable them to improve their businesses. This will be the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from Kiva lenders. With this loan, their businesses will improve both in size and quality. They will be able to make better sales, more profit and consequently, improve their standards of living. They will be able to better look after themselves and their school-going children. 

Alhaji M. T. (right) is the leader of this group. Alhaji was born in Magburaka town, 15 miles from Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. He is 27 and married with four children between the ages of 1 and 4. Alhaji is a car driver who plies the Magburaka-Makeni highway. He has been a driver for five years. With this loan, he will buy spare parts for his vehicle.

loans.use: Invest in his car

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn J. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 50 years old. Merlyn is married and has nine adult children. Merlyn operates a business selling home products. The main source of income for the business comes from selling kitchen supplies and other products, such as bags and slippers, to tourists and local community members. Merlyn has been engaged in her business for more than10 years and earns approximately 15,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2008, Merlyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the second loan taken out by Merlyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Susana Filomena

texts.es: Susana Filomena E. tiene 53 años y 3 hijos que trabajan de manera independiente. Ella es una persona que siempre le ha gustado salir adelante. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad económica como es la venta de comida. Además como madre responsable por lo que sus 3 tenían que comer y estudiar, Susana realizo muchos sacrificios ya que cocinaba una gran cantidad de comida y no tenía a nadie que le ayudara con esto por lo que pero al notar que obtenía muy buenos ingresos decide seguir invirtiendo en capital de trabajo. Es por eso que solicita este financiamiento para la compra de arroz, aceite, frijoles, carne y frutas. Su mayor sueño es poseer un restaurante para seguir ayudando a su familia.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Nuestra Sra Del Rosario Group

texts.es: Las socias del grupo “Nuestra Señora del Rosario” están representadas por la señora Clariza y conformada por  13 miembros que residen en el mismo barrio, la mayoría D. las socias se dedican a la elaboración D. platos D. comida como chicharrón y carnes a la parrilla el resto se dedica  ala elaboración D. pan, a la venta D. ropa, al lavado D. ropa y la venta D. cosméticos por catálogos entre los varones se dedican a la construcción D. viviendas. La competencia a nivel comercial es alta pero la socias tienen mucha experiencia y saben como sacar adelante sus negocios ofreciendo productos variados y D. buena calidad. El destino del financiamiento es para adquisición D. herramientas mas modernas para realizar un pan D. mayor calidad en menor tiempo, también para la adquisición D. mercadería mas acorD. a las exigencias del mercado en especial para el cambio D. temporada y también para el emprendimiento D. nuevos negocios que ayuden a generar mayores ingresos para sus familias.. La socias van cursando su primer ciclo pero ya cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios por lo se comprometen a dar todo D. si para salir adelante con responsabilidad y unidad.
texts.en:
The members of the group “Nuestra Señora del Rosario” (Our Lady of the Rosary) is led by Sra. Clariza and consists of 13 members who live in the same neighborhood. Most of the members prepare dishes such as fried pork skins and grilled meats. Other members make bread, sell clothing, wash clothes, and sell cosmetics by catalog. The men in the group are engaged in housing construction. The level of business competition is high but the members are experienced enough to know that they must offer a variety of products in order to succeed.

Their loan will be used to acquire more modern tools for making high-quality bread in less time. They will also purchase merchandise based on their customer demands in time for the new season. Their new business ventures will help generate more income for their families. The members are working together on their first cycle, but have previous experience with other solidarity groups. Therefore, they promise to give everything they have in order to move forward with responsibility and unity.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Sorry For Me Ii Group

texts.en:
This is Aminata F., Mariatu B., Idrissa K. and Mahawa C.. They named their group Sorry For Me II. They are local entrepreneurs in the town of Magburaka, about fifteen miles from Makeni City in northern Sierra Leone.

This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are receiving from Kiva through SMT and they are requesting a loan of Le 500,000 each. Such a loan can create a significant impact in the lives of these borrowers. They will be able to expand their businesses, make better profits, thereby improving their standards of living.

Aminata F. (second from left) is the leader of the group. She is thirty years of age and was born in Magburaka town. She is married to a businessman and they have two children aged five and seven.

Aminata sells ready-to-wear-clothes both for adults and children. She has been in this business for more than ten years now. With this new loan, she will expand her business.

To Aminata and her colleagues in the group, an increase in profit means making their lives better. They will be able to take good care of their children, specifically with their educational and nutritional needs, as well as putting some money aside for emergencies.

loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina D., from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City, is a 40-year-old married mother of six school-aged children. To make a living, Dina buys and sells bananas, coconuts and cassava. Engaged in her business for over four years, she earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

Dina wants to open up a mini grocery store so as to have another income for her family. In 2008, she joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI, she is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP which will be used to invest in starting the grocery store business. This loan will be Dina's fourth from HSPFI, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family income and support her children's education.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To start a mini grocery store.

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en: Akosua, a 43-year-old married mother of three sons and two daughters, all still in school, works very hard to support her husband in providing for the family. Residing with her family in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana, Akosua trades in gari, cassava, and flour in her community. She procures the gari from the nearby communities at moderate prices. Akosua has been in business for five years now and is requesting a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy gari

loans.name: Genoveva Soledad

texts.es:
Genoveva es socia del Banco Comunal Las Golondrinas.
Genoveva es conviviente, tiene 44 años y 1 hija, Genoveva tiene una cebicheria en su casa actividad que realiza todos los días por las mañanas.
Genoveva necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de platos.
Los sueños de Genoveva son tener un puesto y mejorar su salud.
texts.en:
Genoveva is a member of the Las Golondrinas ("The Swallows") Community Bank. She cohabits, is 44 years old and has 1 daughter. She has a cevicheria in her house, a responsibility that she dedicates herself to every morning. Genoveva needs a loan of $225 which will be invested in the purchase of plates. Her dreams are to have a street stand and improve her health.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of plates

loans.name: Fine

texts.en: Fine A., a 39-year-old married mother of one child, lives in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria. She sells provisions to take care of her family and is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She thanks Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia es socia del Banco Comunal Las Golondrinas.
Alicia es conviviente, tiene 38 años y 2 hijos, Alicia vende ropa a pedido, productos que ofrece a amigos y familiares, sus ventas son en mayor parte a crédito.
Alicia necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de polos, pantalones.
Los sueños de Alicia son tener una tienda de ropas en el centro de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Alicia is a member of the Las Golondrinas Community Bank. Alicia is 38, in a common law marriage, and has two children. Alicia sells clothes by order, which she offers to friends and family members. Most of her sales are on credit. Alicia needs a loan for 1,050 PEN to buy shirts and pants. Alicia’s dream is to have a clothing store in the center of the city.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy shirts and pants

loans.name: Ann

texts.en: Ann, a 38-year-old married mother of one child, lives in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria with her family. She sells drinks, and  hopes for the loan amount of N50 000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She thanks Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Zaragoza

texts.es:
Zaragoza es socia del Banco Comunal Las Golondrinas.
Zaragoza es casada, tiene 52 años y 2 hijos, Zaragoza tiene un carro con el cual realiza transporte de pasajeros, para lo cual cuenta con un conductor. Además Zaragoza en algunas oportunidades vende tamales en su barrio.
Zaragoza necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de accesorios para carro.
Los sueños de Zaragoza son comprar un carro moderno y ayudar a sus hijos en su educación.
texts.en:
Zaragoza is a member of the Las Golondrinas Community Bank. Zaragosa is 52, married, and has two children. Zaragoza has a car with a driver, which is used to transport passengers. Zaragoza also sells tamales on occasion in her neighborhood. Zaragoza needs a loan for 600 PEN to buy accessories for her car. Zaragoza’s dreams are to buy a modern car and to help her children with their education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy car accessories

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga es socia del Banco Comunal Las Golondrinas.
Olga es casada, tiene 62 años y 4 hijos, Olga tiene 2 locutorios en locales alquilados, en donD. brinda servicios D. llamadas telefónicas, recargas virtuales, venta D. tarjetas, actividad que realiza con la ayuda D. 3 empleados.
Olga necesita un préstamo D. 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. tarjetas.
Los sueños D. Olga son tener locales propios.
texts.en:
Olga is a member of the Banco Comunal Las Golondrinas. Olga is married. She is 62 years old and has four children. Olga has 2 call centers at rented storefronts from where she offers phone call services, virtual/rechargeable minutes and calling cards. She does this with the help of three employees. Olga is in need of a loan of 900 soles which she will invest in the purchase of calling cards. Her dream is to own have her stores.

Translated from Spanish by Veronica Martino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of calling cards

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
El comité “8 de Diciembre” se formó con la unión varias vecinas del barrio  8 de Diciembre, de la ciudad de Villa Elisa. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, como son las ventas.
 Las integrantes formaron un grupo  muy unido y capaz de realizar actividades en forma conjunta, ya que la mayoría de sus integrantes se dedican a la venta, siendo así la mayoría de ellas, colegas entre si.
Todas las integrantes del comité son madres que se dedican a dichas actividades con el fin de fortalecer la economía de la casa y desarrollar sus emprendimientos de manera sustentable. 
Las integrantes de este grupo se dedican a las siguientes actividades:
Patricia Bernarda González	Venta de Quiniela
Claudia M. C.	Venta de Ropas
María Ynocencia R.	Venta de de Ropas
Maximina Escurra	Repostera
Ángela Báez de Cuevas	Venta de Cosméticos
Ramona Raquel A.	Venta de Quiniela
Dominga Epifanía C.	Venta de Quiniela
Myriam Graciela Solís	Venta de Bebidas
Gabriela G. de Román	Copetín
Cirila M.	Despensa
Victoriana E.	Repostera
Celia B.	Venta de Ropas
Silvia María T.	Venta de comidas
Elida G.	Despensa
Percida M.	Venta de Frutas
Liz Mariela C.	Venta de carteras 
Lucia A. de Valdez	Venta de Quiniela
Dolores Florentín A.	Venta de comidas
texts.en:
The 8 de Diciembre group formed with the union of several members of the 8 de Diciembre neighborhood in the city of Villa Elisa. All of the group members work at independent activities like sales. The members form a very united group that is capable of doing activities in a joint manner. The majority of the members work in sales and they are colleagues. The members of this group are engaged in the following activities: Patricia Bernarda González Sells Sports Lottery Tickets Claudia M. C. Sells Clothes María Ynocencia R. Sells Clothes Maximina Escurra Makes Pastry Ángela Báez de Cuevas Sells Cosmetics Ramona Raquel A. Sells Sports Lottery Tickets Dominga Epifanía C. Sells Sports Lottery Tickets Myriam Graciela Solís Sells Drinks Gabriela G. de Román Snack Bar Cirila M. Small Grocery Store Victoriana E. Makes Pastry Celia B. Sells Clothes Silvia María T. Sells Food Elida G. Small Grocery Store Percida M. Sells Fruit Liz Mariela C. Sells Purses Lucia A. de Valdez Sells Sports Lottery Tickets Dolores Florentín A. Sells Food

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various merchandise like food, clothes,lottery tickets, purses, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Kathia Del Rocio

texts.es:
La señora KATHIA DEL ROCIO T. P. , tiene 38 años, vive en el distrito de Trujillo-Centro, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal MANATIAL DE VIDA
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5to de secundaria , tiene 4 hijos quienes dependen económicamente de ella.
 KATHIA se dedica a la preparación y venta de chocolates y también  a la venta de productos de belleza.
Su primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invirtió en la compra de mas  productos de belleza para poder vender con mas frecuencia y facilidad.
Este crédito de 500  nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de mas productos para preparar sus chocolates como: chocolates en barra, harinas, pasas, manjar blanco, pasas , pecanas, etc.  
MARIA ELENA sueña con comprar una vitrina y colocarla en la puerta de su casa para vender sus chocolates y también preparar postres.
texts.en:
Sra. Kathia Del Rocio T. P. is 38 years old and lives in the District of Trujillo-Centro, Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad – Perú. She belongs to the Communal Bank “Manantial de Vida” (Spring of Life).

This entrepreneur completed her studies through the 5th year of secondary school. She has 4 dependent children.

Kathia prepares and sells chocolates. In addition, she sells beauty products. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to purchase additional beauty products to keep on hand so that she could sell them more frequently and easily.

She is now requesting a loan of 500 soles to buy more ingredients for making chocolates such as chocolate bars, flour, raisins, manjar blanco, pecans, etc. Kathia dreams of buying a display case to put near the door of her house so that she can sell her chocolates and prepared desserts.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for making chocolates

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.es:
Erlinda es socia del Banco Comunal Las Golondrinas.
Erlinda es conviviente, tiene 27 años y 2 hijos, Erlinda vende ropa en las diferentes ferias de la región a donde viaja 3 veces por semana, y de las ferias compra quesos que vende a sus vecinos.
Erlinda necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pantalones.
El sueño de Erlinda es alquilar un local para tener una tienda de venta de ropa.

loans.use: Para la compra de pantalones.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
La señora MARIA ELENA  H. O. , tiene 53 años, vive en el distrito de Trujillo-Centro, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal MANANTIAL DE VIDA
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5to de secundaria, tiene 4 hijos, todos mayores y ninguno depende económicamente de ella.
MARIA ELENA se dedica a la venta de menús (alimentos) que prepara en su domicilio y los lleva a repartir a los trabajadores de diferentes centros comerciales de la ciudad de Trujillo.
Su primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invirtiró en la compra de productos alimenticios como: arroz, azúcar, menestras, aceites, papas al por mayor para preparar sus alimentos.
Este crédito de 1,000 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de mas productos alimenticios y también en la compra de utensilios de cocina, vajillas y tapers para repartir sus menús.
MARIA ELENA sueña con tener un restaurante en su casa en dónde vender su menús , cervezas y gaseosas.

loans.use: compra de productos alimenticios y también en la compra de utensilios de cocina y vajillas

loans.name: Favour

texts.en: Favour is 35 years old and married with six children. She lives in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria. She sells sarongs. She is requesting a loan in the amount of N100,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. Thank you Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Edita Eliza

texts.es:
La señora EDITA ELIZA G. R., tiene 35 años, vive en el distrito de LA ESPERANZA, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal JESÚS EN TI CONFIO
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5to de secundaria , tiene 2 hijos de 9 y 5 años de edad quienes dependen económicamente de ella.
EDITA  se dedica a la fabricación y venta de calzado en el centro de Trujillo. 
Los zapatos los fabrica en  sociedad con su hermano, quien es zapatero y es quien le enseño este oficio.
Su primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invertió en la compra de material como cuero, cuerina , plantillas, pegamento ,etc
Este crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de mas productos para la fabricación de  sus zapatos.
EDITA sueña con tener  en stand en el centro comercial de Trujillo y poder vender su calzado con mas frecuencia y menos desgaste fisico, ya que en la actualidad los vende en forma ambulatoria.
texts.en:
Sra. Edita Eliza G. R. is 35 years old and lives in the District of La Esperanza, Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad – Perú. She belongs to the Communal Bank “Jesús En Ti Confio”.
