This entrepreneur completed her education through the 5th year of secondary school. She has 2 dependent children, ages 9 and 5.

Edita makes and sells footwear in central Trujillo. She makes shoes with the help of her brother, who is a shoemaker and taught her the trade. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to purchase materials such as leather, suede, insoles, adhesives, etc.

She is requesting another loan of 300 soles to purchase more supplies for making shoes. Edita dreams of opening a stand in the central business district of Trujillo so that she can sell shoes more frequently with less physical effort. She currently sells her products door-to-door.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for making shoes

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina, a 40-year-old married mother of eight children, lives in Warri with her family. She sells madigan and flowers and  is requesting a loan in the amount of N100,000 to purchase more flowers and cake material to sell. Thank you Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To purchase more flowers and cake material to sell

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario es socio del Banco Comunal Las Golondrinas.
Mario es casado, tiene 58 años y 1 hijo, Mario vende cebiche (plato preparado con pescado y limón) de manera ambulatoria, actividad que realiza todos los días, además Mario por las noches trabaja como vigilante.
Mario necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de un triciclo y mesas.
Los sueños de Mario es tener un restaurante marisquería.
texts.en:
Mario is a member of Banco Comunal Las Goldrinas. Mario is married. He is 58 years old. He has one son. Mario sells ceviche (a dish which is prepared with fish and lemon) in a mobile manner. He does this activity everyday. In addition, Mario works at night as a guard. Mario needs a loan of $225 (600 soles), money which will be invested in the purchase of a cart and tables. Mario dreams of having a seafood restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: In order to buy a cart and tables

loans.name: Fausto

texts.en:
Fausto M. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 50 years old. Fausto is married and has four school-aged children. Fausto owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop for a living. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling food and daily use products to the local community. Fausto has operated his business for over one year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Fausto joined HSPFI for access to their financial services in order to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Fausto has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Fausto is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP to expand the business. This loan will be Fausto's 3rd HSPFI loan. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to support his children's education.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand the business

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal Amaquella que significa No seas Flojo en quechua.
Juana es casada, tiene 48 años y 6 hijos, Juana venD. materiales D. construcción en un local propio, además reparte los materiales a domicilio con el apoyo D. su esposo.
Juana necesita un préstamo D. 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arena.
Los sueños D. Juana son tener una ferretería y comprar un carro granD. para su negocio.

loans.use: Para la compra de arena.

loans.name: Gladys Predesvinda

texts.es:
La señora Gladys, tiene 42 años, vive en el distrito D. Moche , provincia D. Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal SEÑOR D. LA PIEDAD II.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5º D. secundaria, tiene  2 hijos quienes  dependen económicamente D. ella, porque aún se encuentran en el colegio.
Gladys se dedica a la venta D. prendas D. vestir que trae D. Lima.
Su primer crédito D. 300 nuevos soles lo invertió en la compra D. ropa y así inició su negocio.
Este crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles lo utilizará para comprar mas ropa D. niños, jóvenes y adultos
Gladys sueña con tener su propio stand en un centro comercial D. Trujillo en donD. pueda vender sus productos y obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gladys is 42 years old and lives in the Moche district, province of Trujillo, La Libertad department - Peru. She is a member of the Banco Comunal SEÑOR D. LA PIEDAD II. The entrepreneur has a 5-year secondary education. She has two children who depend on her financially because they are still in school. Gladys is involved in the sale of clothing articles that she brings from Lima. Her first loan of 300 nuevos soles was invested in the purchase of clothing which is how she began her business. This credit of 1,000 nuevos soles will be used to buy more clothing articles for children, teens and adults. Gladys’ dream is to have her own stand in a commercial center in Trujillo, where she would be able to sell her products and make bigger profits.

Translated from Spanish by Veronica Martino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing for children, teens and adults for resale

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua is forty-five years old. She is married and has six children. Her four sons and two daughters are all school-aged. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda, in the Eastern region of Ghana.

Efua works very hard to support husband and provide for her family. Efua purchases moderately priced smoked fish from nearby towns and then trades the fish in her community.

Efua has been in business for over five years now and wants a loan to buy fish in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fish in bulk

loans.name: Face Reality Group

texts.en:
This is Mohamed S. and Isatu S.. They named their group Face Reality. This is the fourth loan this group is asking for from Kiva through SMT. Previous loans have made a lot of impact in the lives of these people. Having repaid their last loan successfully, they are now requesting a new loan of Le 800,000 for each. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses.

Mohamed S. (left) is the leader of this group. He was born in Magburaka, Tonkolili district, in northern Sierra Leone. He is age thirty-two, married with two children – both of whom are still not of school going age. Patrick has five years of experience in business. He owns a kiosk where he sells plastic water, cold drinks, cigarettes, sardines etc.

loans.use: Invest in his business

loans.name: Loveth

texts.en:
Loveth is 33 years old and married with four children. She lives in Warri with her family.

Loveth sells tailoring materials to take care of her family. She is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more tailoring materials to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Nancy Zoila

texts.es:
La señora NANCY ZOILA A.  M., tiene 32 años, vive en el distrito de Moche , provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal SEÑOR DE LA PIEDAD II.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5º de secundaria, tiene  3 hijos quines dependen económicamente de ella, porque aun se encuentran en el colegio.
NANCY se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en la tienda instalada en su propia casa.
Su primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invirtió en la compra de abarrotes, tales como: arroz, azúcar, gaseosas, galletas, chocolates, fideos, jabones, detergentes.
Este crédito de 1000 nuevos soles lo utilizará para comprar mas productos alimenticios y una vitrina para poder exhibir sus prendas.
NANCY sueña con ampliar su negocio y tener todos los productos que le solicitan sus clientes.

loans.use: comprar mas productos alimenticios.  Comprar una vitrina.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa es socia del Banco Comunal Amaquella que significa No seas Flojo en quechua.
Teresa es casada, tiene 44 años y 3 hijos, Teresa tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, frutas, actividad que realiza con la ayuda D. sus hijas, además tiene un locutorio que esta atendido por un personal.
Teresa necesita un préstamo D. 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, leche y azúcar.
Los sueños D. Teresa son tener una farmacia y mejorar sus negocios.
texts.en:
Teresa is a member of Banco Comunal Amaquella, which means “ Don’t be Lazy “, in the indigenous quechua language. She is married and is 44 years old, with three children. Teresa has a store in her house from where she sells staple groceries and fruit. She does this with the help of her daughters. She also has a call center which is handled by an employee. Teresa needs a loan of 1,200 soles. This money will be invested in the purchase of rice, milk and sugar. Teresa’s dream is to also have a pharmacy and improve her businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Veronica Martino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, milk and sugar

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Amaquella que significa No seas Flojo en quechua.
Victoria es casada, tiene 59 años y 5 hijos, Victoria tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, verduras, frutas, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda D. sus hijos.
Victoria necesita un préstamo D. 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. leche, aceite y azúcar.
Los sueños D. Victoria son mejorar sus negocios y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the Communal Bank Amaquella (which means “Don’t Be Lazy" in Quecha). She is 59 years old, married, and has 5 children.

Victoria operates a store out her home where she sells groceries, vegetables, and fruit. She works every day with the assistance of her children.

Victoria needs a loan of 1050 soles in order to buy milk, oil and sugar. She dreams of improving her business and that her children become professionals.

Click HERE to view Victoria's previous loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase milk, oil & sugar

loans.name: Olinda

texts.es:
La señora OLINDA P. D. B., tiene 61 años, vive en el distrito D. Trujillo-Centro, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal MANANTIAL D. VIDA
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5to D. secundaria , tiene 4 hijos y solo una D. 26 años depenD. económicamente D. ella porque es madre soltera y ella la apoya para que pueda criar a su bebe D. 1 año.
OLINDA se dedica a la venta D. productos alimentos en la tienda D. alimentos instalada en su casa.
Su primer crédito D. 300 nuevos soles lo invirtiró en la compra D. productos alimenticios como: arroz, azúcar, leche, golosinas, jugos, gaseosas, etc
Este crédito D. 300 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra D. mas productos alimenticios para surtir la tienda D.  su casa (fideos, azúcar, leche, huevos, etc.)
OLINDA sueña con ampliar su tienda D. productos alimenticios  y generar mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Sra. Olinda P. D. B. is 61 years old and lives in the District of Trujillo-Central, Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad – Perú. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Manantial D. Vida” (Spring of Life).

This entrepreneur completed her studies through the 5th year of secondary school. She has 4 children. One of her daughters is 26 years old and is financially dependent on her because she is a single mother raising a one year old baby.

Olinda sells food products from the grocery store she operates out of her home. Her first loan in the amount of 300 soles was used to purchase products such as rice, sugar, milk, candy, juices, sodas, etc.

She is now requesting another loan of 300 soles to purchase more food products in order to restock her store (noodles, sugar, milk, eggs, etc.). Olinda dreams of expanding her grocery store and generating more revenues.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase noodles, sugar, milk, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Elmer Lelis

texts.es:
Elmer tiene 30 años, es soltero y vive junto a su madre y sus tres hermanas menores en el caserío El progreso, distrito de Lagunas, ubicado a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Hace 8 años que llegó a vivir al lugar junto a su familia y, poco a poco, ha salido adelante dedicándose a la ganadería, el cría vacas lecheras, y durante este tiempo su ganado ha ido aumentando gracias a su esfuerzo.

La leche producida por sus vacas la vende a una empresa acopiadora del producto, el es el encargado de sostener a su familia y la ganadería es la única actividad que les provee el sustento diario, por lo que debe trabajar intensamente en mantener a su ganado saludable.

Elmer desea darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, sus hermanas ya terminan la educación secundaria y el desea brindarles la oportunidad de seguir algún tipo de estudio superior, para lograr este objetivo el cree necesario ampliar su negocio con la compra de una nueva vaca, es por eso que está solicitando a nuestra Institución un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le permitan terminar de realizar esta inversión y así poder seguir ayudando a su familia.

Elmer ya tiene 4 años trabajando con nosotros, y durante este tiempo ha demostrado ser un cliente responsable, trabajador y muy emprendedor; es considerado un cliente excelente ya que ha demostrado puntualidad en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Elmer is 30 years old, single, and lives with his mother and three younger sisters in the village of El Progreso in the district of Lagunas, which is located 40 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo. Eight years ago, he returned home to live with his family and started breeding livestock. Elmer raises dairy cows, and during this time, his herds have been increasing thanks to his efforts.

The milk produced by his cows is sold to a dairy processing company. Elmer is responsible for supporting his family and raising livestock is the only activity that provides for their daily needs. Therefore, he must work hard to keep his cows healthy.

Elmer wants to give his family a better quality of life. He encourages his sisters to complete their high school education so that they can have the opportunity to pursue higher learning. In order to do this, he wants to broaden his business by purchasing another cow. He is requesting a loan from our Institution in the amount of 1000 soles to that he can continue to support his family.

Elmer has been our client for the past 4 years. During that time, he has proven himself to be responsible, hardworking, and resourceful. He is considered to be an excellent client who has demonstrated punctuality with his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Helyn

texts.en:
Helyn F., a 42-year-old mother of six children, the eldest 23 years old, has been a CEVI client since 2005. She dreams of improving her business profits in order to meet the expenses of tuition and books for her children's education and is therefore requesting a loan of Php 22,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. to be used to finance her water-selling business.

Helyn hopes that her loan from CEVI will result in good business returns. She likes the services of CEVI because it offers a very small interest rate of 2% a month which she feels is affordable, given her circumstances.

loans.use: For business financing

loans.name: Norma Noemi

texts.es:
Norma es socia del Banco Comunal Amaquella que significa No seas Flojo en quechua.
Norma es casada, tiene 47 años y 3 hijos, de profesión Profesora de educación secundaria, Norma vende ropa a pedido, sus productos ofrece a amigos de trabajo y familiares, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima y Huancayo.
Norma necesita un préstamo de 2100 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de zapatos.
El sueño de Norma es tener una boutique.
texts.en:
Norma is a member of the Communal Bank Amaquella (which means “Don’t Be Lazy" in Quecha). She is 47 years old, married, has 3 children, and works as a high school teacher.

Norma also sells clothing upon request. She offers her products to her friends at work and to relatives. Her products are acquired from the cities of Lima and Huancayo.

Normal needs a loan of 2100 soles in order to buy shoes. She dreams of opening a boutique.

Click HERE to view Norma's previous loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase shoes

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.es:
La señora EUFEMIA B. P., tiene 58 años, vive en el distrito de LA ESPERANZA, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal JESÚS EN TI CONFIO
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5to de secundaria , tiene 5 hijos, todos mayores y ninguno depende económicamente de ella.
EUFEMIA se dedica a la crianza de animales como patos, pollos, gallinas para luego realizar actividades como: polladas, patadas, frejoladas, etc
Los fines de semana se dedica a la venta ambulatoria de  golosinas en el terminal terrestre de la salida a Lima.
Su primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invirtió en la compra de productos como: galletas, jugos, gaseosas, cigarrillo, caramelos, etc para vender ambulatoriamente en el terminal terrestre de la salida a Lima
Este crédito de 2,000 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de más animales menores para criar y organizar sus actividades.  La mitad del préstamo lo piensa invertir en otro negocio que lo rrealiza en sociedad con un familiar (fabricación de ladrillos).
EUFEMIA sueña con tener éxito en la fabricación y venta de los ladrillos ya que eso la ayudaría a obtener mayor ganancia de dinero. Más adelante piensa dedicarse solo a ello.
texts.en:
Sra. Eufemia B. P. is 58 years old. She lives in the District of La Esperanza, Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad – Perú. She belongs to the Communal Bank “Jesús En Ti Confio”.

This entrepreneur completed her education through the 5th year of secondary school. She has 5 adult children.

Eufemia raises animals such as ducks, chickens, and Cornish hens. She later prepares the birds using different methods such roasting, baking, in stews, etc. On the weekends, she is a traveling candy vendor at the bus terminal and sells to passengers headed to Lima. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to buy products such as cookies, juices, sodas, cigarettes, caramels, and other products that she could sell at the bus terminal.

She is now requesting a loan of 2000 soles to purchase additional small animals for breeding. Half of her loan will be used to enter a partnership that will invest in a relative’s brick business.

Eufemia hopes to have success with manufacturing and selling bricks because she will be able to earn more money. Later, she intends to devote all of her time into that business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase additional animals for breeding & invest in a brick business

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy e es socia del Banco Comunal Amaquella que significa No seas Flojo en quechua.
Nancy es soltera, tiene 35 años y 2 hijos, Nancy tiene un restaurante - polleria llamada Mayela en un local alquilado ubicado en una avenida céntrica, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de 4 personas.
Nancy necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar y leche.
Los sueños de Nancy son que sus hijos sean profesionales y tener otra sucursal.

loans.use: Para la compra de arroz, azúcar y leche.

loans.name: Rosa Victoria

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal Amaquella que significa No seas Flojo en quechua.
Rosa es viuda, tiene 61 años y 4 hijos, Rosa venD. cosméticos por catalogo que ofrece a sus amigos y familiares, además Rosa venD. comida típica los días sábados y domingos.
Rosa necesita un préstamo D. 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. cosméticos.
Los sueños D. Rosa son tener una farmacia y un restaurante.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Communal Bank Amaquella (which means “Don’t Be Lazy” in Quecha). She is 61 years old, widowed, and has 4 children.

Rosa sells cosmetics by catalog and offers her products to her friends and relatives. She also sells traditional food on Saturdays and Sundays.

Rosa needs a loan of 1500 soles in order to buy cosmetics. She dreams of opening a pharmacy and a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Musa's Group

texts.en:
G. Musa is the leader of his lending group in Kayunga and is married with six children aged 16 – 2 years. He has had a business tailoring and selling clothes in Kavule for twenty-nine years. He deals in finished (ready-made clothes) and unfinished clothes (those he makes himself), and in a week, he is able to make 40,000/= as profits.

Musa has a business policy of having customer-friendly prices so that he will be able to sell more. His plan is to turn his business into a tailoring school and improve on the quality of his family life by educating his children and training them in his trade.

Musa needs a loan to be able to buy new materials for the business so as to boost the business more. He is a hard working and friendly man and this has brought him reliable customers.

loans.use: To buy new clothing materials for his business

loans.name: Ropolon Group

texts.en:
These people are Hassan S. T. and Fatu C.. They call their group Ropolon, named after the village of the group’s leader.  They are local entrepreneurs in the town of Magburaka, about fifteen miles from Makeni in northern Sierra Leone. This is the fourth time they’ve received a loan through SMT. Previous loans have had meaningful impacts on the lives of these borrowers. They were able to use the proceeds to pay their children’s school fees.  They’re also able to feed and clothe themselves and their children with the income generated from the loans.   They are requesting a loan of Le 2,600,000 to buy more goods to add to their businesses.

Hassan S. T. (left) is the leader of the group. He is forty-one years of age. He was born in a village called Ropolon about two miles from Magburaka town.  He is married with four children between the ages of ten and twelve. Hassan has been selling ready-to-wear-clothes for the past ten years now.

loans.use: Invest in his business

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.en:
Eusebia A. has been working with Esperanza International in her hometown of San Pedro de Macoris, where there is infrequent electricity and unreliable access to running water (none of which is potable), for over 5 loan cycles. She has proven herself to be a successful entrepreneur, "graduating" to the level of individual loans from the group solidarity program. With this individual loan, Eusebia plans to expand her inventory in her business selling non-prescription medicine to her community from her house and in the street. In particular, Eusebia plans to purchase vitamins, pain relievers and digestive aids. 

Eusebia was inspired to start her business when she realized that many times people in her community had to travel far to get simple over-the-counter medicines they needed to improve their day-to-day lives. One can imagine what "a headache" it is to board a hot, overcrowded, and noisy bus to go to town center to buy medicine to cure the headache you already had. Sadly, Eusebia has a good deal of experience with lack of access to medicine as, in addition to raising her two children as a single mother, she cares for her elderly diabetic mother. Eusebia says that sometimes it can be very hard to find the proper medicine for her mother.

Despite these difficulties Eusebia has a great deal of hope for the future. With her past loans she says that she has been able to increase her business while making minor improvements in her home life such as buying a "moto" (not a scooter per se but a far cry from a motorcycle in the American sense) to transport her family. With her new loan, she plans to continue increasing the size of her business and using the profits to make improvements to her home such as fixing the leaking roof, provide a bed for her children, and purchasing a washing machine to lessen her domestic work burden. Finally, Eusebia is currently pursuing pharmacological studies at the local university with the goal of one day opening a full-service pharmacy in her neighborhood. She believes that by working with Esperanza, staying true to God, and working hard, she can achieve this objective. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: buying more medicines including pain relievers, vitamins, and digestive aids

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To process fish products

loans.name: Abdul Malik's Group

texts.en:
Abdul Malik M. is the leader of his lending group in Kayunga. He is a responsible married man with 10 children aged 12 – 2 years, and he cares for 3 dependents. He has had a business selling new and old clothes by moving around to daily markets around Kayunga and Jinja for 5 years. As a result, he makes 40,000/= in profit a week.

Abdul says he has been successful in business because he sells a variety of clothing, and his plan is to see to it that he can secure a place so that his business is stationed there instead of moving around all the time. He also works so hard so that he can continue to pay school fees for all his children and dependents. He needs a loan to be able to stock his business with more clothes like hijabs (women's head covering) for the season. He is a hard-working man, ready to hit the sky.

loans.use: Restocking his business with more clothes for the season

loans.name: Honest Group

texts.en:
These people are Kadiatu K., Fatmata K., and Mabinty K.. They called their group 'Honest Group'. This will be the fourth loan these entrepreneurs are receiving from SMT. Previous loans have created a huge and a very significant impact into the lives and living standards of these borrowers. Having repaid their last loan successfully, they are again asking for a new loan of Le 800,000 for each to further strengthen their businesses.

Kadiatu K. (left) is the leader of this group. Kadiatu is age forty-seven, married to a businessman; they have four children. One of her children has just sat to the West Africa Senior Secondary Schools Examinations, two are in Junior Secondary School III, and the last is in class four. Kadiatu sells cooked rice and has been in this business for over thirty years now. With this loan, she will be able to buy cooking ingredients like rice and palm oil (the most popular cooking oil) wholesale.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca I. is from the village of Laturan, Libona Bukidnon. She is 64 years old. Francisca is married and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Francisca owns and operates a specialized retail business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling products such as dried fish in the local community. Francisca has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Francisca joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Francisca has successfully repaid a previous loan of 16,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Francisca is requesting a new loan of 18,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Francisca from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is forty-six years old. He is married and has four children, two sons and two daughters, who are all still in school. He works very hard to be able to provide for his family. John lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. He is a school proprietor. He has from nursery to the kindergarten levels. John has been in business for barely a year now. He says he has female teachers who look after the children. John wants a loan to buy equipment like furniture and teaching and learning aids, etc. He is hopeful to develop the school to higher levels.

loans.use: To buy academic equipment

loans.name: Christopher's Group

texts.en: K. Christopher is a hard working and determined man with a family of 4 children as he cares for two dependants. All his children are school going and he works tirelessly to ensure that he completes his children’s fees on time. He has a retail shop business where he sells general merchandise in Kungu – Kavule for 10 years and he is happy that he is able to make 100,000/= as profits a week. Christopher wants to turn his retail shop into a wholesale shop in future so that he can increase his profitability and take care of his family better. He needs a loan to be able to add it in his business as working capital so that his business can run smoothly.

loans.use: Restocking his retail shop with more goods for increased profitability.

loans.name: Komyeneh Group

texts.en:
These people are Hawanatu T., Memunatu S., and Sampha T.. They named their group Komyeneh. This will be the first loan these entrepreneurs are receiving from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, their businesses will expand and profit margins will also increase. Consequently, their living standard will improve. In this way they will be able to better look after themselves and their children in terms of feeding, clothing, and educating them.

Hawanatu (right) is the leader of the group. Hawanatu is twenty-seven years of age. She was born in Magburaka town in northern Sierra Leone. She is married to a businessman and they have one child who is not of school-going age. Hawanatu sells cigarettes, mints, batteries, Vaseline, milk, cocoa, etc. Hawanatu has seven years of experience in this business.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is thirty-six years old. She is widowed and has given birth to four children, two sons and two daughters, who are all still in school. She works very hard to be able to provide for the family. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. She is a petty trader.

Beatrice is into the palm oil production business. She supplies to retailers in her community. She procures the palm fruits from nearby communities. Beatrice has been in business for three years now and wants a loan to buy palm fruits in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy palm nuts in bulk

loans.name: Baltazara

texts.en:
Baltazara E., 66-years old is engaged in buy and sell business and piggery. Currently, she has a sow and in the coming months she is expecting piglets where she could sell at a higher cost to support her family.

She would like to ask a loan of Php 18,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. she will use the loan to finance her business like buying feed to grow pigs. 

She likes the CEVI credit services because it has low interest rate. She said that her loan is really a help.

loans.use: business financing

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi is forty-eight years old. She is married and has given birth to six children, four sons and two daughters, who are all still in school. She works very hard to help her husband provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. She is a petty trader.

Esi sells cereals. She sells them in her community and also supplies them to other food vendors. She procures the cereals from nearby communities. Esi has been in business for six years and wants a loan to buy cereals in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy cereals in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Processing seafood

loans.name: Tanenkasu Group

texts.en:
This is Isatu K., Aminat T. and Mummy T.. They named their group Tanenkasu. This will be the fourth loan they are receiving from SMT/Kiva. Previous loans have been very helpful to these entrepreneurs. With previous loans, their businesses expanded, their profit margin increased and consequently, their standard of living also improve. They have repaid their last loan successfully and they now want a new loan. They are requesting a new loan of Le 1,500,000.00 to further strengthen their businesses.

Isatu K.(middle) is the leader of the group. Isatu was born in Magburaka town, in northern Sierra Leone, fifty-five years ago. She is married with three children and two foster children. All of her children are now grown-ups, her foster children are still attending schools.  Isatu sells market food and has been a businesswoman since she was a child. With this loan, she will further expand her business.

loans.use: Invest her business

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es: Doña Gloria S. de 45 años de edad, su negocio es la venta de ropa, zapatos, cosméticos y la venta de frutas, verdura, el cual inicio con fondos propios y la iniciativa de crecer en la economía como en su vida en la dependencia de su esposo, el trabaja como  radiotécnico, residen en el barrio Memorial Sandino en la capital de Managua, con un hijo de 11 años que estudia la primaria, en Afodenic lleva nueve ciclo trabajando el cual ha sido de mucho beneficio ya que ha invertido en el  negocio como en las mejoras de su casa. Con este préstamo invertirá en la compra de ropa variada, verduras y frutas para ofrecer a sus clientes una gama de variedad para darles un buen servicio y poder obtener mejores ventas.
texts.en:
Gloria S. sells clothing, shoes, and cosmetics, as well as fruits and vegetables. She is 45 years old, and lives with her husband, a radio technician, and their 11-year-old son who attends elementary school. They live in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood of Managua.

Gloria started her business with her own savings and her desire to achieve both economically and in her family. She has, since then, taken out and repaid nine loans with AFODENIC. These have been very useful both to build the business and to improve their house. With this loan, she will invest in a variety of clothing and fruits and vegetables in order to offer her customers a wide variety of products. This will be a service to the customers and will lead to increased sales.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing and various fruits

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is thirty-nine years old. She is married and has given birth to seven children, three sons and four daughters who are all still in school. She works very hard to help her husband provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. She is a petty trader.

Stella is into the palm oil production business. Stella supplies to retailers in her community. She procures the palm fruits from nearby communities. She has been in business for four years now and wants a loan to buy palm fruits in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy palm nuts

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es: Karla Patricia R. S. tiene 29 años de edad. Es casada y vive con sus 2 hijos. Desde hace mas de 3 años que se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Ella es una joven muy emprendedora y siempre se ha dedicado a trabajar muy fuertemente. Anteriormente se dedica a estudiar, pero debido a las circunstancias  tenía que generar más ingresos a su familia ya que sus hijos necesitaban el pan de cada día y además no podía seguir estudiando, por lo que decide hacerse cargo de este negocio ya que le generaba ciertas ganancias. Ella solicita este financiamiento para invertirlo en capital de trabajo como pantalones, camisas, faldas, camisolas, perfumes, cremas y colonias. Su deseo en un futuro es lograr establecer su propio tienda.
texts.en:
Karla Patricia R. S. is 29 years old, married and lives with her 2 children. For the past 3 years, she has sold general merchandise. She is an enterprising young woman who always dedicates herself to working extremely hard. She used to be a student, but her circumstances dictated that she start working so that she could generate an income to meet her children’s daily needs. As a result, she quit school and started this business.

Karla is requesting a loan to use as operating capital to buy trousers, shirts, skirts, camisoles, perfumes, crèmes, and colognes. She hopes to open her own store in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Abigail

texts.en:
Abigail is 31 years old. She is married and has given birth to six children, five sons and one daughter who are all still in school. She works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. 

She is a hairdresser by profession. Abigail has her shop by the roadside in her community. She has some apprentices under training. Abigail has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy working materials like artificial hair, creams, shampoo, etc., to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy hairdressing materials

loans.name: Stand Strong Group

texts.en:
This is Mahawa K., Zainab K. and Adamsay S.. They named their group Stand Strong. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva. This loan will create a tremendous impact into the businesses and personal lives of these entrepreneurs. They will be able to expand their businesses, make better profit and consequently improving their businesses and standard of living. 

Mahawa K. (middle) is the leader of this group. Mahawa is thirty-two years of age. She was born in Magburaka town, in northern Sierra Leone. Mahawa’s husband works for a non-governmental organization and the two of them have three children. One of her children is in Junior Secondary School I, the other in class five and the last is in class I. Mahawa sells dishes, rice, palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil) and many other types of locally produce food items. She has been in the business for many years.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina D. is from the village of Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 43 years old. Josefina is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Josefina operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing rooms for rent to local community members and students. Josefina has been engaged in her business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 15,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2006, Josefina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josefina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 23,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in renovating her rooms-for-rent business. Josefina is requesting a new loan of 26,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to repair her rooms for rent. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Josefina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the rooms of her house to cater to more boarders, especially students from other communities. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to repair the rooms for rent

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Isolda Graciela

texts.es: Doña Isolda de 49 años de edad, reside en el barrio 380 en la capital de Managua, tiene un hijo de 22 años estudiante universitario, su negocio es un caber el cual esta administrando, anteriormente tenia un taxi lo vendió y puso el caber el cual hasta ahora le ha ido bien ya que es visitado por muchos jóvenes, los problemas es cuando se va luz eléctrica y no puede atender es una perdida de entrada económica. Con este préstamos comprara una computadora nueva para dar cada día un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Da las gracias Afodenic por los préstamo que le han dado este es su séptima ciclo el cual ha administrado en mejoras a su vivienda como en su negocio.

loans.use: Comprar computadora

loans.name: Hadijah's Group

texts.en:
N. Hadijah is the leader of her lending group in Kayunga. She is a 47-year-old widow taking care of her 11 children plus four other dependents. She's had a business of selling food, mostly matooke (medium size green fruit like a plantain), at the Kayunga Central market for two years and is able to make weekly profits amounting to 30,000. She buys the matooke mostly from villages far and near and she ensures that she has quality produce in her stall for sale. 

She has a dream of starting up a poultry business whereby she will be selling the chicken herself from the market hence maximizing profits. At the moment, Hadijah needs a loan to be able to stock more matooke for enlarging her business. This will enable her to save enough for her children’s education and welfare.

loans.use: Buying more matooke for increased stock hence more sales and profitability

loans.name: Julia Margarita

texts.es: Doña Julia R. de 30 años de edad, reside en el barrio Vila roma en la capital de Managua, madre soltera de dos hijos, vive junto con su madre el cual tienen en sociedad una pulpería que administran desde hace diez años, inicio con poco productos y poco dinero, pero han logrado salir adelante. Entre otros productos vende leña, frutas y verduras. Con este crédito lo quiere para infraestructura en la compra de materiales de construcción del área del negocio para dar una mejor presentación y tener mejor comodidad. Sus planes es seguir invirtiendo en la venta, apoyar siempre a su mama y a sus hijos. Da las gracias a la institución por dar la oportunidad de mejorar sus vidas económicamente.
texts.en:
Ms. Julia R. is 30 years old and the single mother of two. She lives with her mother in the Vila roma section of the capital city of Managua. They’ve been running a general store together for the past 10 years. They started their business with little money and a few items, but have managed make it successful. She sells a variety of products, including firewood, fruits, and vegetables. She will use this loan to buy construction materials to make her place of business more comfortable and improve its image. She plans to continue to invest in her business and to always support her mother and children. She is thankful for giving her the opportunity to help her improve their lives economically.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo R., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction Materials

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is 45 years old, married and has four children, two sons and two daughters, all of whom are still in school. She and her husband work very hard to provide for their family, which lives in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. Lucy makes a living selling soap, both in her town and in nearby communities. She has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk so that she can expand her business.

loans.use: To buy soap to sell to her customers

loans.name: Liberata

texts.en:
Liberata T. lives in the village of Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 69 years old, married and has four grown children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (or variety) retail store that sells mainly food and products people use daily. Liberata has been in this business for more than six years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from her work.

In 2006, Liberata joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and business opportunities. She has successfully repaid five previous loans from HSPFI, and is requesting a new loan of 21,000 PHP to expand her business. She plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to increase her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to expand her business

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Maria Felix

texts.es: Maria Felix P. tiene 38 años de edad. Su actividad económica es el destace de cerdo. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica este negocio. Por lo que es una mujer muy luchadora y que desde muy joven ha tenido que trabajar para mantener a sus 2 hijos. Ella dio inicio a este negocio por su suegra ya que presentaba problemas de salud y ella sabia elaborar muy bien los nacatamales y además conocía muy bien la venta de los derivados. Por lo que más tarde observa que con este negocio logra obtener los suficientes ingresos para  salir adelante. El motivo del financiamiento es par capital de trabajo para la compra de cerdos, leña, maíz para la elaboración de los nacatamales. Su mayor sueño es obtener un vehículo que le ayude a movilizarse.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Stombroch Group

texts.en:
Here are Aminata M. K., Isatu B., Kadiatu K. and Fatmata S.. They are small scale business people base in Magburaka town, in northern Sierra Leone. They named their group Stombroch. This will be the first loan these entrepreneurs are receiving from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make better profit and improve on their standard of living. 

Aminata B. (middle), age forty-five is the leader of this group. Aminata was born in Magburaka town; she is married with three children – two are already grown-ups and one is in Junior Secondary School II. Aminata sells fire-wood. She has been in this business for five years now.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Zorayda Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Zorayda tiene 44 años de edad, casada. Reside en el barrio Memorial Sandino en la capital de Managua, procreó dos hijos, que ahora tienen 12 y 14 años de edad que estudian la primaria. Ella trabaja de regente de Farmacia en una empresa ONG, y en tiempos libres vende cosméticos y prendas  de plata, ella comenzó con el deseo de obtener otros ingresos para sastifacer las necesidades de su hogar. Sus planes es poder tener su propia farmacia que espera en días no  muy lejano tener. Con este crédito comprara materiales de construcción para construir un muro y poder tener mejor seguridad y presentación de su vivienda. Se siente contenta por el apoyo de la institución ya que es su décimo ciclo el cual ha invertido en negocio y mejoras para su hogar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Zorayda is 44 years old and married. She lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood in Managua, the capital. She has two sons, 12 and 14 years old who are in elementary school. She works as a manager of a pharmacy in an NGO. As the needs of her home increased, she sought other means of income and in her free time she sells cosmetics and silver jewelry. She soon plans to open her own pharmacy. With this loan she will buy construction materials to build a wall to have better security and presentation of her house. She’s very happy with the support of the microfinance institution as it is the tenth loan and has invested in her business and in improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to build a wall

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Processing seafood

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia is 55 years old, married, and has four children, three sons and one daughter, all of whom are still in school. She and her husband work very hard to support their family, which lives in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. Felicia makes a living selling undergarments for women in her community and in nearby towns. She buys her goods in the capital, Accra. She has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to buy more goods in bulk to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell to her customers

loans.name: Rukia's Group

texts.en: L. Rukia leads a loan group in Kayunga. She is 28 years old and the mother of four children, all of whom are in primary school. Rukia runs a restaurant in Kayunga North that has been in operation for six months. Ever since she opened this restaurant, her profits have increased slowly and she is now generating a good income. Clients are few only during the rainy season, and her dream is both to enlarge her restaurant and build a house with her husband so that they do not have to pay rent. Rukia plans to use her portion of this loan to buy more seats for her restaurant and make it larger.

loans.use: To buy more seats for her restaurant and make it larger

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose A. lives in Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 31 years old, married and has two school-aged children. She makes a living by selling flowers to tourists and neighbors. Rose has been in this business for over seven years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from her work.

In 2007, Rose joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to improve her life and her business opportunities. She has successfully repaid five previous loans, and is applying for a new one to build a stall of her own where she could display flowers for sale. She plans to use the additional income made possible by this loan to support the education of children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to build a stall where she can display and sell her flowers

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is forty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to six children, four sons and two daughters, who are all still in school. Janet works very hard to help her husband provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. She is a petty trader.

Janet sells smoked fish. She hawks to sell in her community. She procures the fish from nearby towns at moderate prices. Janet has been in business for over fifteen years now and wants a loan to buy fish in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy smoked fish in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Dyeing cloth, commerce, and processing seafood

loans.name: Claudia Cordelia

texts.es: Claudia Cordelia S. tiene 55 años. Es una mujer casada. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es una pulpería. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Ella decide iniciar este negocio porque su esposo y ella no tenían un ingreso estable, por lo que deciden establecer una pulpería que le ayude a sufragar los gastos de su familia. Es por esto que solicita el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de papel, arroz, frijoles, jugos, jabón, detergente, aceite entre otros. Su deseo es que logre alcanzar todas sus metas propuestas.
texts.en:
Claudia Cordelia S. is 55 years old, married, and has 2 dependent children. She has been operating a grocery store for the past 4 years. She started this business because she and her husband did not have a steady source of income, so they decided selling groceries would be a good way to help cover their living expenses.

For this reason, Claudia is requesting a loan to use as operating capital to buy paper, rice, beans, juices, soap, detergent, oil, and other products. She hopes to succeed in meeting all of her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is 29 years old and is married with one child. She runs a small home-based grocery shop. She also has a food stand at a local company, where she sells lunch daily to its workers. Rosa’s husband works as a bricklayer. She can count on his support for her business ventures.

Rosa has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for three years and is a member of the communal bank “Madres Coraje” (Mothers with Courage). Rosa plans to use this loan of 1000 soles to buy products for her shop as well as food items, including oil and rice, for her lunch business.

Rosa’s goal is to improve and grow her grocery business. She also wants to someday have a home-based restaurant.

loans.use: To buy items for a grocery shop and a lunch business

loans.name: Mariela Del Carmen

texts.es: Mariela del Carmen Gutiérrez R. es madre soltera tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. La ubicación de su negocio es en su casa de habitación. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado salir adelante, para brindarle a su familia el pan de cada día. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de golosinas en general, pan, refrescos naturales, jugos, galletas, gaseosas y granos básicos. El deseo de Mariela es mejorar su condición económica.
texts.en:
Mariela del Carmen Gutiérrez R. is a single mother with 2 dependent children. She has been operating a grocery store out of her home for the past 5 years. With hard work, she has been able to get ahead and provide for her family’s daily needs.

She is requesting a loan to use as operating capital for the purchase of candy, bread, natural beverages, juices, cookies, sodas, and basic grains. Mariela hopes to improve her financial condition.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Llanilda

texts.en:
Llanilda D. is 30 years old and is married with two children.  Llanilda sells vegetables outside the main market of Yarinacocha, a small suburb of the city of Pucallpa.  Her husband works as a motorcycle taxi driver.

Llanilda has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for four years and belongs to the communal bank “Madres Coraje” (Mothers with Courage).  She used her very first loan of 300 soles (about $100) to purchase vegetables for her business.  Llanilda plans to invest this loan of 1000 soles in maintenance work for the two motorcycle taxis that she and her husband own.  Llanilda is pleased to be able to use her loans to also support her husband in his business.  

Since she began working with Manuela Ramos, Llanilda has always been punctual in her loan payments.  Llanilda enjoys the business education sessions given by the organization’s loan officers at the monthly meetings of her communal bank.

Llanilda’s goal is to eventually have her own spare parts shop for motorbikes and motorcycle taxis.

loans.use: Maintenance work for two motorcycle taxis

loans.name: Lucila Migdalia

texts.es: La Señora Lucila Migdalia Munguía Martínez tiene la edad de 45 años. Es una mujer casada. Tiene 3 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de ropa nueva. Hace más de 4 años, anteriormente Lucila se dedicaba a la venta de cosméticos, ya que tenía que buscar le medio para sacar adelante a sus 3 hijos. Actualmente la ubicación de su negocio es de manera ambulante. Por lo que ya tiene muchos clientes. Ella solicita este financiamiento con el fin de compra ropa, para caballeros, para damas y para niños. Su mayor sueño es obtener otro medio de ingresos como es una pulpería.
texts.en:
Sra. Lucila Migdalia Munguía Martínez is 45 years old, married, and has 3 dependent children. She has been selling new clothing for more than 4 years. Lucila previously sold cosmetics because she needed a way to support her children.

She currently sells her merchandise door-to-door and already has many customers. Lucila is requesting a loan to buy clothes for men, women, and children. She dreams of finding another source of income, such as opening a grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Moses' Group

texts.en: N. M. is the leader of this group in Kayunga. He is a responsible man and married with seven children and he takes care of 4 orphans, all in school. He is a farmer involved in the growing of maize, beans, coffee, and bananas, and he has been our client for four years. The loans have really helped him in his crop-growing, especially with manpower, enabling him to get enough profits that he uses partly to pay the children’s school expenses and invest more in his farm. His fellow group members agree that the loans have been instrumental in their families’ development and business transformation. M. needs a loan to be able buy higher quality seeds for planting during this rainy season so as to get better yields.

loans.use: Buying quality seeds and employing manpower on his farm

loans.name: Kossivi

texts.fr: Soudeur expérimenté et maîtrisant les rouages de la forge depuis 2001, cet homme marié et ayant 02 enfants à sa charge sollicite un prêt de WAGES pour acheter 21 tôles, 50 baguettes et 30 tubes pour agrandir ses activités. Il a sa forge située à Agoè Anomé, l’un des quartiers périphériques de Lomé. Il est très apprécié de sa clientèle qui lui fait beaucoup confiance pour son travail toujours bien fait et conçu
texts.en:
Kossivi A. is married and the father of two dependent children. He works in his own smithy located in Agoè Anomé, a suburb of Lomé. He has been an experienced blacksmith since 2001 and perfectly knows the workings of his forge. His customers appreciate and trust him very much for his good and well designed work.

Kossivi applies to WAGES for a loan to expand his activity. He will buy 21 iron sheets, 50 metal bars and 30 pipes.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy iron sheets, metal bars and pipes for his smithy

loans.name: Ayaba Akofa

texts.fr: Depuis un an, cette dame s’est lancée dans la vente de produits cosmétiques au grand marché de Lomé. Marié et père d’un enfant, il sollicite un prêt de WAGES pour l’achat de 20 cartons de produits cosmétiques de toutes sortes, 10 cartons de fournitures scolaires et autres produits. Elle vend à une clientèle assez diversifiée. Ce commerce lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ayabe Akofa N. is married and the mother of a child. A year ago she started a business selling cosmetics to a diversified clientele at the Great Market in Lomé. This business enables her to provide for her family. Ayabe applies to WAGES for a loan to buy 20 boxes of all kinds of cosmetics, 10 boxes of school stationery and other products.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics

loans.name: Los Lirios 1 And 4 Group

texts.en:
Evelyn F. is a valued associate of Esperanza and she is entering her second loan cycle after coming to Esperanza because of its easy payment facilities. Evelyn is from L. Alcarrizos, an industrial town outsiD. of Santo Domingo, where power and water utilities are unreliable and sparse. She lives with her husband and three children. Her house serves both as her business and her small living space. 

Evelyn business is a beauty salon and it has been successful, however, unreliable water from the utility company means that clients may sometimes be turned away or worse, have to wait for hours to wash hair products out of their hair. Evelyn's plan therefore is to purchase a water pump to prevent this from happening and attract more business. In addition, her dream is to use to use the new revenue from new clients to build a second story to her home so that her shop can be on the bottom floor and she can live upstairs. Also, since her home is also her business she notes that the pump will have the added benefit of providing her family with consistent running water. She thanks everyone for their support.

loans.use: A water pump

loans.name: Ruben Antonio

texts.es: Rubén Antonio R. O. tiene 60 años. Es un hombre casado. Tiene 1 hijo a su cargo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es brindar el servicio de transporte. Su negocio dio inicio hace 18 años, por lo que anteriormente él se dedicaba a conducir camiones, por lo que con el poco esfuerzo que logro realizar logro comprar un camión y así obtener sus propios clientes, el es un hombre muy luchador y le gusta trabajar de manera muy humilde. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para proporcionarle mejoras a su camión y comprar ciertos repuestos que le hacen falta. Su mayor sueño es lograr que todos sus planes se lleven a cabo.
texts.en:
Rubén Antonio R. O. is 60 years old. He is a married man and is responsible for one son. He is involved in transportation services. His business began 18 years ago. Before this, he used to drive trucks. Eventually, with some effort, he was able to buy his own truck and built his own clientele. He is a hard worker. The credit that he is requesting is for working capital in order to improve the condition of his truck and also purchase some needed parts for it. His biggest dream is to achieve all his goals.

Translated from Spanish by Veronica Martino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Maria Auxuliadora

texts.es: Maria Auxiliadora S. B. tiene 45 años. Es una mujer muy luchadora y trabajadora. Ella es madre soltera y tiene 5 hijos. Hace más de 30 años que se dedica a la venta de ropa. Doña Maria inicio este negocio con mucho esfuerzo por lo que trabajo desde muy joven anteriormente se dedicaba a ofrecer los servicios de planchar ropa y lavar, en diferentes lugares ofreció este servicio por medio de sus propios clientes quienes la recomendaban por que desempeñaba de buena forma estas labores. Pero lamentablemente solo pudo realizar este trabajo por 2 años, debido a que tenía atender a sus hijos. Por lo que decide comenzar con la venta de ropa y dedicarse solamente a este negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima. El sueño de Maria es poseer su propio negocio en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Maria Auxiliadora S. B. is 45 years old. She is a hard-working woman. She is a single mother of five children. She has been involved in the sale of clothing for over thirty years. Ms. Maria began this line of business with hard effort when she was very young. Prior to this, she used to offer laundry and ironing services to her customers, who in turn, recommended her highly due to her work ethic. Unfortunately, she was only able to do this for two years since she had to care for her children. This is why she became involved in the sale of clothing. The credit she is requesting is for working capital to purchase materials for her business. Maria’s dream is to have her own store in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Veronica Martino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Nuevo Encuentro Group

texts.es:
Frida C. vende cosméticos en la feria “16 de Julio” en su  puesto propio hace 10 años, ella necesita el préstamo para comprar mercadería. Frida es integrante de la Asociación Comunal  “Nuevo Encuentro” que a su vez pertenece al Centro Focal “Alto Lima”. Las  demás integrantes también tienen sus propios negocios como la costura de chamarras, faldas, tejido de chompas y  venta de verduras, repuestos de auto. Y necesitan el préstamo para la compra de materia prima (tela, hilo) y mercadería (verduras y repuestos).

Este grupo se caracteriza por ser unidas y alegres, además les gusta aprender y llevar a sus hijos al consultorio.
texts.en:
Frida C. sells cosmetics at the 16 de Julio market and has had her own booth for ten years. She needs the loan to buy merchandise. Frida is a member of the Nuevo Encuentro Communal Association which is a part of the Alto Lima Focal Center. The other members also have their own businesses such as sewing jackets and skirts, knitting sweaters, and selling vegetables and automotive spare parts. They need the loan to buy raw materials (cloth, thread) and merchandise (vegetables and spare parts). This group is notable for being close and happy. Also, they like to learn and to take their kids to work with them.

Translated from Spanish by Kristina Howe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Raw Materials and Merchandise

loans.name: Alcira

texts.es:
La señora  ALCIRA L. V., tiene 60 años, vive en el distrito de Larco , provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal MANATIAL DE VIDA
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5to de secundaria , tiene 4 hijos y ninguno depende economicamente de ella.
ALCIRA se dedica a la preparación y venta de chocotejas (chocolates), los cuales reparte en diferentes bodegas, tiendas, clínicas, oficinas, y hospitales
Su primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invirtió en la compra de productos como: chocolate en barra, mantequilla, colorantes, pasas, guindones, manjar blanco, pecanas, moldes, etc
Este crédito de 1,000 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de mas productos para elaborar sus  chocolates (chocolate, manjar blanco, pecanas, etc.).
Paralelamente se dedica a la preparación y ventas de tamales (comida criolla) en un local que tiene su esposo en sociedad con su cuñado (en el centro de Trujillo) .
ALCIRA sueña con  tener un restaurante que le permita tener mejores ingresos.

loans.use: compra de productos para elaborar sus  chocolates.

loans.name: Carmen Jose

texts.es: El señor Carmen José J. Solís tiene  36 años de edad, es casado y tiene 4 hijos los cuales son menores de edad. El señor J. Solís posee una pulpería. Don Carmen J. dio inicio a su negocio hace 2 años  ya que tuvo la necesidad de brindar mayores ingresos para sustentar a su familia. El crédito será invertido en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercancías, para su pulpería. Cabe señalarse, el señor también labora como maestro en una escuela de primaria, lo cual principalmente le ayuda brindar mantenimiento a su familia. Su sueño es llegar a engrandecer su negocio y también mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, además de brindarle mejoras a su casa.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Manuel Jesus

texts.es: Manuel Jesús Martínez L. tiene 72 años. Es un hombre casado. Tiene 6 hijos pero ninguno depende de él. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la compra y venta de ropa. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. A pesar de la edad tan avanzada que Manuel posee le gusta recorrer las diferentes calles ofreciendo sus productos. Por lo que es un hombre muy responsable y le gusta proporcionarles a sus hijos lo necesario en sus estudios y en vestimenta. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa como faldas, vestidos, camisetas, pantalones y shorts. El deseo de Manuel es seguir creciendo con su negocio.
texts.en:
Mr. Manuel Jesús is 72 years old. He is married. He has six children, none of which are dependent on him. He works buying and selling clothes. He has been working in this business for more than five years. In spite of his advanced age, he has the energy to travel around different streets selling his products. He is a responsible man and he likes to provide his children with what they need to study and to dress. He is asking for a loan for working capital to buy clothes like skirts, dresses, T-shirts, pants and shorts. Manuel wishes to continue growing his business.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Victoria Eva

texts.es:
La señora VICTORIA EVA L. V.  V. D. S., tiene 63 años, vive en el distrito D. Larco , provincia D. Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal MANANTIAL D. VIDA
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5to D. secundaria , tiene 4 hijos, solo uno depenD. económicamente D. ella ya que se encuentra estudiando  Estomatología en la Universidad.
VICTORIA se dedica a la preparación y venta D. tamales (comida D. la zona).
Su primer crédito D. 300 nuevos soles lo invirtió en la compra D. insumos como: harina, mantequilla , aceituna, etc
Este crédito D. 700 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra D. mas productos para  preparar sus tamales, como aceitunas, mantequilla, harina.
Pero actualmente se encuentra descansando ya que estuvo internada en el hospital por problemas D. bronquios y asma.
VICTORIA sueña con obtener más capital y asociarse con su sobrino y dedicarse a la confección D. buzos escolares ya que él gano una licitación para la fabricación D. buzos escolares 2010.

loans.use: compra de productos para  preparar sus tamales (comida de la zona)

loans.name: Oscar Manuel

texts.es: Oscar Manuel M. M. tiene 34 años de edad. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadearía en general. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. Cuando el tomo la iniciativa de comprar mercadería, pero debido a que su capital de trabajo era muy poco no podía comprar la variedad de productos necesarios para atraer más clientes, con la ayuda de un amigo que le facilito algo de dinero logro salir adelante e invertir en mas productos. El mayor desafío de Oscar fue dedicarles tiempo suficiente a su esposa y sus 2 hijos. Su deseo es poder mejorar los ingresos para su familia.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Angela Juana

texts.es: La señora Ángela Juana Chávez tiene 48 años de edad, ella posee un negocio que es una pulpería. El negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación, además de poseer este negocio trabaja como maestra de primaria lo cual le genera un ingreso extra a su a hogar, es madre de 3 hijos de los cuales 2 lograron coronar sus carreras y el tercero está estudiando, con la ayuda de su esposo ambos  han logrado salir adelante la señora está solicitando este financiamiento para aumentar su variedad de productos ella vive de manera humilde y cuenta con todos los servicios básicos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Angela is 48 years old. She owns a grocery business. This business is located in her house. In addition to this business she works as a primary school teacher This job generates extra income for her and her home. She is the mother of three children, two that have their own careers. The third one is a student. With the help of her husband, the couple has been able to progress. She is asking for a loan to increase the variety of products that she carries in her store. She lives simply and has all her basic needs.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Patrice

texts.en:
After twenty years in the industry, Patrice and her husband decided to open their own furniture showroom. Patrice says that the biggest challenge to her business has been not being able to display a wider variety of furniture in her showroom.

She recently learned about ACCION USA on the internet, applied for a loan, and has been approved. With their loan, Patricia and her husband are buying different varieties of furniture to make a unique and flavorful showroom, hopefully increasing their sales.

Patrice says that her greatest success in business is being able to offer her clients "no credit check" financing options, which has been very helpful during the economic downturn. They currently have two employees, but their goal is to increase business and one day make their store a household name.

loans.use: adding to their inventory of furniture

loans.name: Irene's Group

texts.en:
L. Irene is the leader of her lending group in Mukono. She is 30 years old and married with 2 children aged 9 and 7, both in primary school. She also helps to take care of her parents in the village who are sickly. She is very hard-working and has had a motor vehicle spare parts business in Kisekka market in Kampala for 7 years. She is able to make 200,000/= as weekly profits.

She started up her business in 2002 after being an employee earning a salary, but now she is the one who employs others. She is faced with a lot of competition, high rent costs, taxation, and high transport costs for bringing the spare parts to Kampala from Dubai.

Irene has a plan of starting her own reflector workshop so that she would be able to increase her income; and in future, she plans, together with her husband, to build commercial houses in their home area of Mukono. She needs a loan to be able to buy more spare parts that are currently missing in her shop. The profits will help in catering for her household including the children’s school fees and saving for future developments.

loans.use: Buying more spare parts for her business

loans.name: Ricardo Miguel

texts.es: El joven Ricardo Miguel D. Ramírez se dedica a la compra y venta leña. El vive con su padre que enviudo cuando el tenia 8 años de edad y comienza a trabajar para ayudar a su papa ya que tiene una hermana menor, y quieren que salga adelante. Además Ricardo está planeando sacar su bachillerato para salir adelante. Ya que desde muy joven le ha gustado ayudar a su papa. El un joven muy emprendedor y ayuda a sufragar los gastos de la familia y con los estudios de su hermana, ya que le está brindando la oportunidad de estudiar es por eso que tiene que trabajar muy duro. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima. Su mayor sueño es salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Ricardo Miguel D. Ramírez buys and sells wood. He lives with his father, who was widowed when Ricardo was eight. He started to work to help his father. Ricardo has a younger sister, and they want her to get ahead. Also, Ricardo is planning to get his high school degree in order to get ahead. Since he was very young he has liked helping his father. He is very entrepreneurial, and he helps with the family expenses and his sister’s education. He has to work very hard because of the educational opportunity being offered. The loan he is asking for is for working capital to buy raw material. His greatest dream is to get ahead with his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Chascañawi Group

texts.es:
La asociación denominada “Chascañawi” se reúne cada dos semanas en el centro focal Senkata, ubicado en la ciudad de El Alto, a la fecha cuenta con trece miembros los cuales han demostrado ser un grupo, muy organizado en cuanto a sus cuotas de crédito y actividades internas.
Existen diferentes negocios dentro la asociación, por ejemplo; venta de verduras, tejidos en macramé, Costura, Repostería, Herrería, venta de chuño y tunta (papas deshidratadas). La asociación Chascañawi precisa créditos para comprar mayor cantidad de productos.
texts.en:
The “Chascañawi” association gets together every two weeks in the Senkata center in the city of El Alto. To this date, they have 13 members who have demonstrated to be a very organized group in their loan quotas and internal activities.

They have different businesses in the association such as: selling groceries, macramé, sewing, a pastry shop, a blacksmith’s shop, and selling dehydrated potatoes. The Chascañawi association needs loans to buy more products.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy Products

loans.name: Isela Valeriana

texts.es: La señora Isela Valeriana L. V. ella tiene 32 años, es casada y tiene 1 hija la y es una menor de edad que todavía depende de ella. La señora tiene 3 años de tener una farmacia ubicada en su casa de habitación.  Ella empezó con un negocio de venta de comida. Luego a ella le gusto estudiar farmacología y de allí, cuando terminó la carrera decidió establecer una farmacia. El crédito será invertido en la compra de mayor cantidad de medicinas para su negocio en la farmacia. Su sueño siempre ha sido llegar a constituir el negocio como una empresa bien sólida, que brinde estabilidad económica para ella y para su familia en general.
texts.en:
Señora Isela Valeriana L. V. is 32 years old. She is married and has one daughter, who is still a dependent. For three years, this woman has run a pharmacy located in a room of her house. her first business was selling food. Later, she wanted to study pharmacology, and from there, when she finished the course, she decided to open a pharmacy. This loan will be used to buy large quantities of medicines for the pharmacy. Her dream has always been to come to establish this business as a solid venture that provides economic stability for her and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ismah's Group

texts.en: Ismah S. is the leader of his lending group in Mukono. He is a hard working boda boda cyclist in Mukono for a very long time and because of his down to earth nature, Ismah has a number of loyal customers that will always wait for him even if he has other customers to take. He is a father of four and is able to take care of his family using profits from his business. He now has a motorcycle of his own and he plans to have a fleet so that he can hire them out to his fellow youth in the same business. At the moment, he needs a loan to be able to buy another boda boda in addition to the savings from his previous loans.
