loans.use: Buying a motorcycle as a top up with the savings for increased profits.

loans.name: Katia

texts.en:
Katia M. D. is 36 years old and is married with four children.  She sells vegetables.  Katia’s husband works as a motorcycle taxi driver.  

Katia has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for three years and belongs to the communal bank “Madres Coraje” (Mothers with Courage).  Katia plans to invest this loan of 1000 soles in local agricultural products to sell at her vegetable stand.  Among other items, she will buy lemons, yucca, sweet peppers and cilantro at wholesale prices.  Since Katia first began working with Manuela Ramos, her business has grown bit by bit.  The organization’s short loan repayment periods enable her to have a good capital flow for her business.         

Katia’s goal is for her family to have their own motorcycle taxi.  (At the moment Katia’s husband is a driving a motorcycle taxi which belongs to his sister).

loans.use: Lemons, yuca, sweet peppers, cilantro and other vegetables to sell at a stand.

loans.name: Rebeca Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Rebeca del Socorro García  M. ella tiene 50 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos, los cuales los dos son mayores de edad. La señora García M. se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general de forma ambulante. Ella dio inicio a este negocio hace  16 años, debido a que quería brindar un mayor sustento a su familia. Ya que su esposo laboraba  pero no ganaba lo suficiente. Desde ese tiempo ella ha sabido manejar sus inventarios, de forma que ahora tiene un negocio bien establecido. Su crédito será invertido en la compra de mayor cantidad de cosméticos y de ropa, ya que actualmente tiene buenos pedidos. Su  esposo trabaja como chofer de un microbús de forma ambulante. Su sueño es llegar a tener una buena tienda en el mercado municipal que le brinde estabilidad económica a ella y a su familia en general.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is 29 years old and is married with two children.  She and her husband work together making and selling charcoal.  They live in the city of Pucallpa. 

Doris has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for a year and belongs to the communal bank “Madres Coraje” (Mothers with Courage).  She plans to invest this loan of 1000 soles in purchasing wood to make charcoal.  

Doris and her husband have large ovens for making charcoal 40 kilometers outside of Pucallpa, along the highway which links the city to the capital, Lima.  Doris has been investing in her charcoal business since she first began taking out loans from Manuela Ramos.  As a result, her business has grown and she and her husband now employ several people to help make their charcoal.  

Doris’s goal is to increase her production of charcoal in order to be able to sell in other cities.

loans.use: Wood to make charcoal.

loans.name: David's Group

texts.en: K. David is the leader of his lending group in Mukono. He is a hard-working man with many dreams to come true. He is a businessman with a business of selling green bananas from Mukono Central market. Before the loans, David only sold banana fingers but now also has bunches in his stock. He is grateful for the transformation that the loans have brought in his business and he sees the future is bright for him. He makes profit from his business, some of which he saves for business expansion and paying school fees for his 4 children. He bought a plot of land and he plans to construct a family house where his children and wife will find peace away from landlords. David needs a loan to help him buy more matooke (plantains) for resale.

loans.use: Buying more matooke (green bananas) for resale

loans.name: Jesus De Nazareth Group

texts.es:
Alberto M. M., (quien apreciamos en la fotografía ubicado al lado izquierdo), es Presidente del ALCOM “Jesús D. Nazareth” desD. hace un año, pero integra el grupo hace tres años. Junto a sus 10 compañeros han solicitado diferentes créditos en forma grupal para poder ayudarse en sus negocios.

El Sr. M. D. 35 años D. edad, convive con su pareja mas D. 8 años y tiene 4 pequeños hijos, el  mayor D. 8 años, el segundo D. 6, el tercero D. 2 y el último D. apenas unos cuantos meses. Ellos son la razón D. su esfuerzo, el aliciente para poder salir adelante y progresar en su negocio D. pastelería.

Hace 6 años, en un local alquilado y con dinero que estuvo ahorrando poco a poco, llegó a juntar  un pequeño capital, inició su negocio preparando queques  a mano, en moldes. Luego D. mucho esfuerzo y sacrificios D. casi dos años, pudo comprar las máquinas necesarias para la preparación D. sus productos.
Los préstamos solicitados a EDAPROSPO, fueron para la compra D. materia prima.
Ahora ha implementado su panadería en una parte D. su casa, y produce mayor cantidad que al inicio, pero su meta es comprar un horno rotativo con lo cual podría cuadruplicar su producción. Así podría brindarles a sus hijos lo que todo padre  desea, que es darles una buena educación y lograr que sean unos buenos profesionales.
El préstamo solicitado lo destinará para comprar insumos para la elaboración D. sus productos.
texts.en:
Alberto M. M. (shown on the left-hand siD. of the picture) has been President of ALCOM “Jesus of Nazareth” for a year but has been a member of the group for three. He and his colleagues have applied for different joint loans to be able to support their businesses. Mr. M. is 35 years old, lives with his partner of over 8 years, and has 4 small children. The oldest is 8 years old, the second is 4, the third is 2, and the youngest is just a few months old. His kids are the motivation behind his work, the inspiration to have a better life and make progress with his bakery business. Six years ago, Alberto started his business in a rented space with money that he had been saving little by little. He managed to accumulate some capital and started his business making cakes by hand, in pans. After much effort and sacrifice maD. for almost two years, Alberto was able to purchase the necessary machines to make his products. The loans requested to EDAPROSPO were for the purchase of raw materials. Now he has built a bakery in part of his house and makes more product than when he started. However, his goal is to purchase a rotating oven so that he can quadruple production. By doing so, he could proviD. his children with what every father wishes-to give them with a good education and help them achieve a successful professional life. Mr. M. will use the loan to purchase materials for the making of his products.

Translated from Spanish by Rocio Vargas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: INVERTIR

loans.name: Roca Fuerte Group

texts.es:
En la zona de Villa Exaltación (ciudad de El Alto) se encuentra el centro focal que lleva el mismo nombre, a este pertenece la asociación “Roca fuerte”. El grupo esta formado por doce integrantes los cuales han demostrado ser un grupo responsable y unido.
Casadas en su mayoría, afirman que los ingresos que obtienen no son suficientes para cubrir las necesidades básicas en sus hogares .Diversas son las actividades de este grupo, como ser; venta de comida  en la feria 16 de Julio(El Alto), confección de ropa deportiva y chamarras , tejido de chompas , confecciona de mantas y otros. La asociación Roca Fuerte desea ampliar su producción, para esto necesita capital para la compra de materia prima, tienen la seguridad de obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
The association "Roca Fuerte" belongs to the regional hub of Villa Exaltación, in the zone of the same name (in the city of El Alto). The group is made up of twelve members who have proved themselves to be a responsible and united group. With the majority of the group members married, they have reported that their income is not sufficient to cover the basic needs in their homes. The group's activities are diverse, from the sale of food in the 16 de Julio market (El Alto) to the production of leisure wear and coats, woven jackets, blankets and other items. The association Roca Fuerte wants to increase their production, for this they need capital to purchase the raw materials. They are certain that with this loan they will make a higher profit.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Isidora

texts.es:
La Sra. Isidora M. C. tiene 47 años de edad, actualmente esta separada de su marido. La sra. Isidora tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 2 todavia viven con ella. Tiene una casa propia en una zona que se dedica a la actividad lechera.

La sra. Isidora se dedica a la lecheria desde hace 20 años, entrega leche a una empresa que produce toda clase de productos lacteos.

Requiere el dinero para poder comprar insumos (avena y soya) para su ganado lechero. esto repercutira de manera positiva por que asi se proveera de insumos que haran que sus vacas lecheras produzcan mas, incrementando sus ingresos, para poder pagar los estudios de sus dor hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Isidora is 47 years old. She is separated from her husband. She has five children, two that still live with her. She has her own home in a region that is known for its dairies. Mrs. Isidora has been working in the dairy business for twenty years. She delivers the milk to businesses that produce all sorts of dairy products. She would like money to buy ingredients (oats and soy) for her milk cows. This will have a positive impact because with better feed the milk cows will increase their production. Increasing her income will allow her to pay for the education of her two children.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy feed for her milk cows.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia Q. V. tiene 18 años, es madre soltera de una niña de 1 año de edad. Vive en el terreno de sus padres en una casa separada e independiente.

A su corta edad ella trabaja independientemente con su propio ganado lechero, empezo a trabajar desde muy pequeña con su madre, aprendio y ahorro para comprar al inicio 2 cabezas de ganado lechero y asi sucesivamente hasta que logro tener 7 vacas lecheras. Toda su produccion entrega a una empresa local que elabora toda clase de productos lacteos. Requiere el dinero para poder comprar otra vaca lechera mas.

Ella espera en un futuro seguir creciendo en su actividad para poder generar mas ingresos para darle a su hija una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Lidia Q. V., 18, is the single mother of a one year old girl. She lives on her parents’ land in a separate and independent house. At her young age, she works independently with her own milking cows. She started working with her mother when she was very small. She learned and saved to initially buy two heads of milking cows. She continued in this manner until she had seven milking cows. She takes all of her production to a local business, which makes all types of dairy products. She needs money to be able to buy another milking cow. In the future she hopes to keep growing in her business to be able to generate more income in order to give her daughter a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a milking cow

loans.name: Nueva Generacion Group

texts.es: La asociación “Nueva Generación”, trabaja junto a Pro-Mujer hace un año, se reúnen cada dos semanas en el centro focal Villa Exaltación, ubicado en la ciudad de El Alto. Los negocios de este grupo son variados, algunas se dedican al tejido, otras de ellas venden frutas, mochilas, conservas, dulces y confeccionan  calzados, entre otros. Todas afirman que necesitan créditos para la compra de materia prima y/o mercaderia.

loans.use: COMPRA DE MATERIA PRIMA Y/O MERCADERIA

loans.name: Dora

texts.en:
Dora O. P. is 48 years old and is married with three children.  Dora has a business locale where she sells grocery items and ice cream.  She also has a telephone service (several phones in small cabins where people can pay to make calls).  Her husband is an environmental engineer, specializing in forestry.  He also supports Dora in her business ventures.  

Dora has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for six years and is a member of the communal bank “San Fernando II.”  She plans to use this loan of 2500 soles to buy more products for her grocery shop.

Because her grocery business has done well, Dora was recently able to add the telephone service.  Dora’s goal is to expand this service.  In this way she hopes to earn more income, particularly because she now has daughters who are beginning their university studies.

loans.use: Products for a grocery store.

loans.name: Milena

texts.en:
Milena V. V. is 52 years old and is married with six children.  Milena has two businesses, a vegetarian restaurant and a stand in the Bellavista market, a massive, chaotic street marketplace located near the center of the city of Pucallpa.  Milena sells spices and condiments (chili sauces, etc.) from her stand, which is named “Nutrisoya.”  Milena works together with her husband, who sells condiments wholesale, in both of her business ventures.  

Milena has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for three years and is a member of the communal bank “Las Triunfadoras” (The Winners).  She invested her very first loan of 300 soles (about $100) in purchasing condiments for her stand.  With this loan of 2300 soles Milena will buy a glass exhibitor window to display some of the foods she offers at her restaurant.

Milena has enjoyed working with Manuela Ramos.  In particular, she feels that she learns a lot about business from the educational sessions given by Manuela Ramos loan officers at the monthly meetings of her communal bank.  Milena’s goal is to add a soda fountain to her vegetarian restaurant.

loans.use: Glass exihibitor window to display food.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela V. T. is 53 years old and has seven children.  She is widowed and lives together with her youngest son in the city of Pucallpa.  Angela has worked in the city slaughterhouse for the past 28 years and sells tripe and other viscera from livestock.  Angela’s work has enabled her to support her children.  

Angela has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for eight years and is a member of the communal bank “Las Triunfadoras” (The Winners).  She invested her very first loan of 300 soles (about $100) in timber for sale.  She plans to use this loan of 1500 soles to purchase a second-hand motorcycle taxi.  

Angela’s goal is to someday have a home-based business such as a small restaurant that serves lunch.

loans.use: To buy a second-hand motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Nueva Generacion De Jovenes Group

texts.es: Gonzalo P. es el presidente de un grupo de cuatro miembros denominado Nueva Generación de jóvenes, se reúnen en el centro focal Villa Exaltación. Vieron la necesidad de iniciar un negocio para ayudar a sus padres en la economía de sus hogares ya que tienen familias numerosas. Necesitan comprar productos  para iniciar sus negocios, Gonzalo por ejemplo se dedicara  a la reparación y venta de celulares a medio uso, los demás se dedicaran a la venta de  conservas, frutas y comida.
texts.en:
Gonzalo P. is the president of a group of four members named Nueva Generación de jóvenes (New Generation of Youth), who meet up in the focal centre Villa Exaltación. They saw the need to start up a business to help their parents economically in the home as they have large families. They need to buy products to start up their businesses: Gonzalo, for example, repairs and sells second hand cell phones, while the others sell preserves, fruit and other food.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: PURCHASE OF PRODUCTS

loans.name: Mitsi

texts.en:
Mitsi D. V. is 26 years old and is married with one child.  She and her husband work together in the timber business.  They live in the city of Pucallpa.  

Mitsi has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for about a year and a half and is a member of the communal bank “Las Triunfadoras” (The Winners).  She invested her very first loan of 300 soles (about $100) in the sale of condiments, a business that she had at that time.  Nowadays, Mitsi is working full time with her husband in the timber business.  She will use this loan of 1700 soles to purchase wood at Pucallpa’s port along the Ucayali, a wide brown river that flows past the city and eventually joins the Amazon to the north.  Mitsi and her husband process the wood into boards.  

Mitsi’s goal is to purchase a planer and another machine for the small sawmill that she and her husband have been operating for the past 6 months.  In this way she hopes to offer better service to their customers.

loans.use: Wood for a sawmill business.

loans.name: Maria Azucena

texts.es: Maria Azucena Z. M. tiene 43 años. Es cliente de Fundación León 2000 es casada y junto a su pareja tiene 1 hijo que estudia con el esfuerzo de ambos. Conocedora de esta actividad que es muy común como es el destace de cerdo y la venta de nacatamales. Desde hace mas de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio, anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de gallinas, pero siempre tenía problemas porque tenía que viajar a lugares muy distantes para ofrecer sus productos ya que esto le resultaba muy cansado y difícilmente podía continuar de esta manera. Y por su hermana decide vender cerdos y  al notar que tenía muy buenas ganancias decide seguir adelante. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de cerdos y ciertos productos necesarios para la elaboración de sus nacatamales. Su mayor sueño es que su hijo tenga la oportunidad de estudio que ella no pudo tener.
texts.en:
Maria Azucena Z. M. is 43. She is a client of Fundación León 2000, is married, and has one son who goes to school through the efforts of her and her husband. She is an expert at a common activity, which is butchering pigs and selling tamales. She has had this business for more than 6 years. She used to sell chickens, but she always had problems because she had to travel to far-away places to sell her products, which was very tiring, and it was difficult to continue on like that. Because of her sister, she decided to sell pigs. When she noticed she made very good profits, she decided to continue doing this. The financing she is requesting is for working capital to buy pigs and products she needs to make her tamales. Her biggest dream is that her son has the opportunity to study that she wasn't able to have.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
La Sra Graciela de 38 años de edad es madre soltera con un hijo varón que va en el colegio del estado de dicho barrio, vive en su propia casa con su hermana mayor que es docente y comparten los gastos del hogar.
Ella es propietaria de un Despensa en donde además vende  artículos de mercerías como utensilios de cocina, manteles, ropa, zapatos, etc. el cual está ubicado en su propio domicilio hace mas de 4 años con buena clientela formada y que es atendida por ella misma. 

A medida que pasan los días cada vez tiene mas clientes y su negocio a su vez esta creciendo y esto le da mayor ganancia y asi puede cumplir con su compromiso con la Fundación.

El destino del crédito es para la compra de mercaderías varias para aumentar su stock de mercaderías, en vista de que no tiene competencia y la demanda es alta en esa zona.

loans.use: Compra de azúcar, gaseosas, lácteos, vegetales, frutas, carne, aceite, arroz, etc.

loans.name: Maria Graciela

texts.es: Maria Graciela V. Mejía tiene 53 años de edad. Es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos de los cuales ninguno depende de ella. Su actividad económica es la venta de recargas telefónicas. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que tenía que buscar el medio de sobrevivir, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y siempre le ha gustado comunicarse con sus clientes y brindarles los servicios necesarios. La mayoría de sus clientes siempre satisfechos porque el espíritu de Graciela es muy alegre y además es muy cariñosa. El motivo del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de para la compra de recargas de las dos compañías y así ofrecer un mejor servicio. El sueño de Maria es obtener otro medio de ingreso como es una pulpería.
texts.en:
Maria Graciela V. Mejía is 53. She is a single mother, and she has two independent children. She sells telephone cards. She has had this business for over three years. She had to look for a way to survive. She is a very hard working woman, and she has always liked communicating with her customers and offering them necessary services. The majority of her customers are always satisfied because Graciela has a very happy spirit, and she is very kind. The loan is for working capital to buy telephone cards from the two companies, which will offer better service. Maria’s dream is to get another means of income such as a mini market.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Carlos Enoc

texts.es: Carlos Enoc Z. F. tiene 24 años. Es un joven soltero. A pesar de su corta edad le ha gustado trabajar y ganarse el dinero de una manera muy humilde. Hace más de 11 años que se dedica a la venta de comida, por lo que atiende su negocio todos los días. Además Carlos se encarga de la elaboración de tortillas, y con estos pocos ingresos ayuda a su mama y su familia. Anteriormente cuando estaba más pequeño salía a vender sus tortillas de manera ambulante y recorría muchos lugares con el fin de ayuda lo suficiente económicamente a su Mama y más tarde decide establecer una venta de comida en su vivienda. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de maíz, leña, frijoles, azúcar, aceite entre otras cosas. Su deseo es poseer su propio restaurante.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Cecilio

texts.es: Cecilio R. Laínez tiene 63 años. Es un hombre que siempre ha trabajado. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es ofrecer los servicios de carpintería. Hace más de 15 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Anteriormente se dedicaba a ofrecer los servicios de vigilante, pero este trabajo era muy peligroso y tenía que cuidar a sus 5 hijos y al tener la necesidad de proveerle a su familia el alimento diario, continúo con este trabajo hasta que por medio de un amigo logra aprender la carpintería. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de madera, alcohol, tinte y ciertas herramientas. Su mayor sueño es adquirir su propio medio de transporte para sus productos.
texts.en:
Cecilio R. Laínez is 63 years old. He is a man that has always worked. He offers carpentry services. For over 15 years he has dedicated himself to this work. Previously he worked as a security guard, but this work was very dangerous; because he had to take care of 5 children and had to provide his family food daily, he continued in this work until, through a friend, he learned carpentry. The loan that he requests will be used as work capital to purchase wood, alcohol, dye, and certain tools. His biggest dream is to acquire his own means of transportation for his products.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital (to purchase wood, alcohol, dye, and certain tools).

loans.name: Mary Geraldine

texts.en:
Mary Geraldine E. is a 41-year old pig grwer in Trento, Agusan Del Sur. She has six children, 19 years old the eldest. She is very uch worried about their family growing finances, espeially that her children are studying so she needs to provide more on their needs especially school like tuition fee, books and other daily costs.

She would like to request a loan of Php 13,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy feed for her pigs. Part of the loan as well will hopefully put to starting a new businesss that will hel augment their oncome. Her planis actually having a sari-sari store and the loan that she applies will truly help for the realization of her plan.

She likes CEVI because they are giving loans of smallest interest rate, only 2% a month.

loans.use: To help start a business and buy feed for the pigs

loans.name: Salvadora

texts.es: La Señora Salvadora L. Antón  tiene 59 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos que trabajan de manera independiente. La actividad económica es la venta de refrescos. Ella  inicio hace más de 14 años, y pesar de la edad en una excelente cliente de Fundación León 2000 ya que cada uno de sus financiamientos los ha aplicado a su negocio. Los propósitos de Doña Salvadora son de mantener este negocio activo para proporcionarle a su familia una fuente de ingresos. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo ya que con esto comprara frutas naturales, jugos gaseosas y además algo de pan. Sus deseos de son de aumentar la producción de ya que al mismo tiempo obtendría muchos clientes.
texts.en:
Salvadora L. Antón is 59 years old, a single mother, and has 3 children that work independently. She sells drinks. She began this business over 14 years ago, and despite her age she is an excellent client of the Fundación León 2000 given that she has invested each one of her loans in her business. Salvadora’s goal is to keep this business active so that she can provide her family a source of income. The loan will be used as work capital, which she will use to purchase natural fruits, juices, soft drinks, and some bread. Her hope is to increase production given that by doing so she would obtain many clients.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital (which she will use to purchase natural fruits, juices, soft drinks, and some bread).

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 33 years old and has one child.  She is a single parent.  Patricia works as a primary school teacher (and teacher coordinator) and is also engaged in a number of business ventures.  She has a motorcycle taxi which she rents out daily to a driver.  She also owns a lawnmower that she rents out.

Patricia has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for six years and is a member of the communal bank “Las Doncellas.”  She invested her very first loan of 300 soles (about $100) in beauty products for sale.  Patricia will use this loan of 3000 soles to buy another lawnmower.  

Patricia is happy to be working with Manuela Ramos because she can exchange ideas with other members of her communal bank.  In this way, Patricia feels that she is developing more personally and also contributing to the personal development of other members of her communal bank.

With her business ventures, Patricia also helps her siblings.  Patricia’s goal is to eventually purchase two more lawnmowers.

loans.use: A lawnmower to rent out (as a business venture).

loans.name: Hector Ruben

texts.es: Héctor Rubén B. tiene 30 años de edad.  Su actividad económica que es la venta y compra de electrodomésticos. Hace más de 12 años que se dedica a este negocio. El dio inicio a este negocio porque le gustaba reparar   aparatos eléctricos y también vender este tipo de aparatos que son necesarios en el hogar y además tiene una hija que necesita de estudio y vestimenta por lo que esto lo motivo a salir adelante con este negocio. Su mayor desafío fue que algunas veces no conocía las direcciones de los clientes y esto le ocasionaba la pérdida de  mucho tiempo ya que tenía que buscar la dirección exacta. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de video juegos, licuadora, equipos de sonido televisores y algunos repuestos de electrodomésticos. El sueño de Héctor es terminar de construir su vivienda y brindarle a su familia las mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Hector Ruben B. is 30 years old. He buys and sells household appliances. He has dedicated himself to this business for over 12 years. He began this business because he enjoyed repairing electronic appliances, and also selling these types of appliances that are necessary in the home. In addition, he has a daughter that needs clothing and to further her studies, which is the reason that he wants to move forward with this business. His biggest obstacle has been that at times he didn’t know his clients’ addresses, which caused him to waste a lot of time given that he has to look for the exact address. The loan that he is requesting will be used as work capital to purchase video games, a blender, sound equipment, televisions, and some spare parts for home appliances. Hector’s dream is to finish building his house, and to provide his family with the best living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital (to purchase video games, a blender, sound equipment, televisions, and some spare parts for home appliances).

loans.name: Kuña Marangatu Group

texts.es:
Este grupo del Barrio San Pedro surgió por contacto de una de las integrantes con la Fundación. Todas las señoras realizan actividades productivas como ser: Despensa, venta de comidas, venta de ropas, modista, kiosco, etc. El monto que recibe cada señora varía de 300.000 a 1.400.000, todas las señoras destinan el crédito para las actividades que ya están realizando actualmente. 
Cada integrante junto con la actividad comercial que realiza se describe a continuación:
Francisca Benítez de Chávez, Empleada Doméstica y Despensa 
María Alicia González de Benítez , Despensa,  
Elena Rosa Benítez Duarte, Kiosco,  
María Elizabeth C. Venta de ropas 
María Anuncia Martínez de Romero, Despensa 
Selva Dejesus Valdéz G., Modista 
Rosa Natalia C. C., Modista, 
Eufemia Concepción C. de C., Modista,  
Ana Beatriz C. Fleitas, Venta de comidas ambulante 
Catalina Benítez Duarte, Venta de ropas ambulante  
María Griselda González de Vázquez, Venta de comidas ambulante  
Mariela Carolina Chávez Benitéz, Venta de ropas ambulante  
Marcela Elizabeth Chávez B., Venta de insumos informáticos  
Soledad Belen G. C., Venta de ropas ambulante 
Hipólita Noemi Chávez B., Cantina   
Liliana Raquel Benítez, Venta de comidas ambulante.

loans.use: Compra de artículos comestibles como ser harina, aceite, fideos, yerba, carnes, panificados, tapa para empanada, compra de ropas, compra de hilos y telas, y otros para surtir despensa.

loans.name: Osma Guillermo

texts.es: Osman Guillermo Martínez tiene 35 años de edad. Es un hombre casado y tiene 3 hijos a si cargo que dependen de él. En su vivienda está ubicado el negocio de Osman que es una pulpería, en donde ofrece productos de consumo diario. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio y le ha ayudado mucho para el apoyo familiar. Osman es un hombre muy humilde, pero trabajador, por lo que es siempre se ha encargado de vigilar que a sus hijos no les falte nada. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de arroz, aceite, frijoles, azúcar, pan y golosinas en general. Su deseo es obtener una pequeña distribuidora para seguir proporcionando a s familia lo necesario.
texts.en:
Osman Guillermo M. is 35 years old. He is a married man, and has 3 children under his care that depend on him. Osman’s business is located in his home; his business is a small general store where he offers products that are consumed daily. He has dedicated himself to this business for over 7 years, and it has helped him a great deal to support his family. Osman is a very humble man but a hard worker, and has always taken care to ensure that his children lack nothing. The loan that he is requesting will be used as work capital to purchase rice, oil, beans, sugar, bread, and general sweets. His dream is obtain a small store so that he can continue to provide his family what is necessary.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital (to purchase rice, oil, beans, sugar, bread, and general sweets).

loans.name: Lily Magaly

texts.es:
Lily es una madre soltera de 29 años que vive junto a sus tres hijos de 11, 10 y 7 años en casa de sus padres, ubicada en el distrito de Santa Rosa, a 25 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.
  
Se ha dedicado durante toda su vida al tejido artesanal de sombreros de palma (planta cuya fibra es utilizada en la confección y tejido de varios productos artesanales), ella compra la palma en el distrito de Monsefú y teje sombreros junto a su madre para luego  venderlos, tan solo tejer un sombrero le puede tomar hasta una semana..
  
Ella depende de esta actividad para apoyar a su familia, sus hijos están estudiando en un colegio estatal de la zona y día a día tiene que dar lo mejor de sí para sustentarlos, su mas grande sueño es poder costruir una casa propia en donde pueda vivir junto a sus hijos y brindarles una buena educación y calidad de vida.
  
Lily desea ampliar su negocio y seguir tejiendo sombreros para seguir sacando adelante a sus hijos, es por ello que está solicitando por primera vez a nuestra Institución un crédito de 800 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de más material para su producto.
  
Sus vecinos la consideran una madre muy responsable y trabajadora dentro de su comunidad, siempre está solidarizándose con quien más la necesita.
texts.en:
Lily is 29 years old and a single mother that lives with her three children ages 11, 10, and 7, in her parent’s house located in the Santa Rosa district, 25 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She has dedicated her whole life to making handicrafts, specifically hats made of palm (palm is a plant that has a fiber that is used in the making and crafting of various handicrafts). She purchases the palm in the Monsefu district and crafts hats with her mother, which they later sell; crafting one hat can take up to a week.

She depends on this work to support her family; her children are studying at the local state school, and she has to give her best daily to support them. Her biggest dreams are build her own house where she can live with her children, and to provide them with a good education and quality of life.

Lily hopes to expand her business and to continue crafting hats so that she can continue to ensure that her children get ahead in life. Because of this, she is requesting for the first time from our institution a loan of 800 PEN, which she plans to invest in the purchase of more material for her product.

Within her community, her neighbors believe her to be a very responsible mother and hard worker; she is always supporting whoever most needs her.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase dry palm leaves to craft hats.

loans.name: Paola Del Milagro

texts.es:
Paola tiene 24 años de edad, es casada, y vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos, de 5 años y de 2 meses de edad, en casa de sus suegros, ubicada en el distrito de Monsefú, a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace 5 años se dedica al negocio de venta de tejidos hechos artesanalmente, ella realiza su trabajo en base a pedidos: compra el material para luego confeccionar y bordar toda clase de manteles, vestidos y frazadas que después distribuye en ciudades como Lima y Piura.

Gracias a la artesanía ella puede mantener a su familia, su esposo trabaja como mototaxista (un servicio de transporte muy utilizado en la zona) y juntos sueñan con comprar un terreno en el que puedan construir su casa propia.

Tratando de seguir su sueño ella está solicitando por pirmera vez a nuestra Institución un crédito de 1100 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de más hilos y telas con los cuales confeccionar más manteles y así, salir adelante poco a poco.

Paola es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable y día a día borda y teje con mucho entusiamo tratando de apoyar a su familia con los gastos diarios del hogar.
texts.en:
Paola is 24 years old, married, and lives with her husband and two children, who are 5 years old and 2 months old, in her in-laws home located in the Monsefu district, 20 minutes for the city of Chiclayo.

For the past 5 years she has dedicated herself to her business in the sale of handcrafted textiles. She carries out her work based on orders: she purchases materials to later make and embroider all types of table cloths, dresses, and blankets that she later distributes in cities like Lima and Piura.

Thanks to craftwork she can support her family; her husband works as a motorcycle taxi (a popular transportation service used in the area), and together they dream of purchasing a plot of land on which then can build their own house.

In an effort to follow her dream she is requesting for the first time from our institution a loan of 1,100 PEN which she plans to invest in the purchase of more thread and fabrics to make more table cloths, and in that way get ahead in life little by little.

Paola is a hardworking and responsible woman, and everyday she embroiders and sows with much enthusiasm hoping to help her family with daily household expenses.


Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase threads and fabrics to make handcrafted textiles.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita P. is from the village of Ibabao. She is 52 years old. Conchita is married and has 1 adult-aged children. To make a living, Conchita owns & operates a snacks & food vending business in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Conchita has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Conchita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Conchita has successfully repaid a previous loan  from PMPC. Conchita is requesting a new loan of 14900 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Conchita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica B. is from the village of Tabo-o, Jimenez, Msamis Occidental. She is 40 years old. Jessica is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Jessica owns & operates a business venture in the food sector selling fish. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying & selling fish in the local community. Jessica has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jessica joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jessica is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jessica from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Meas S., age 61, is a widow and has six children. She lives with her children in Phnom Penh City. To make a living, she operates a business selling a few groceries and ice, earning approximately US $5 per day. The family is also assisted by her children who are employed in various kinds of workplaces in the city.

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, S. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, S. is seeking to increase her income. She is asking for a loan of US $500 to purchase various kinds of groceries to expand her current business. By doing so, she hopes she will be able to generate more income and raise her family's standard of living.

loans.use: grocery purchase

To make a living, he works in construction, and he operates a business as motor-taxi driver in his free time from work in the evening, earning collectively an income of US $7 per day. His wife is employed as a worker in a local garment factory, earning an income of US $2 per day.

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, S. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, S. is seeking to increase his income. He is asking for a loan of US $700 to purchase a new motorbike for his business as motor-taxi driver. By doing so, he hopes he will be able to raise the standard of living of his family.

loans.use: motorbike purchase

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, S. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, S. is seeking to increase his income. He is asking for a loan of US $500 to have his car repaired. By doing so, he hopes he will be able to attract more customers to consume his transportation services and generate more income to raise a good standard of living for his family.

loans.name: Ma. Luningning

texts.en: Ma. Luningning is engaged in a small eatery  business.  She is 49 years old and married to Rolando.  the couple was blessed with a daughter named Mary-Ann, she is now 17 years old and in the high school level.  According to Luningning she needed additional capital for her eatery business to further grow and expand into a bigger one. In this regard, she is asking to borrow loan amounting PHP5, 000 as additional capital. She has been in this business for four years.  She will use the loan to buy spices, meat, rice and other ingredients she needed.  She is hoping that her loan will be granted for the welfare of her family.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora currently lives in her native place at Barangay Almaguer, South of Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. She is married to Justo and they were gifted with three children. They belong to the poor families but with strong faith and determination to uplift their standard of living. Leonora and her husband work very hard and patiently coping with the difficulties of life they are experiencing. Two of their children have already graduated from high school and are now working abroad as domestic helpers while their youngest child is still studying.

Farm labor and cultivating their own farm is their major source of income. Leonora on the other hand is managing a vending business: rice, vegetables, and sometimes she also sells frozen foods. She wants to take out a loan from Kiva amounting to PHP 10,000 as additional capital to maintain her business so it will become profitable. She hopes that through her business, they can uplift their life out of poverty.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make food products for sale

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Weaving is the business of Jane R.. She makes cradles from soft ball thread which is quite difficult to use. She and her husband reside in Santiago City, Isabela. According to her, she can produce at least four bog cradles from the thread. Weaving cradles needs patience in order to produce good quality, she added.

Jane is doing her best to have a good product that she can offer to her customers. She wants to further improve and promote her business, this is the reason why she is taking out a loan of PHP 5,000 from Kiva lenders. According to her, her raw materials are also bought in Manila and this makes her really interested to take out a loan to further maintain the business which is of big help to her family.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Ruby May

texts.en:
According to Ruby May “hard work and patience is the key to success”. She bears those qualities, thus Ruby May is hoping someday to become successful in her mushroom production business. She is already 35 years old and is happily married to Fernando. They have two children who are both attending the primary level of education.

Mushroom production is quite difficult sometimes, because some of their bought mushrooms seeds (semelia) were unproductive and also because of hot temperature that cause the mushrooms not to grow. Ruby May is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 in order to keep her business going and overcome those factors affecting her business so she can progress.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda U. is from the city of Aloran. She is 31 years old. Linda is married. To make a living, Linda owns & operates a "sari-sari" store business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Linda has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.In 2009, Linda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Linda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14900 PHP from PMPC. Linda is requesting a new loan of 50000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell & to renovate her general store for expansion. This loan will be the  15th loan taken out by Linda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell & to renovate her general store for expansion

loans.name: Nub

texts.en:
Nub S., age 28, is married and has two young children. She lives with her husband and children in Takeo province. To make a living, she is engaged in a business of weaving at home, earning approximately US $4 per day which is the primary source of income for the family. Her husband works as a teacher of a local public school, and he also sells scarves and car washer made from pieces of fabrics, earning an income of US $3 per day.

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, S. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, S. is seeking to increase her income. She is asking for a loan of US $1000 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to transport his fabrics and scarves to sell. By doing so, she hopes she will be able to generate more income and save more money to raise a good standard of living.

loans.use: motorbike purchase

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna has been a resident of Barangay General Balao in Solana, Cagayan since she was born. She is now 46 years old and engaged in the business of selling fish in the market.

Aside from vending, Lorna is also a hog-raiser. She wants her business to grow for the future of her children and that is why she asking for a loan from Kiva of PHP 9,000 as additional capital. Her income from vending is wisely divided to purchase feed for her hogs and for the school allowance of her children and for their daily needs.

Lorna is married to Agapito, 47 years old, who is a farmer. They are blessed with six children. Through farming, her husband helps her in providing their needs and also in sending their children to school.

loans.use: To use as additional business capital

loans.name: Leonila Ail

texts.en: Leonila Ail A. is from the city of Pagadian. She is 38 years old, is widowed, and has two school-aged children. Leonila Ail is just starting a business operating a specialized retail store, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Leonila Ail joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Vorn

texts.en:
Vorn K., age 42, is married and has seven children. She lives with her husband and children in Takeo province. To make a living, she is engaged in a business of producing a cow and buffalo ties, earning approximately US $3 per day. Her husband has to travel to the city to work as a construction builder, earning an income of US $3 per day which is the primary source of income for the family. The family is also assisted by three of the children who are currently employed in a local garment factory with the income of US $3 each.

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, K. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, K. is seeking to increase her income. She is asking for a loan of US $1200 to purchase a motorbike to transport her animal ties to sell at the other villages in the province. By doing so, she hopes she will be able to generate more income and save more money to raise a good standard of living.

loans.use: motorbike purchase

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe T. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 49 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Fe owns and operates a business running a food stall, selling a variety of fruits and vegetables in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over thirty years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month. In 2008, Fe joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. Fe is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to repair their residential house. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to have a little bit more comfortable shelter to live in and to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair her house

loans.name: Mut

texts.en:
Mut P., age 50, is married and has four children. She lives with her husband and children in Takeo province. To make a living, she is engaged in the agriculture sector as a rice field farmer, earning approximately $1.5 USD per day. Her husband is a local primary school teacher, earning an income of $5 USD per day, which is the family's primary source of income. The family is also assisted by two of the children who have a sewing business that generates an income of $3 USD each.

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, including P.. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of these economic difficulties, P. is seeking to increase her income. She is asking for a loan of $1000 USD to purchase items for her children's sewing business. By doing so, she hopes she will be able to generate more income and save more money to reach a good standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase items for sewing business

loans.name: Nub

texts.en:
Nub K., aged 42, is married and has six children. She lives with her husband and children in Takeo province. To make a living, she is engaged in a business producing doormats, earning approximately $3 USD per day. Her husband travels to other places in the province to work as a construction foreman, earning an income of $3 USD per day. The family is also assisted by three of the children who are currently employed in a local garment factory, earning an income of $3 USD per day each.

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, K. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of these economic difficulties, K. is seeking to increase her income. She is asking for a loan of $1200 USD to purchase construction supplies to expand her husband’s business. By doing so, she hopes she will be able to generate more income and save more money to reach a good standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase construction supplies

loans.name: Bush

texts.en:
Bush P., age 43, is married and has five children. She lives with her husband and children in Takeo province. To make a living, she is engaged in the agriculture sector of raising pigs and growing rice, earning approximately US $0.50 per day. Her husband has to travel to the city to work as a construction builder, earning an income of US $5 per day which is the primary source of income for the family. The family is also assisted by three of the children who are currently employed in various kinds of workplace for a reasonable income.

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, P. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, P. is seeking to increase her income. She is asking for a loan of US $1000 to start a new business of selling various kinds of fruits at a local market. By doing so, she hopes she will be able to generate more income and save more money to raise a good standard of living.

loans.use: fruit purchase

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 40 years old and married to Jhon, who works as an engineer. The couple are blessed with one child, Nica, who is 11 years old and in elementary school. Marites has been a hairdresser for 25 years. She manages a beauty salon named after herself. With her experience, she has been able to set up her own salon and employ six people.

Treatments Marites offers in her salon include manicures, pedicures, haircuts, hair treatments, hairdressing and facial massage, all of which are very affordable. She is now asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP in order to develop her business.

loans.use: As additional capital

loans.name: Encarnacion

texts.en:
Encarnacion C. is 62 years old and is married to a farmer of the same age. Encarnacion and her husband, Supio, have six children. Four of them have their own family now and two still live at home and work for Encarnacion's business.

Ten years ago Encarnacion attended a Department of Trade and Industry (DTI) training course in her villlage about handicraft making. After the course, she started a small business using the skills she had learned from the training. At that time she had no access to business capital so she worked for other people and was paid only according to the number of pieces she could make in a day.

In 2005, Encarnacion joined Kiva partner, ASHI. She took a loan and started her own business weaving sleeping mats using panan leaf (a kind of palm). As she continued to take loans from ASHI and save some of her profits, she was able to grow her business. Now she makes other kinds of handicrafts such as native bags from abaka (banana leaf) fiber, hats, placemats made from twigs, and other house decorations. Many souvenir shop owners visit Encarnacion's village to buy her products. Other customers are tourists and Overseas Filipino Workers (OFW) wanting to buy presents for their colleagues abroad. As a result, Encarnacion is requesting a larger loan to sustain and finance the increasing demand for her handicrafts.

loans.use: To finance her handicraft business

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Thy P., age 33, is married and has three school-aged children. She lives with her husband and children in Takeo province. To make a living, she is engaged in a business of weaving, earning approximately US $3.3 per day. Her husband operates his car taxi for garment factory workers in the province, earning an income of US $10 per day which is the primary source of income for the family.

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, P. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, P. is seeking to increase her income. She is asking for a loan of US $1000 to have her husband’s car repaired to attract more customers to consume his transportation services. By doing so, she hopes she will be able to generate more income and save more money to raise a good standard of living.

loans.use: repair the car

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma L. is from the town of Katipunan. She is 48 years old. Vilma is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Vilma owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Vilma has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Vilma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vilma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Vilma is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Vilma from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to the borrower's house. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe L. is now 43 years old and happily married to Richard, who works in a manufacturing business. They are blessed with three children: Chariefae - 17 years old, second year college; Cliff Richard -14 years old, a junior high school student and Tishamae - 7 years old is a grade school. She hopes that her children will someday able to finish their college education for their future. 
 
Fe and her husband help each other in making their leather business a success. They make leather accessories such as wallets, coin purse, bags, belt and other accessories. They have a business stall located in Brixton Mall in Tuguegarao City and used to sell in trade fairs even in different places of Luzon. According to Fe, the business really helps them in providing their children education and their basic needs at home. She wanted to borrow loan from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP35, 000 as additional capital to further expand and promote their business.  She believes that hard work and patience are the best qualities in order for a business to grow aside from having enough capital.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina and her family live in the small village of Sitio Anguapan Tumauini, Isabela. She is 44 years old and is married to Dominador, a 50-year-old farmer. They are blessed with two children who have finished high school but have not been able to pursue their college education due to lack of financial resources.

Catalina manages a duck-raising business in her village. She also sells rice to provide an additional source of income. She hopes that her business will grow and be able to provide sufficient income to meet her family's daily needs. Catalina also dreams of having a more stable livelihood project in order to improve their poor living conditions. She hopes that her loan proposal of 7,000 PHP will be approved to further maintain and expand the business she manages.

loans.use: As additional capital

loans.name: Ear

texts.en:
Ear Y., age 42, is married and has three school-aged children. She lives with her husband and children in Takeo province.

Y. is engaged in a business selling groceries and soft drinks from her home, earning approximately US$13 per day. Her husband is a motorcycle repairman at home, too, earning a gross income of US$13 per day.

The financial crisis has been difficult for businesses in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, Y. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most.

In light of the country's economic difficulties, Y. is seeking to increase her income. She is asking for a loan of US$1,000 to purchase a machine for her husband’s business of repairing motorcycles. By doing so, she hopes she will be able to generate more income and save more money to raise a good standard of living.

loans.use: To buy a machine for her husband's motorcycle repair business

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is so glad that, through her hog-raising and mushroom-production businesses she is able to support the basic needs of her family. She wants her businesses to grow and, in line with this, she would like to obtain a loan of PHP 5,000 from Kiva lenders as additional capital for her mushroom-production business. Leonida said that the amount she is asking to borrow will not only benefit her mushroom business but also be a big help to her family.

Leonida is married to Roel L. who is a house carpenter. They live peacefully in the simple Barangay of Isidro Paredes, somewhere in Diffun Quirino province. The couple helps each other in providing their children’s allowances and tuition fees in school. Her youngest child is already a senior high school student and Leonida is hoping that, through the improvement of her businesses, she will somehow be able to send her child to college.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
“Time is gold”: this is Gina’s main principle in life. She is already 27 years old and married to Rogelio S.. They have one child named Princess Aira who is just two years old.

Gina and her husband have a lot of hopes and dreams for their child and their future children. According to her, she doesn’t want her child to experience what she’s been through. She never had a stable life because she did not finish her studies. She wishes that her child will not suffer by being uneducated like her.

Gina has run a general store for three years already. She started operating her business when her husband went abroad to support them. They sacrificed being away from each other for the sake of their future. Her husband’s salary is being saved for the education of their child and for their future as a whole family.

Gina engaged herself in her retailing business hoping to help her husband in gaining income to support their daily needs. Gina wants to ask for a loan of PHP 5,000 to further expand her business. She’s always wanted to grow it with her own ability. Her future plan for the loan is to purchase additional products like rice to sell to increase her profits.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene D. is from the city of Dapitan. She is 40 years old. Arlene is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Arlene owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Arlene has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Arlene joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arlene has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. Arlene is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Arlene from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 26 years old. She is married to Romualdo and they have a six-year-old daughter named Christine. Maricel’s husband works as a farmer and sometimes helps her in selling pineapples in their village. The couple and their daughter live happily in the village of Sitio Anguapan, Tumauini, Isabela.

Aside from selling pineapples, Maricel is engaged in a business selling rice. She also has a small vegetable farm in their backyard. She is always hoping that she can provide a better life for her child and give her a good education. Her daily net income from selling pineapples is only PHP 150 daily. In this regard, Maricel would like to obtain a loan of PHP 4,000 to be used as additional capital in purchasing two sacks of rice to retail and vegetables, too. She hopes to continuously maintain her business with the help of Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy two sacks of rice to sell and vegetables, too

loans.name: Mor

texts.en:
Mor S., age 35, is married and has three children. She lives with her husband and children in Takeo province. She is involved in a business manufacturing Cambodian traditional cakes, earning approximately US $8 per day. Her husband is engaged in a business of collecting coconuts from villages to sell in the town, earning an income of US $6.60 per day.

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, S. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, S. is seeking to increase her income. She is asking for a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase a motorbike and trailer for her son to operate a business like his father. By doing so, she hopes she will be able to generate more income and save more money to raise her family's standard of living.

loans.use: buy a motorbike and its trailer

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma hopes to borrow a loan from Kiva amounting to PHP8, 000 that will be utilized for the maintenance of her tailoring machine and some will be used to purchase sewing clothes and other materials needed in sewing. She used to accept sewing of school uniforms, gowns, sports uniforms, and also accepts repair. Her income in the business was utilized for her family necessities. 

Thelma is already 43 years old, she lives in Barangay General Balao, Solana, Cagayan with her whole family. She have six children, all of them are attending a local school in their community. She is a responsible mother and neighbor in the village. She works hard for the fulfillment of her family goals.  The villagers always come to her to repair shorts, pants, school uniforms, etc. and ask only little amount of for the labor work done.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying some necessary things for his land

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: For expanding business

loans.name: Welfrida

texts.en:
Welfrida J. is from the village of Pigsag-an , Cagayan de Oro City. She is 38 years old. Welfrida is married and has 6 children. To make a living, Welfrida owns and operates a 'sari-sari' (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Welfrida has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Welfrida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Welfrida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Welfrida is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Welfrida from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Pedrito A. is from the village of Pigsa-an, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 49 years old. Pedrito is married and has 7 adult children. To make a living, Pedrito owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Pedrito has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Pedrito joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pedrito has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand product offering. Pedrito is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Pedrito from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business.
