location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Sabza Group

texts.en: Sabza is the group leader of Sabza group. They are three members in this group. They are wants to take a loan for expanding business and make it larger. So they are requested a group of loan 42000 Afghani. Sabza wants to take a loan for the business of fruits selling cart Qamar wants to take a loan for her husband who has wood selling shop. Abeda wants to take a loan for her husband who his truck. So they are very thankful from Kiva lenders that can support all entrepreneurs.

loans.use: For progress business

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna S. is managing a general store in the village of Rio Del Grande, Enrile, Cagayan. She is 56 years old and married to Julio, a tricycle (three-wheeled vehicle) driver in their area.  They were blessed with five children who are all married.  Edna and her husband work hard to support their daily needs and at least to help their children financially, even though they are living separately from them.  

Edna wants her business to become more progressive and to increase her daily income.  This is the reason why she would like to borrow a loan in the amount of PHP 30,000 from Kiva lenders.  She is hoping that her loan request will be granted so she can develop her store and purchase more merchandise.

loans.use: Business Improvement

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy items necessary to ready his land for cultivation

loans.name: Lailanie

texts.en:
Lailanie is already 35 years old. She and her family live in the village of Sitio Anguapan Tumauini, Isabela. She and her husband were blessed with four children. Two of her children are already in high school while two are in grade school. Lailanie has been helping her husband in their agriculture business by retailing rice in their village. In this way, she generates an income which is quite beneficial to provide the school allowance of their children. The couple are helping one another to achieve their goals in life. They are hoping that each one of them will be fairly benefited through their sacrifices in giving them a good future.

Lailanie is again requesting a loan amounting to PHP 4,000 to further improve her rice retailing business. She is planning to buy sacks of rice and to have a lot of stock to able meet the needs of her customers in their village thus increasing her daily income. She is hoping for the loan request to be granted soon.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Jubel

texts.en:
Jubel O. is from the village of Zions Canituan, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 22 years old and single. To make a living, Jubel owns and operates a business providing pedicab services, transporting members of the local community from place to place. Jubel has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Jubel joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jubel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Jubel is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide his pedicab service. This loan will be his third from HSPFI. Jubel plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide his pedicab service

location.town: Zions, Canitoan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is among the villagers in St. Catalina Ilagan, Isabela who is engaged in the charcoal vending business.  Her business has been the major source of income of her family.  She is also aiming to be competitive just like others entrepreneurs in their village. Marilou is distributing her charcoals in different markets in order to gain more income. She needs to develop her business a profitable one because her children have their growing needs. With this, she would like to borrow a loan amount of PHP4, 000.00 from Kiva lenders to improve her business.  

Marilou is now 23 years old and a mother of two. Her children are not yet studying but she want to save for their future education while they are still young. She is also dreaming to give them good future by providing them complete education. She hopes that through her diligence in working with her husband, they could provide all their needs.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is from the village of Sta. Catalina of Ilagan, Isabela. She is married to Samuel who helps her in their small charcoal production business. She is glad that they also have a small farm which gives them an additional source of income. The couple have three children, all of whom are currently studying. Jane hopes that they will be able to finish their studies so that they can have a better standard of living when they have families of their own.

Jane collects wood to make charcoal and sometimes also buys it for this purpose. To help her business grow, she is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP from Kiva lenders. The income from her business is essential to her family because it is used to provide their basic daily needs.

loans.use: As additional capital

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena M. manages a general store business in the rural village of San Jose, Santiago City, where her family lives happily. Elena is married to Vicente Sr. The couple are blessed with five children, four of whom graduated from high school and one of whom was able to finish a two-year course at college. Elena and her husband do not have the financial resources to sustain their children's education as the store is their only means of income.

Elena is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP from Kiva lenders to use as additional capital for the improvement of her store. She hopes to buy stocks of merchandise to retail in the store. In doing this, Elena believes she can increase her income, and will wisely reinvest it back in the business.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise for her general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase new items

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 50-years old and married to Apolonio who is 51-years old and a farmer. She has always prayed for the health of herself and every member of her family. As a parent, she has felt it important to fulfill her responsibilities to her children. Through their diligence in managing their resources, Lourdes and Apolonio have been able to provide a complete education for their children who were willing to pursue their college studies. At the moment, they are still sending two of their children to school.

Lourdes is engaged in the livestock business. She has been taking good care of ten goats which has been a big help in responding to their financial needs especially in times of emergencies. Grown up goats are being sold at least once a week. For each goat, she gets PHP 2,500 and this is quite helpful for the family’s needs. Lourdes is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000 to purchase more baby goats to raise. She is planning to use some of the loan to sustain their farm.

loans.use: To purchase baby goats

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional seafood products

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 42 years old and owns and manages a general store.  Aside from selling different merchandise, she also sells vegetables and cooked food in her store for additional income.  She wishes to maintain her business to meet the daily needs of their family.  Lack capital motivated her to request a loan from Kiva lenders an amount of  PHP 7,000.00.  She will use the loan to purchase grocery items for her business to become profitable.  	
	
Imelda is married to Ricarte Garcilian. They have five children and her three eldest children got married already at their very early aged and two remains studying. She hopes to provide all their needs so will not imitate what her three eldest children deed. They work very hard to reach out for the development of their business and she was holding on to the financial support coming from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To start working on his land

loans.name: Minerva Loraine

texts.en: Minerva is a hardworking person. She and her family are residing in the village of Rio Del Grande, Enrile, Cagayan. Minerva is hoping that she will able to continue to expand her food processing business that she usually sell to her neighbors in their village after she had able to packed her homemade longganisa. Minerva is asking for financial assistance from Kiva lenders for the improvement of her business. She hopes to avail at least PHP5, 000 loans. She is also raising swine that is also of big help in their daily needs. She hopes that someday, her business will become productive for the progress of their poor living situation.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia C. is  44 years old. She is married to Emmanuel Sr and they are blessed with five children.  Two of them have already graduated from college and three are still studying in a public school.  They live in the village of Isidro Paredes of Diffun Qurino province. The family has a good reputation  in the village. 

Farming is their major source of income. Ofelia maintains a mushroom project in their backyard. She earns income  from her mushroom production. Buyers buy her harvested products weekly in kilos at lower price so that they will also have income when they retail it to their customers. With the help of her husband, Ofelia is very grateful to have her business keep growing and by requesting additional business capital from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP 5,000 she hopes that she will generate more income from the business.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Mirium

texts.en:
Mirium is s member of the Furaha borrower group in Himo,Kilimanjaro,she is 44 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 6 children,Her children are aged 32,20,22,18,16,17 years.

Mirium started her own grocery business selling beer 4 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 250,000 Tanzania shillings.


This is Mirim`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more beer for her business.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Mirium hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more beer

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en: Cristina A. raises hogs and at the same time engaged in mushroom production as their sources of income.  They are living in the rural place of Isidro Paredes, Diffun, Quirino. She is already 57 years old and is enjoying her hog raising and mushroom businesses. She earns income and at the same time enjoys her business thus she is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP5, 000 that will be utilize in the maintenance of her mushroom production and hog raising business. Cristina hopes to develop her business while she is still strong and determined. Cristina said that by working harder and she will become successful in every business endeavor.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites P. is a 34 year old widow who owns and manages a small store in front of her house. She has been in this business for four years and she is thankful for the continuous operation of her store.  Marites admits that being a widow is not that easy. She serves as the father and mother to her two children who were both studying.  Her husband passed away when their youngest was only ten months old.  Now, her youngest is  8 years old and her eldest is ten years old.  They are presently residing in the village of Anguapan Tumauini, Isabela, a place which is a little distant from the public market. 

Marites is looking forward to the success of her business and hoping to support the education of her children.  Marites is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to be used in purchasing the needed commodities she sells in her store. According to her she will do everything to make her business gain more income because this is the only source of income that she has.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Melba

texts.en: 54-year-old Melba L. is a food vendor. She sells snack food for the neighbors just to augment her farmer husband's sporadic income. Two months ago, she decided to open a small variety store in their house. Business capital she had then came from her only child who is a laborer. This is the only child she had living with her after five other children got married and moved to their own houses nearby. Though Melba has able to maintain her small variety store, the capital she had was not enough to fill up her store with basic items and products which people in the village need. Now that she is a member of ASHI, she has applied for a loan which will complete her variety store. She hopes that with this loan she will be able to sell more necessary items in her store for the convenience of her neighbors.

loans.use: Will be used to buy soft drinks and canned foods for sale in her variety store.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic N. and her family live in the simple village of Barangay in San Isidro Paredes of Diffun, Quirino province where she  maintains her mushroom production business situated in their backyard. She is now making an income from the mushrooms and, according to her, it is a good business if maintained and managed well. Her income in the said business also supports the education of her two children. Her husband Romeo also works very hard for them to overcome the prevailing economic crisis.  

Marivic is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 from Kiva lenders. She will utilize the loan for maintaining her mushrooms. She hopes that lenders will grant her request for the continuous improvement of her enterprise.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Jenipha

texts.en:
Jenipha is a member of the Nyamwenda 2 borrower group in Himo,Kilimanjaro,she is 30 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 4 children.Her children are aged 14,10,7 and 3 years.

Jenipha started her own clothing business selling clothes 3 years ago,she works 7 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 130,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Jenipha first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes for sale .

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Jenipha hopes to save money,pay school fees and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora Barbadan is a mother of six children. She is married to Timotheo who is now 60 years old. They live in a peaceful village surrounded by farms in Sitio Anguapan Tumauini, Isabela. Her husband also does farming and she hopes to help him  to able gain income for their daily needs by maintaining her business. 

Aurora manages a variety store in front of their house. Aside from this, she is also engaged in a livestock business where she raises swine. She decided to venture into  these businesses in 2001  in order to able support the needs of her children. She is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 7,000 to use in expanding her businesses.  All her efforts in making her dreams attainable are for the benefit of her children.

loans.use: Additional capital for business expansion

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is engaged in a hog raising business. Aside from this, she also retails charcoal in their village in order to have extra income. She wanted her business to be improved and be more profitable but due to lack of capital she couldn’t afford to purchase additional piglets to raise and hog feeds that are really needed.  Elsa would like to request for a loan amounting to PHP6, 000 to have additional capital for her business. She is hoping that her business will grow by the help of the loan she is requesting to avail.

Elsa is already 48 years old. With her husband Elito, they are blessed with five children. Most of them ended graduating in high school and unfortunately they weren’t able to pursue their studies in college due to difficulties of life. Her youngest is still attending his high school education. Elsa hopes to uplift their ways of living someday by working hard in the business she’s involved with.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
Gertrudes S. is from the village of Agusan Canyon, Camp Phillips, Bukidnon. She is 55 years old. Gertrudes is married and has 5 children. To make a living, Gertrudes owns and operates a 'sari-sari' (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Gertrudes has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Gertrudes joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gertrudes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand product offering. Gertrudes is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Gertrudes from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Jackielyn

texts.en:
Jackielyn S. is only 21 years old. She got married at an early age to Edmar whose occupation is farming. They now live in Barangay General Balao of Solana, Cagayan. Jackielyn is a vendor and really proud of the business she maintains because it is decent and legal. Some of her earnings are being saved for the future education of their children. Some of her income is also used to buy farm inputs they need.  

She wants to access a loan from Kiva amounting to PHP8,000 as additional capital for her vending business. She sells different kinds of vegetables in her stall, and also some fruits and some beans. She wants the business to grow and somehow expand into selling cooked foods. That way, her PHP200 daily net income will increase and she hopes that the business will be sustained well.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Manzoor Group

texts.en:
Mazoor S. is the group leader. He is single and lives in Jalalabad, Nangarhar province. With hard work, he formed a group of three members. Each one of them is busy with different tasks: Mazoor S. has a general store, Mahmood S. is a taxi driver, and Bibi S. has a tailoring business. 

They want to become stronger in their businesses, so they formed a group and requested a group loan. Each member requests 14,000 Afghani to further their work and be a good client for Kiva and AFS (Ariana Financial Services Joint Stock Company) in Jalalabad, Afghanistan. Mazoor ensures that they can repay the loan on time and he can lead the group. He would like to thank everybody who helps with this loan process in Afghanistan and other poor countries.

loans.use: To invest in making the businesses stronger

loans.name: Tulemane Group

texts.en:
Clara C., age 38, is married with four children, ages 19, 16,12 and 8 years. She has a general store. She has had this shop for about four years now.  She works from 7am to 8pm daily and is able to earn a monthly profit of about $427. 

This will be Clara’s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase the stock in her store and paid school fees for her firstborn. She has paid the loan back successfully. She now hopes for a new loan to further increase her inventory.

Clara will share this loan with the group Tulemane. The group has 22 members.  These members hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Clara is first on the left in the front row, wearing a blue dress.

loans.use: To further increase store inventory

loans.name: Theresia

texts.en:
Theresia is a member of the Embacasy borrower group in Himo,Kilimanjaro,she is 50 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 4 children,her children are aged 9,12,.16,20 years,she also cares other 4 dependents.


Theresia started her own business selling crops like maize,Tabacco 10 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 200,000 Tanzania shillings.


This is Theresia first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more crops for sale.


With the additional profit she gains from the use of this  loan Theresia hopes to get more food for family,pay school fees,ans expand her business

loans.use: To buy more crops

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent M. is a resident of Barangay San Jose, Santiago City. He is a simple person trying to give his family sufficient support for them to live a progressive life. He believes that a business which is selling of different dry goods such as kitchen utensils, raincoats and other things could be a big help. He usually purchases his products in the city of Santiago proper and sells in their village and nearby villages by means of walking while carrying the products on his shoulders.

He strives to give his family a better living. He is just 21 years old and is very aggressive in developing his buying and selling business. He is now requesting to borrow PHP 5,000 from Kiva lenders as additional capital. He believes that his patience in maintaining his business is a good step to start with. He just hopes that lenders will allow him to access the amount he is requesting to borrow.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 28 years old and a good mother to three children.  Her family simply resides in the General Balao village of Solana, Cagayan. She is married to Nicasio who is a farmer in their village. Farming is their major source of income and they help each other in uplifting their poor living situation by patiently working hard in their farming and in her hog raising business. 

Providing sufficient feeds supply to her hog raising will enable her to acquire bigger income than expected that is why, she wanted to avail a loan from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP6, 000 to further support her hog raising with complete feeds. She used to clean their pigpen daily and also feeds them 4-5 times a day. She hopes to succeed in her business undertakings all for the wellness of her family especially her children.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra L. is from the village of Agusan, Canyon Camp Phillips, Bukidnon. She is 40 years old. Alejandra is married and has 10 school-aged children. To make a living, Alejandra owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling vegetables in the local community. Alejandra has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Alejandra joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alejandra has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Alejandra is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Alejandra from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer C. is a dealer in cosmetic products like MSE and at the same time a vendor of woven cradles. She wants to take out a loan to support her small livelihood project so it will grow. An initial amount of PHP 5,000 will already be of big help to her so she will be able to maintain their cradle weaving and her direct selling of MSE products. Her business income has helped her send her children to school and she hopes that someday, she can continue sending them to college.

She is happily married to Valeriano C. who is an OFW (overseas Filipino worker). They have three children who are Joliza - 12 years old and already a high school freshman; Jerome - 8 years old and in the third grade in the elementary level, while Jonathan is merely 2 years old. Jennifer is sacrificing to be a good mother and father to their three children while her husband is working abroad and at the same time manages to generate income by her direct selling and buying and selling of woven cradles.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Bibi Pakia Group

texts.en: Bibi Pakia is the group leader of Bibi Pakia group. There are three members in this group. They are requesting a loan to expand businesses. They are requesting a group of loan 30,000 Afghani. Bibi Pakia wants to take a loan for her husband who has general store. Fwazia wants to take a loan for her husband who has fuel selling shop. Hadala wants to take a loan for the business of a beauty salon. They all very thankful for Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding businesses

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen S. is already 33 years old and engaged in mushroom production and a direct sales business. She is happily married to Darwin who is a truck driver. They live happily in the village of Isidro Paredes in Diffun Quirino.

Aileen also sells her mushrooms in other villages and sometimes in their market. Maintaining the business needs enough financial capital to buy the needed amount of mushrooms. She is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP 5,000 for her to further develop her direct sales business.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en: Sonia, 26 years old and her husband Renato are married three years ago. They have no child yet that is why Sonia had started growing a business to stabilize their income to finance the need of their children in the future. She joined ASHI eight months ago for a loan which she used for starting her variety store. Six months after repaying the whole amount she loaned from ASHI, she is now requesting for a larger amount of loan to finance the growth of her variety store. She plans to purchase soft drinks and rice for selling.

loans.use: Will be used for financing a variety store business.

loans.name: Emmylou

texts.en:
Emmylou B. is from the village of Agusan Canyon, Camp Phillips, Bukidnon. She is 26 years old. Emmylou is married and has 2 very young children. To make a living, Emmylou owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling tropical aqua fish in the local community. Emmylou has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Emmylou joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emmylou is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Emmylou from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Rizzalyne

texts.en:
Rizzalyne is a retailer of vegetables and mushrooms in their village. She sells their own harvested mushrooms in their backyard since it is the main product produced in their village in Isidro, Paredes, Diffun, Quirino aside from rice. She hopes to receive a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 as additional capital for her mushroom production and for her to further improve her vending business of vegetables.

She is already 25 years old and married to Arleen D. C.. The couple is gifted with two children namely: Rizza Mae - 8 years old and Yvan - 5 years old Both are enrolled in a public school in their village. She hopes that they will be able to continue their studies.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina T. is from the village of Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 38 years old. Lina is married. To make a living, Lina owns and operates a 'sari-sari' (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Lina has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lina is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Lina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Theresia

texts.en:
Theresia is a member of the Embacasy  borrower group ,she is 32 years old woman,she is married and mother of 3 children,Her children are aged 4,8,10 years.

Theresia started her own crops business selling Tobaccos,Beans 5 years ago,she works 10 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 180,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Theresia`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more tobacco and beans.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Theresia hopes to save money,pay school fees and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more tobacco,beans

loans.name: Rotilda

texts.en:
Rotilda has been working hard to provide a better life for her children. Her husband makes an income from their welding shop while she works as a vegetable vendor in their village to be of help in sustaining their family. She is hoping for their business to be more progressive in order to be more profitable for the future of her children.

Rotilda is already 47 years old, her family lives in the big community of San Ignacio Ilagan, Isabela. In her vending routine, she is generating an average income of PHP 150 daily. That amount is already of big help for her family but according to her, it's too little for their growing needs and the educational needs of her children.

She wants to increase her income and in order to achieve this goal, Rotilda is seeking financial assistance from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP 4,000. Rotilda has a lot of dreams for her four children who are all enrolled in school. She hopes that all of them will be able to go in college and finish their studies so that in due time, they will be able to obtain a good and stable job in the future.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane A. is a simple resident of Isidro Paredes in Diffun Quirino. She is already 28 years old and married to Warlito. They help each other in making their mushroom production business become progressive. Their harvested mushroom is being sold in the market by Mary Jane alone. According to her, the product is really in demand though it is a little bit expensive. The product is organically produced that explains why most of their customers/buyers are those in the middle class and high class families in their province. 

For her to further make the business progressive, she is requesting a loan amounting to PHP5, 000 from Kiva lenders that will be of big help in making their business grow for the welfare of their family especially their children in the future.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Ghullam Aly Group

texts.en:
Ghullam Alay   is the group leader of Ghullam Alay group. There are four members in this group. All of them want to receive money for their business.
Masodan and G. Khanam want to take a loan for their business of tailoring. They want to buy a new machine for their business. Also Norya wants take a loan for her business of embroidery. She wants to take necessary materials for her business. And Ghullam Alay   
Wants to take a loan for his business of carpenter. He wants to complete her stock. They want to thank form the loan of 56000 Afghani.
With this loan they can make larger their business. And support their families and make a better future for themselves and there families in future and thanks the all lenders of AFSG and Kiva.

loans.use: they are make larger their business

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
“Persevere for the success of life” says Cecilia. She is a responsible housewife of Bruno and they live in the rural community of Barangay Salvacion, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. Despite of her low educational attainment, she has the strong determination to improve their status of living and give their four children a better future. Their primary source of income is through charcoal retailing business. Her husband makes charcoal out from his cut woods in the forest while Cecilia is the one who retails the product in the market. 

She wanted to borrow loan from Kiva amounting to PHP5, 000 for the maintenance of their charcoal making business and somehow will enable her to expand into selling other vending products like vegetables. Her income in the business daily helps her provide for the needs of her children who were enrolled in high school and elementary.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Bibi Sheren Group

texts.en: Bibi Sheren is the group leader of Bibi Sheren group. There are four members in this group. Each of them wants to take a loan to grow their businesses and make them larger. They have requested a group of loan 40,000 Afghani. Bibi Sheren wants to take a loan for the business of quilt making. Gul Ghati wants to take a loan for the business of tailoring. Sharefa wants to take a loan for her husband who has general store. Salia wants to take a loan for a bakery. They are very happy for this loan process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To grow their businesses (quilt making, tailoring, general store, bakery)

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a member of the Embacassy 1 In Himo,Kilimanjaro,she is 42 years old woman,she is married and e mother of 6 children.Her children are aged 3,8,12,15,18 and 22 years.

Fatuma started her own crops business selling Tobacco,beans 20 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 100,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Embacassy first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 In order to buy more crops for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Fatuma hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more beans,and  tobacco

loans.name: Meliza

texts.en:
Meliza M. is a simple hog-raiser in the village of San Jose, Santiago City. She treats her business with passion and dedication. The business gives her family big financial support, especially during emergencies. She wants to sustain the business to enable her children to finish their courses in college.

Maintaining the feed supply of her newly-born piglets is difficult for Meliza because she doesn’t have enough financial capital. Thus, she wants to borrow PHP 5,000 from Kiva lenders to use as additional business capital.

Meliza is thankful that her husband is very supportive, though he is busy in their field. Still, he finds the time to help her with her business. Also, she is thankful for having her four children who help her in maintaining the livestock. Her eldest child is Nicanor - 24 years old, followed by Alfredo - 22 years old, Catherine - 20 years old and Redel - 12 years old. Two of them are still attending school.

loans.use: To use as additional business capital

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Work hard and be patient in overcoming the difficulties of life, shared Aileen. She is managing a little stall selling different snacks such as noodles, bread, candies and so on. She is a resident of Barangay Salvacion Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She was not able to pursue her college education because she got pregnant before getting married, when she was in her last year in high school.

To make her business grow, Aileen is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP 5,000 as additional business capital. She wants to increase her income and as much as possible double her time for her child is already in his senior year in high school. Aileen wishes to provide her child with his need for education. She knows her son will be responsible for her when she grows old and thus she wants him attain his ambitions in life for their future. She once became a failure as a teenager but now is a proud mother without expecting help from others in managing her son’s education. She just hopes that lenders will grant her loan request.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
Pilar S. is from the village of Baluarte, Lumbia Cagayan de Oro City. She is 42 years old. Pilar is married and has 5 children. To make a living, Pilar owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling firewood in the local community. Pilar has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Pilar joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pilar has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase more inventory. Pilar is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Pilar from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Jinky

texts.en:
Jinky is a direct seller of Board Walk and NATASHA products. She is already 45 years old and is married to Arnolfo who works abroad for already three years now. They were gifted with 3 children, the eldest is Cherilyn Kate - 12 years old and the youngest is Argie - 10 years old both were in the grade school. The family lives in the simple community of Rio Del Grande in Enrile, Cagayan. 

Aside from direct selling, Jinky is also a vendor of meat .  She sells meat twice a week for her to have quality days spend to her family while at the same time doing a business. She wanted to borrow loan amounting to PHP5, 000 as additional business capital for she believes that the business is good enough to maintain their daily living and for the education of her children if it will be develop further. Having the amount will enable her increase her capital to revolve in the business and will somehow generate higher income.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Fevily

texts.en:
Fevily is a mother of two children, one and three years old. Her husband Randy is a baker while she has been running a hog fattening business for three years. Though she was able to have her own business, still, enhancing it and sustaining it was hard because she has no means of financing all the expenses that her family incurs. Her husband's income is also insufficient to finance all their needs.

Early in 2009, Fevily joined ASHI for a loan which she used for financing her hog-fattening business. She raised more than she had raised three years ago. The profit she had from hog-fattening is as much double her capital. Now that she had fully repaid her first loan, she is requesting a much larger amount for the same business. Someday, out of her business profit, she will be able to send both of her children to school until college and then she hopes that they will have a better life.

loans.use: Will be used to finance her hog-fattening (pig raising) business

loans.name: Fransica

texts.en:
Fransica is a member of the Embacassy 1 in Himo,Kilimanjaro,she is 50 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 3 children,Her children are aged 28,30,34,years.she also cares for other 3 dependents.

Fransica started her own business selling Tabacco 10 years ago,she works 11 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 100,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Fransica first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 150,000 Tsh in order to buy more Tabaccos for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan Fransica hopes to save money,get more food for family and expand her business

loans.use: To buy more  tabacco for sale

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia C. is from the village of Baluarte, Lumbia Cagayan De Oro City. She is 36 years old. Emelia is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Emelia owns and operates a variety store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of products in the local community. Sometimes she also does food vending as her sideline. Emelia has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Emelia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emelia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. Emelia is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Emelia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children and pay her weekly obligation.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Baluarte, Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: For expanding businesses

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a member of the Embacasy borrower group in Himo,kilimanjaro,she is 40 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 5 children.Her children are aged 8,12,15,18,20 years.

Grace started her own business selling Tobaccos 3 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Grace`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more tobaccos for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,grace hopes to save more money,get more food for family,pay school fees and expand her business

loans.use: To buy more tobaccos

To make a living, Verna owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling firewood in the local community. Verna has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Verna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Verna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. Verna is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional stock. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Verna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children.

location.town: Baluarte, Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Erma

texts.en: Erma and her husband Ricky have been  doing blacksmith manufacturing business since five years ago. They got the idea of having this kind of business from Erma's brother in-law. It was hard for them then to grow their business because they had no any other source of capital aside from their own profit which is also their source of everyday expenses. Erma's four children aging from four to 11 incur a lot of expenses from their school and other basic needs. Wanting to grow the business and finance the needs of her children at the same time, Erma joined ASHI early of 2009. She had a loan which she used in her business and now that she had repaid whole amount of it, she requests for another loan with larger amount than her previous. Her very good performance especially in repayment guarantee her of receiving her desired amount. With her blacksmith manufacturing business and the profit it will make, Erma aspired to be able to send all of her children to college and have them graduated from their own chosen course.

loans.use: Will be used for financing her blacksmith manufacturing business.

loans.name: Leoncia

texts.en: Leoncia A. is from the village of Baluarte, Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 51 years old, is widowed, and has four adult children. Leoncia owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling firewood in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month. In 2008, Leoncia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. Leoncia is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Baluarte, Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina N. is a woman with the courage and determination to overcome poverty. She is 43 years old and the mother of four, all daughters. She was widowed and left with four children to take care of. She lives in the busy town of Morong, Rizal province in the Philippines.

Life was not easy for Josefina when her husband died. She needed to work and look for a living to support the needs of her children. In 1999, she decided to join ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines. During her membership in ASHI, she was noted for her exemplary performance in terms of responding to her responsibilities in the organization.

For almost ten years already, Josefina has been engaged in the resale of ready-to-wear clothes and beauty products. When she first joined ASHI, she used her first loans as starting and rolling capital for the business. The business became her main source of income and she receives a good income and proceeds.

Now Josefina is requesting a loan of 25,000 pesos as additional capital for her business. Specifically, the amount will be used to pay for pants, short pants, T-shirts, face powder, perfumes and many others similar items. She has regular customers and she also receives and accepts orders.

Josefina hopes to send her younger children to school until they finish college and find jobs. She also hopes to expand her business and be able to have more stock. She even aspires to having a space in the market.

loans.use: To pay for pants, short pants, T-shirts, face powder, perfumes and other goods

loans.name: Loreli

texts.en:
Loreli T. hails from the city of Antipolo, Rizal province in the Philippines. She is 38 years old, married, and has two children: a boy and a girl. Her husband, Ernesto, is a private driver and is 44 years old. Loreli believes that poverty is just a stepping stone to success: just do the hard work and be a wise spender.

For almost ten years Loreli has been selling both frozen foods and ready-to-wear clothes. The business runs smoothly and has become their major source of income. She buys frozen food and stores it in her freezer and people come to buy it. Sometimes she also roams around their village to sell her frozen foods. The same with her ready-to-wear clothes: she buys the stock in bulk and displays it in her house where people, especially teenagers, are her customers.

Now on her 7th loan, Loreli proposes a loan of 40,000 pesos as additional capital for her businesses. Specifically, the loan will be used to pay for assorted frozen foods and the remaining amount used as rolling capital to buy ready-to-wear clothes, and for transportation and delivery expenses.

Loreli is hopeful that with the trust given her by ASHI and Kiva, she can make her business grow and be able to send her children to school until college and have savings for their future.

loans.use: To pay for frozen foods, ready-to-wear clothes, and transportation and delivery expenses

loans.name: Raheli

texts.en:
Raheli is a member of the Embacasy 3 Borrower group in Himo,Kilimanjaro,she is 47 years old woman, she is Married and a mother of 5 children.Her children are aged 1,3,6,8,10 years..she also cares for other 5 dependents.

Raheli started her own fruits business 15 years ago,she works 10 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Raheli first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more fruits for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Raheli hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more fruits

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda P. is from the village of Baluarte, Lumbia Cagayan De Oro City. She is 47 years old. Emelda is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Emelda owns and operates a specialized retail business. The main source of income for the business comes from buying green bananas in the local community. Emelda has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Emelda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emelda has successfully repaid a previous loan from HSPFI. Emelda is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used as additional business capital. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Emelda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.
