loans.use: as additional business capital

location.town: Baluarte, Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria D. R. is a 43-year-old mother to two; all boys. She is married to Roberto who is 54 years old. She lives in the City of Antipolo, Rizal province in the Philippines. She is a woman of faith and courage to overcome poverty.
With her desire to overcome poverty, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines, in 2005. Her previous loans were used as starting and rolling capital on her resale business.  She has been doing the business for five years already. She is happy of the income the business brings her. She is so industrious to sell her products on their village. She already has regular costumers and she also receives orders. She buys her stocks on bulk and resale it.
Now she proposes a loan of 40,000 pesos as additional capital for her resale business. The loan will be used to pay for beauty soap, herbal coffee, lotion, grape seeds, prime juice, fit and right and other products. She aspires of bringing her family out of poverty. To send her children to school until college until they find jobs. Also to expand her business and dreams of having a space in the market in the near future.

loans.use: To pay for beauty soap, herbal coffee, lotion, grape seeds, prime juice, fit and right and other products.

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena R. is from the village of Baluarte, Lumbia Cagayan De Oro City. She is 53 years old. Lucena is married and has 9 children. To make a living, Lucena owns and operates a specialized retail business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling firewood in the local community. Lucena has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Lucena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. Lucena is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Lucena from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her house.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional firewood

location.town: Baluarte, Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena and her husband Gregorio are blacksmith manufacturer since 20 years ago. This is the kind of business that enable them to send all of there eight children to school. Three are college undergraduate, three presently are still studying in college, one in high school and the youngest in elementary. Expenses they had for the education of their children and for their basic needs has disabled the growth of the business, however they tried there best in maintaining it. 
Eight months ago, Elena decided to join ASHI for a financial assistance. She had loan then to be used for financing her business and for supplementing its growth. Now, she had repaid the whole amount she loaned on time and she requests for another loan larger than the first she had for the same purpose in addition of hog fattening business. With hog fattening she doesn't need to buy piglet to be raised since she is also breeding pigs. Profit with this kind of business is as much double of its capital after four months of raising. Someday she wants to have her own blacksmith shop in public places for more costumers.

loans.use: Will be used to finance her blacksmith manufacturing business and a small portion will be used to finance her hog fattening (pig raising) business.

loans.name: Matilde Dos Santos

texts.pt:
Matilde dos Santos N. nasceu na província de Maputo no distrito de magude (a 200 km a norte de maputo), tem 51 anos de idade, fez a 3 classe na era colonial e parou por falta de condições financeiras. É casada, pai de 4 filhos maiores de idade que vivem nas suas casas. Vive no distrito de boane no bairro de Marconi com seu marido e 3 netos sob sua responsabilidade.

Matilde cresceu na companhia dos seus pais e mais tarde mudou se juntamente com os pais para o distrito da Manhica donde mais tarde casou se e, devido à guerra dos 16 anos, que era bastante intensa neste distrito, saiu para o distrito de Boane em busca de lugar mais seguro para viver, no ano de 1985.

Foi desde essa altura que aprendeu a fazer actividades de geração de renda, enquanto o marido trabalhava numa das pedreiras de Boane (este distrito possui cerca de 4 pedreiras onde se extrai pedra para construções de casas e estradas).

Matilde é comerciante e dona do negocio. Vende vários produtos de primeira necessidade (sabão, colgates cervejas e refrescos) que os adquire na cidade de Maputo e rende cerca de 500,00MT por mês e consegue poupar algum valor no Banco comercial.

Já teve empréstimos com uma Associação de créditos que usava metodologia de grupos solidários e tendo levantado e concluído os valores de 1.500,00MT; 2.500,00MT e 3.000,00MT com sucesso. E, com a Hluvuku-Adsema este é o seu quarto empréstimo no valor de 23.500,00MT que pretende ampliar o seu negocio (vendendo peixe). Quer iniciar a venda deste produto porque o os produtos que vende actualmente não tem tido muita procura.

Teve informações sobre a Hluvuku-Adsema através de vizinhos e tendo levantando 16.00,00MT; 22.000,00MT e 23.000,00MT, respectivamente para o exercício da mesma actividade (venda de produtos de primeira necessidade).

Propõe se a pagar o empréstimo para poder aceder a mais créditos com o objectivo de ampliar o estabelecimento comercial.
texts.en:
Matilde dos Santos N. was born in the province of Maputo in the Magude district (200km north of Maputo). She is 51 years old. She attended school until the 3rd grade in the colonial era and stopped attending due to financial considerations. She is married and has 4 adult children who have their own homes. She lives in the Boane district in the Marconi neighborhood with her husband and 3 grandchildren, whom she supports. Matilde grew up with her parents and later moved with them to Manhica where she later married. Due to the 16 year war, which was very intense in this region, she left for Boane in 1985 to find a safer place to live. During this same timeframe, she learned to do activities that could generate income, while her husband worked in one of the Boane quarries (this area has around 4 quarries where stones are extracted for construction of homes and roads). Matilde owns her own business. She sells a variety of items to meet basic needs (soap, toothpaste, beer, soft drinks) that she acquires in Maputo. She earns around 500,000MT per month and is able to save some money in a commercial Bank. She has had loans in the past with an association that used group loan methodology, through which she took out and successfully paid off loans of 1.500,00 MT; 2.000,00 MT and 3.000,00 MT. This loan with Hluvuku-Adsema will be her fourth, with a value of 23.500,00 MT that she will used to expand her business (by selling fish). She wants to start selling fish because the products she currently sells have not had much demand. She learned about Hluvuku-Adsema through neighbors who had taken out loans for 16.00,00 MT; 22.000,00 MT and 23.000,00 MT, respectively, for similar activities (selling basic goods). She plans to pay off the loan to have access to future loans with the goal of growing her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy and sell personal care  and other products

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn V. hails from the coastal town of Cardona, Rizal province in the Philippines. She is separated and living with her business partner Marialyn, who is 38 years old and a fish vendor. Jonalyn is 42 years old and a mother of two, both a son and a daughter.

When her husband left her with two children to take care of, she was challenged and determined to look for a living that could sustain the needs of her children. She wants to prove to her husband that she can give a proper education and life to her kids.

In 2007, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines, full of hope to have access to capital to start a business. Her previous loan was used as additional capital for her current business, the resale of assorted slippers and sandals. After more than three years of doing this business, she is happy since she receives a good income from it. She displays her products at her house and sometimes roams around her village and other nearby villages to sell her goods.

Now she asks for a loan of 10,000 pesos as additional capital to pay for 10 dozen assorted slippers and sandals for resale and also to pay for transportation expenses. She is hopeful that she can make her business grow which will bring her more profits for her to save and improve her living status.

loans.use: To pay for 10 dozen assorted slippers and sandals for resale and also to pay for transportation expenses.

loans.name: Fernado

texts.pt:
Fernando Cossa nasceu na província de Maputo, distrito de Boane no Bairro Mozal, tem 36 anos de idade, casado e pai de dois filhos com idades compreendidas entre três e 10 anos, estando o mais velho a freqüentar escola. Estudou ate 2 classe devido à falta de condições por parte dos seus pro genitores. Para alem dos filhos não sustenta mais ninguém.

Cresceu na companhia dos seus pais e só saiu para viver no bairro de Umpala quando contraiu matrimonio. O seu trabalho é de venda de produtos diversos produtos e pequenos trabalhos de pedreiro. Faz negócios desde o ano de 2005 tendo aprendido com os amigos no bairro da Mozal. Vende produtos de limpeza e outros de primeira necessidade a mais de 4 anos. Ganha mensalmente 3.000,00MT que aplica no sustento da família e amortização de credito. 

Nunca teve empréstimo com outros bancos, com a Hluvuku-Adsema e este é o seu terceiro credito no valor de 15.00,00MT para compra de produtos de primeira necessidade (sabão em pó. Arroz e outros). Os outros empréstimos também foram para a mesma actividade nos valores respectivos de 8.000,00MT e 12.600,00MT. Teve informações através de amigos e vizinhos.

Conta que o seu negocio poderá crescer bastante e que vai poder pagar o empréstimo sem problemas para poder aceder a mais empréstimos com objectivo de construir um estabelecimento de alvenaria.
texts.en:
Fernando Cossa was born in the province of Maputo, Boane district, in the Mozal neighborhood. He is 36 years old, married, and the father of two children ages 3 and 10. His older child attends school. Fernando attended school until the second grade when he dropped out due to his parents’ financial situation. He does not support anyone else beyond his children. Fernando grew up with his parents and only left to live in the Umpala area when he got married. He sells a variety of products and does small jobs as a stone mason. He has been in business since 2005, which he learned from friends in Mozal. He has been selling cleaning products and other basic needs items for the past 4 years. He earns 3.000,00 MT per month which he uses to support his family and pay of his loan. He has never had a loan with other banks. With Hluvuku-Adsema this is his third loan, in the amount of 15.000,00 MT which he will use to purchase items such as powdered soap, rice, etc. His other loans were for the same activity in the amounts of 8.000,00 MT and 12.600,00 MT respectively. He learned about Hluvuku-Adsema through friends and neighbors. He believes his business can grow a great deal and he will be able to pay off the loan without any problems so that he can have access to future loans that he will use to build a establishment made of brick.

Translated from Portuguese by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy and sell cleaning and other products

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena B. is from the village of Baluarte, Lumbia Cagayan De Oro City. She is 39 years old. Elena is married and has 10 school-aged children. To make a living, Elena  engages in business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail business. The main source of income for the business will come primarily from selling of firewood and buying and selling of green bananas in the local community.

In 2008, Elena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. Elena is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Elena from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve/expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Baluarte, Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Jorge Domingos

texts.pt:
Jorge domingos J. nasceu na cidade da Beira (segunda capital do pais, no centro a 1200 km de Maputo) casado e pai de 4 filhos com idades compreendidas entre 4 e 18 anos dos quais 3 frequentam escola. Estudou ate 7 classe, tendo interrompido devido à doença que lhe atacou bastante neste ano. Para alem dos filhos sustenta seus irmãos enviando lhes dinheiro, mensalmente.

Saiu da Beira no ano de 1980 para cumprir o serviço Militar obrigatório na província de Maputo e desde lá nunca mais voltou para sua terra natal nem para outro ponto do pais.
É desmobilizado e trabalha como segurança na empresa G4, segurança a mais de 8 anos. Foi formado como militar neste distrito de boane (o distrito tem o um dos maiores quartéis do pais). Ganha como pensionista 1.500,00MT e 3.000,00MT na empresa de segurança.

Vive na casa própria e com o empréstimo de 15.000,00MT pretende comprar materiais de construção de uma casa de alvenaria. Este é o seu terceiro empréstimo. Os outros créditos foram também para mesma actividade (8.000,00MT e 14.500,00MT).
Teve informações através de amigos e colegas que vivem neste distrito de boane.

Nunca teve empréstimo com outros bancos ou instituições similares e espera pagar o presente credito para poder aceder a mais empréstimos com objectivo de concluir a sua casa e posterior apetrecha mento. De forma voluntária, concorda compartilhar a sua historia no site do kiva.
texts.en:
Jorge Domingos J. was born in the city of Beira (Mozambique's second capital, 1200 km away from Maputo in the middle of the country). He is married and has four children between the ages of 4 and 18. Three of them attend school. He went to school until 7th grade, when he became ill and had to stop. In addition to his children, he supports his brothers, sending them money every month. He left Beira in 1980 to carry out his obligatory military service in Maputo, and hasn't left Maputo since then or returned to his hometown. He is no longer enlisted and has worked as a security guard at the G4 company for more than eight years. He was trained as a soldier in Boane, which has one of the largest barracks in the country. He gets a military pension of 1500 meticals a month, and earns 3000 meticals a month as a security guard. He lives in his own home, and plans to use the 15,000 meticals requested to buy construction materials in order to build a brick house. This is his third loan. His other loans were for the same purpose (8000 and 14,500 meticals). He learned about Hluvuku through friends and colleagues who live in Boane. He's never had a loan from other banks or similar institutions, and he hopes to pay off the present loan in order to request further assistance, with the goal of completing and furnishing his house. He has voluntarily agreed to share his story on Kiva's website.

Translated from Portuguese by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials for a brick house.

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.en:
Cornelia F. manages her own business. She is a native of the busy town of Cardona, Rizal province, in the Philippines. She is happily living with her four children, who are all of legal age. Her business partner is her second son Arnuld, who is 37 years old. Cornelia is 67 years old, yet full of determination to rise up from poverty.

Due to her desire to overcome poverty, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines, in 2003. Her hope was to have access to capital for her business. She carefully spent her previous loans to stock her general store, her primary business, and on upholstery, her secondary one. Both of her businesses are performing well and she is satisfied with the proceeds she receives. She wants to invest more in her businesses.

Now on her 11th loan, she asks for an amount of 20,000 pesos as additional capital to pay for stock for her general store. Part of the loan will also finance her upholstery business. She is hopeful that with the trust and confidence given by ASHI, in partnership with KIVA, she will be able to expand and make her businesses sustainable.

loans.use: To pay for stock for her general store and to finance her upholstery business.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: Lourdes H. is from the village of Baluarte, Lumbia Cagayan de Oro City. She is 46 years old, is married, and has six school-aged children. Lourdes owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling specialty food products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Lourdes joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. Lourdes is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

location.town: Baluarte, Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Elisa Alberto

texts.pt:
Nasceu na provincial de gaza, tem 31 anos de idade, mãe de 1 filho de 5 anos de idade. Concluiu o ensino médio de professorado e para alem dos da filha sustenta também duas sobrinhas vivendo na mesma casa. Não vive com o marido (pai do filho).

Saiu da província de Gaza quando tinha vinte anos para namaacha (no centro de formação de professores básicos) e depois de concluir fez o nível médio no Instituto de Magistérios primários na cidade de Matola no ano de 2001. Neste momento trabalha como professora na escola da vila de Boane. Saiu de Gaza sozinha. Recebe um salário mensal no valor de 6.142,00MT que aplica no sustento da família e pagamento de credito.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos e este é o seu segundo credito com a hluvuku (o primeiro com kiva) no valor de 14.000,00MT que pretende comprar material de construção de uma casa de alvenaria. Vai poder cobrir uma parte da casa. O primeiro empréstimo no valor de 12.000,00MT, também foi para a mesma actividade.

O seu maior sonho é de ver a casa concluída para confortar a sua família (filha, sobrinhas e outros filhos no futuro) e para tal, propõe se pagar o empréstimo sem problemas como forma de aceder a mais créditos e manter a sua personalidade.
texts.en:
She was born in the providence of Gaza. She is 31 years old and the mother of a son who is 5 years old. She finished her secondary education in teaching, and besides her son she also support 2 nieces who live in their home. She does not live with her husband (father of her son). She left the providence of Gaza when she was 20 and moved to Namaacha (the center of basic teacher training) and after completing that she went to the next level at the Institute of Primary Teachers in the city of Matola in 2001. Right now she is working as a teacher in a school in the town of Boane. She left Gaza alone. She receives a monthly salary of 6,142MT which she uses to sustain her family and pay her debts. She has never had a loan through another bank and this is her second loan with Hluvuku (first with Kiva) in the amount of 14,000MT. She intends to purchase construction materials to work on her home. She is going to cover a part of the home with brick. The first loan for 12,000MT was also used for the same activity. Her dream is to see her home finished to comfort her family (son, nieces, and future children) and so she intends to pay off the loan without problems. This way she can receive more loans and maintain her reputation.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials for brick home

loans.name: Kamela

texts.en:
Kamela and her son, Issam, own a small piece of land they use to plant vegetables, especially eggplant and tomatoes. They started planting the land two years ago in order to increase their income. Since Issam is an employee and getting married, but his salary is not enough to cover daily expenses, they thought of planting the land to increase their income.

Kamila appears in the photo taking care of her plants.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth R. is a woman who believes that poverty is not a hindrance to success. She is 36 years old and married to Salvador who is 41 years old and a private employee. Elizabeth is the mother to three: a girl and two boys. She lives in the busy town of Morong, Rizal province in the Philippines.

Elizabeth is a busy woman engaged in the sale of vegetables, rice and sugar. In 2004, With her determination to improve and develop her business, she joined ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines with the hope of having access to capital for her business. Her previous loans were carefully used as rolling capital for her business. She has been running her business for four years already. It has brought her a good and justifiable income and she wants to invest more in it.

Now on her 7th loan, Elizabeth is requesting PHP 20,000 as additional rolling capital for her business. Specifically, the loan will be used to pay for five sacks of sugar, assorted vegetables, four sacks of rice and to pay for transportation expenses. She is hopeful that her business will grow and will bring her enough proceeds to save for the future school fees of her children. She also dreams of having a mini-grocery store someday.

loans.use: To buy stock for her business and to pay for transportation expenses

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Cette femme est mariée et mère de 02 enfants, son mari est un menuisier, le revenu de son  mari est insuffisant pour couvrir les charges du foyer, pour apporter sa contribution elle a commencé le commerce de poissons, elle exerce ce commerce au marché local d’adidogomé qui constitue un véritable point de vente pour elle. Elle fait face en ce moment à une baisse de son stock de marchandises, pour se réapprovisionner, elle sollicite un premier crédit de WAGES pour acheter 03 paniers de poissons.
texts.en:
Akouvi A. is married and the mother of two children. Her husband is a carpenter whose income is insufficient to meet the expenses of the household. Akouvi started a fish trade on the local market of Adiogomé to contribute to the family's needs. Her supply became too low recently, which is why she applies to WAGES for her first loan to stock up again. She will buy three baskets of fish.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Carlos Agostinho

texts.pt:
Carlos agostinho M. nasceu na cidade de maputo, tem 34 anos de idade, casado e pai de 4 filhos com idades compreendidas entre 3 e 13 anos, estando os três primeiros a freqüentar escola. Estudou ate 6 classe, tendo parando por falta de condições financeiras para custear as despesas de transporte.
Vive na casa própria e sustenta também sua mãe que vive com ela na mesma casa. A esposa é comerciante (dedica se na venda de produtos diversos).

Saiu da cidade de maputo para Boane na companhia dos seus pais ha. bastante tempo e trabalha na empresa estatal ARA sul (Administração regional de Águas) ha mais de 8 anos e obtém um salário mensal no valor de 2.500,00MT que aplica no sustento da família e pagamento de credito. 

Este é o seu terceiro empréstimo com a hluvuku e primeiro com kiva no valor de 12.000,00MT para compra de material de construção. Os primeiros empréstimos de 8.000,00Mt 6.000,0MT respectivamente para a mesma actividade.

Nunca teve credito em outras instituições e obteve informações através de amigos e colegas clientes da hluvuku-adsema. Propõe se a pagar o empréstimo sem problemas para poder adceder a mais créditos para terminar com a construção da sua casa de alvenaria e mobiliar.
texts.en:
Carlos Agostinho M. was born in the city of Maputo. He is 34 years old, married, and the father of 4 children with ages between 3 and 13 years old. The first three are in school. He went to school until the 6th grade, but he stopped because he lacked the financial conditions to afford the expense of transportation. He lives in his own home and also supports his mother who lives with him. His wife is in the trade business (dedicated to selling various products). He left the city of Maputo for Boane in the company of his parents a long time ago. He has worked for the state-owned company, ARA South (Regional Administration of Water) for more than 8 years, and he earns a monthly salary of 2,500MT which he uses to sustain his family and pay his debts. This is his third loan with Hluvuku and his first with Kiva in the amount of 12,000MT, which he intends to use to purchase construction materials. The first two loans of 8,000MT and 6,000MT respectively were used for the same activity. He has never had credit through other institutions, and he obtained information about Hluvuku-Adsema through friends and colleagues who are clients. He intends to pay off this loan without problems so he will be able to get more loans to finish the construction on his brick home and then furnish it.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials for a brick home

loans.name: Barbara

texts.en:
Barbara A. is 28 years old and the mother of a boy and a girl. She got married early to Arnel, who is 32 years old and a jeepney driver. She lives in the beautiful town of Cardona, Rizal province in the Philippines.

With her determination to bring a better life to her family, especially to her children, Barbara needed to engage in a business that could add support to her husband’s meager income. In 2006, she joined ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines, hoping to have access to capital to start a business. When she received her first loan, she invested it in the resale of frozen foods and, with her next loan and up to the present, she is still in the same business. She likes the business since her product is in demand with families during breakfast as food for their children. She already has regular customers and even receives orders.

Now, Barbara is requesting a loan of 20,000 pesos as additional capital for her resale of frozen foods. Specifically, the loan will be used to pay for twenty kilos of pork longganisa (sausages flavored with indigenous spices), twenty kilos of hotdogs, twenty kilos of ground beef, and to pay for transportation expenses. Some will be set aside as rolling capital.

Barbara hopes that with the support of ASHI and the assistance of Kiva lenders, she can reach her dreams: to send her children to school until college; to expand her business; and to set her family free from poverty.

loans.use: To buy more frozen food to sell and to pay for transportation expenses

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: Marina O. is from the village of Salay, Misamis Oriental. She is 42 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Marina owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Marina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business and to support the education of her children. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ayao Toviegnon

texts.fr: Cet homme a démarré depuis 2008 dans le quartier d’Agoè assiyéyé à Lomé le commerce très prisé d’une boisson locale dénommée « sodabi ». Son commerce devenant de plus en plus prospère, il sollicite un prêt de WAGES pour s’approvisionner et maintenir son marché en pleine expansion. Cet homme est marié et père d’un enfant.c'est avec ce qu'il gagne de ce commerce qu'il subvient aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ayao Toviegnon A. is married and the father of a child. In 2008 he set up a very successful business selling sodabi, an alcoholic drink much appreciated by the locals. The income from this business enables him to provide for his family. His business becomes increasingly prosperous, which is why he applies to WAGES for a loan to stock up. This will help him to keep up with the fast-expanding demand from his customers.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy alcoholic drinks

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a member of the Zilipendwa borrower group in Himo,Kilimanjaro,she is 30 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 2 children.Her children are aged 10 and 8 years.

Veronica started her own business selling soap,Colgate etc 2 years ago,she works 13 hours and earn a monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Veronica`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 150,000 Tsh in order to buy more soap,Colgate.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Veronica hopes to save more money,pay school fees  and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy nmore soap,colgate,

loans.name: Safa

texts.en:
Safa owns a small grocery shop at Al-Nusairat Refugee camp. Her husband is an employee and she has four children, two of whom are teenagers who help her to sell at the store during summer vacation.

Safa is the main person who is responsible for selling and managing the business. She sells juice, rice, toilet paper, diapers, and food like oil, rice and canned food. She also sells cleaning materials.

Safa needs 1,000 USD to buy new products for her store. She appears in the photo at her store with two of her children.

loans.use: To buy new products for her store

loans.name: Julia Jorge

texts.pt:
Julia nasceu no distrito de Marracuene, na provincial de Maputo, de 41 anos de idade, solteira e mãe de 2 filhos maiores de idade e já não estudam. Estudou ate 6 classe e só interrompeu quando contraiu matrimonio. Sustenta 5 pessoas sob sua responsabilidade (1 neto e 4 sobrinhos) que vivem na mesma casa própria da senhora Julia.

Cresceu na companhia dos seus progenitores na vila do distrito de Marracuene e saiu juntamente com seus pais quando se transferiram para o distrito de Bane no bairro do km 16 (chinonanquila). Vive próximo da casa dos seus pais, onde aprendeu a fazer pequenos negócios. Vende roupa usada para todas as idades e tem cerca de 20 anos de experiência em negócios. Trabalha sozinha, compra o produtos (fardos de roupa Diversa) na cidade de Maputo e conta clientes dentro e fora do pais, na áfrica do sul e swazilandia.

Tem um rendimento mensal de 5.000,00MT e consegue poupar na sua conta bancaria 1.000,00MT por mês. 
Ouviu falar da Hluvuku-Adsema através dos vizinhos que são clientes da instituição, tendo aproximado e desembolsado dois empréstimos de 5.600,00MT e 7.000,00MT para o exercício da mesma actividade (venda de roupa usada).
Com o credito de 10.000,00MT pretende adquirir mais fardos de roupa usada e diversificada para aumentar o volume do negocio e satisfazer os seus clientes.

Propõe se pagar o empréstimo sem problemas para poder aceder a mais créditos com o objectivo de comprar mobiliário para sua casa, expandir o negocio e contractar uma empregada para lhe auxiliar nas vendas e outros trabalhos.
texts.en:
Julia was born in the district of Marracuene, Maputo province. She is 41 years old and unmarried with 2 adult children who have completed their studies. She attended school through the sixth grade and left when she got married. She supports five people (one grandson and four nephews) who live in Julia's house with her. She grew up with her parents in the town of Marracuene. The family left Marracuene when they were transferred to the district of Bane (Chinonanquila). She lives near her parents' house, where she learned to run small businesses. She sells used clothing for all ages and has nearly 20 years of experience in business. She works alone, buying products (a variety of clothing) in the city of Maputo and has clients within Mozambique as well as from South Africa and Swaziland. She earns 5000 meticals a month and is able to save 1000 meticals a month in her bank account. She heard about Hluvuku-Adsema through her neighbors, who are clients of the organization with two loans of 5600 and 7000 meticals for the same purpose (selling used clothing). With this 10,000 metical loan, she plans to acquire a variety of used clothing to expand her business and satisfy her clients. She intends to pay off the loan in full and on time so that she can take out more loans in order to buy furniture for her house, expand her business, and hire an employee to assist her with sales and other tasks.

Translated from Portuguese by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying and selling used clothing

loans.name: Venerando

texts.en:
Venerando M. is from the village of Salay Misamis Oriental. He is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Venerando owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail business. The main source of income for his business comes primarily from selling a variety of fruits like "marang" in the local community. Venerando has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Venerando joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Venerando is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used as additional business capital. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Venerando from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from his business to improve/expand it.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Use as additional business capital

loans.name: Susana

texts.en: Susana T. is a business woman. She has selling cooked noodles to sell to people in their village for a business. Anyhow, profit she had for this kind of business augments her husband's income being a hired chainsaw operator but still it can't sustain the daily expenses her four children ages from four to 25. With this problem she faced, she thought of having another business in order to increase their income. In order to pursue her plan, she joined ASHI eight months ago. She loaned for a business capital and she then started her RTW buy and sell business. She sells clothes in their village and after six months, she has able to repaid her loan from the profits she had. Now, she applies for a bigger amount of loan which will be used to finance the growth of her RTW buy and sell business. Someday, when she her business has grown, she will be renting a space open to public for more costumers. She also would like her business to become stable to be able to secure her children financial need.

loans.use: Will be used to finance her selling of Ready To Wear (RTW) clothes business.

loans.name: Haithm

texts.en:
Haithm operates a grocery store in his neighborhood. He started his operation five years ago. He is a 36-year-old father of three kids. He sells products like rice, canned foods, drinks, candies, etc.

With the loan, Haithm wants to buy more products to increase his stock of goods. He also hopes to increase his savings to provide his kids with a quality education. He would appreciate your assistance very much.

loans.use: Buy more products to increase his stock of goods

loans.name: Raed

texts.en:
Raed is a very responsible and hard working man. He lives in Nablus city of Palestine with his wife and their child. Raed has a grocery store where he sells different kinds of food, such as cookies, candies, soft drinks, juices, tea, and many other items in his store.

In order to continue growing and serving the demand of his customers, Raed needs a loan of $1,500. Having this capital would enable him to increase his income and to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase more food products

loans.name: Dafrosa

texts.en:
Dafroza is a member of the Msufini borrower group in Himo,Kilimanjaro,she is married and a mother of 4 children,Her children are aged 20,23,29,26 years.she also cares for other 1 dependent.

Dafroza started her own business selling banana 15 years ago,she works 10 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 100,000 |Tanzania shillings.

This is Dafrosa first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 100,000 Tsh in order to buy more banana for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Dafrosa hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more banana

loans.name: Samer

texts.en: Married to a housewife and the father of two children, Mr. Samer is 49. He is a tailor and lives in Nablus city of Palestine,where he has a little tailor shop. He is asking for a loan of US$1500 to buy a sewing machine and more tailoring materials .He is grateful to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: Buy a sewing machine and more tailoring materials

loans.name: Hani

texts.en: Hani is 41 years old. He is married and has nine children to whom he wishes to give the best and be able to cover the expenses of schooling for his children. He dreams that all of them might be well educated. Hani sells different kinds of accessories in his store. Today he wants to expand his business and to increase his working capital in order to purchase new goods to sell. With this purpose in mind, he is requesting $2,000. Hani would be very grateful for your support.

loans.use: To purchase new goods to sell

loans.name: Ransford

texts.en:
Ransford is 26 years old and a married father of two. One child is currently in school while his last born is still breastfeeding. Ransford works very hard to support his children and the wife. He is a supervisor for Millicom Ghana limited, a telecommunication network in Ghana, but he supervises the eastern region.

He owns a taxi cab and he is been using the taxi commercially for three months now. For his busy schedule he has employed a driver who uses the vehicle and makes accounts to him on a daily basis. He is requesting the loan to change the vehicle engine as he purchased the vehicle used. With the loan he believes he can invest into different areas and make more cash for the future of his children. He would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy a new engine for his taxi

loans.name: Claire

texts.en:
Claire M. is from the village of Salay, Misamis Oriental. She is a single mother of one infant. To make a living, Claire owns and operates a variety store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of products in the local community. Claire has been engaged in her business for more than a year and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2009, Claire joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Claire is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Claire from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to autoM. the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is one of FATEN’s long-term clients. She has taken at least seven loans from FATEN, and she repaid all her loans on time and in full.

Marina works out of her house and she does a lot of crafts like chocolate decoration for all events like christmas, weddings and new baby. Also she does wool-knitting for children and newborn babies in addition to embroidery.

Marina needs the loan to buy raw materials because if she buys a big quantity in cash she will get a better price for the materials.

Marina appears in the photo at her house with samples of her products.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials in bulk for her work

loans.name: Mira Luna

texts.en:
Mira Luna B. is from the village of Waterfall, Balingasag Misamis Oriental. She is 37 years old. Mira Luna is separated from her spouse and has two young children. To make a living, Mira Luna owns and operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing transport services to local community members by the use of her "sikad-sikad" or pedicab. Mira Luna has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2005, Mira Luna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mira Luna is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide better service. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Mira Luna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide better service

loans.name: Bathsheba Group

texts.en:
Beauty is 45 years old she is married and mother with two children. Her children are currently in school. To support her household, she has been selling cereals like maize, beans and groundnuts in the neighborhood to her loyal customers. She says selling of these products is very lucrative and therefore she wants the loan to expand her inventory to enable her make good income to support her family. She takes delivery of stock from suppliers in the northern region of Ghana and retail to her customers. With the loan she knows she can pick enough from the market place she would be grateful for your support.

She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Bathsheba’. She is the one sitting in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors etc. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bags of cereals like groundnut and beans

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.en:
Dilbar lives with her husband and her five children. She is a tailor who offers her great services to her neighbors. Her earnings are used to help cover her household expenses. Her work and her financial contribution have enhanced her self-esteem and her self-confidence. Dilbar is very proud of her work. This is the second time that Dilbar has requested a loan from IMON International. Having said this, Dilbar has an excellent history of on-time repayment.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics for sewing

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.en:
Gulnora is divorced and has two children. Gulnora has 15 years experience in her tailor shop. On her own initiative, she began to elaborate garments, which she then began to sell. This endeavor went very well, and little by little she has been purchasing different kinds of sewing machines for her store. She works every day of the week from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. Gulnora is requesting this loan in order to purchase new fabrics for sewing national dresses. With this investment, she will be able to improve her earnings and to improve her store. She will also be able to offer better service to her customers. Gulnora would like to be able to improve her quality of life and to remodel her tailor shop so that it looks nicer.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics for sewing national dresses

loans.name: Abdujabor

texts.ru: Абдужабор Салимов проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 34 года. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Абдужабор более 7 лет занимается животноводством. Он откармливает и продает крупно рогатый скот на рынке. Клиент доволен работой с кредитом т.к. он является повторным клиентом. Кредит просит для закупа скота.
texts.en:
Abdujabor S., 34, lives in Rumi district. He is married with three children. For over 7 years, Abdujabor has raised animals for a living, fattening and selling livestock at the market. As a satisfied past microfinance client, Abdujabor has applied for another loan to purchase additional livestock.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Ravshanjon

texts.en:
Ravshanjon is a young clothing merchant from Dushanbe, Tajikistan. He started his small business when he was in his late twenties, and gradually, through much hard work, he has been able to develop it into quite a successful enterprise. Ravshanjon has the qualities it takes to succeed as an entrepreneur. Goal-oriented, hard-working and punctual, he is a natural businessman. He has requested 3000 Somoni to add to his available working capital. The ability to purchase large quantities of inventory in bulk saves time and expense for merchants such as Ravshanjon. He would like to buy a supply of men's shoes that will boost his inventory before the busy autumn season. Ravshanjon appreciates the availability of funding through IMON International. It allows him to take advantage of good opportunities and focus on growing his business so that he is able to adequately provide for himself and his family.

loans.use: To purchase new men's shoes for resale

loans.name: Bethel Group

texts.en:
George is 44 years old. He is married and the father of four children. All his children are currently in school in the community where they live. He is a trader who buys and sells cutlasses. He purchases cutlasses in bulk from Accra, sharpens them, and retails them to the farming communities to weed their farms. He has been in this business for sixteen years now and has lots of experience. He requests the loan to buy a bulk supply of cutlasses in order to meet the demand of the farming communities.

George is the leader of a trust bank group called Bethel. In the group photograph, he is the man who is seated. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors, etc. In this group, the individual members act as a form of social collateral, which creates peer pressure amongst the members to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy a bulk supply of cutlasses and a sharpening machine

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy D. C. is a mother of five children whose ages are from nine to 21 years old. Nancy and her her fisherman husband wasn't able to sustain their eldest child's education after high school because the variety store business she put up when she loaned from ASHI in 2003 is not yet stable at that time the same as her husband's fishing business. After several loans, she was able to improve her business and now she has the ability to finance the education in college of her second child, her two children in high school and youngest in elementary. In her past loans and profits, she has able to purchase three fishing boat in support to her husband's fishing business. Now, Nancy wants to request for a larger amount of loan in addition to their growing fishing business. Fishes her husband will catch are to be sold by Nancy in their village and to some people wanting to sell fish in the market.
With all of her plans for the growth of their businesses, Nancy would be happier if her children will be able to graduate from college and have their own life out of poverty.

loans.use: Will be used to finance her husband's fishing business.

loans.name: Ma. Leilanie

texts.en:
Ma. Leilanie S. owns and operates a variety store selling products in her community. She is 56 years old, married and has two school-age children. They are from the village of Waterfall, Balingasag Misamis Oriental. Ma. Leilanie is just starting this business.

In 2009, Ma. Leilanie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Ma. Leilanie is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to support the education of her children and improve her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products for a store

loans.name: Munavar

texts.en:
I. Munavar is 59 years old. She is married and has one son. Munavar's husband works for a charitable organization as an accountant. In order to support her husband, Munavar has been running her own business for more than nine years. She sells national trousers for women. National dresses and trousers in Tajikistan are very popular and a very important item for the majority of women and girls. Munavar has a trading place in the central local markets of Dushanbe city. She is trying to have a wide range of goods available, in order to meet the requirements of her customers and to satisfy the needs of clients with different income levels. Today, Munavar requests 800 USD for the purpose of increasing the variety of her goods for sale. Be an important part of the growth of Munavar's business.

loans.use: To purchase new national trousers for women in order to increase the range of goods available for sale

loans.name: Nkosuo Group

texts.en:
Stephen is a trader who sells cutlasses. He gets his stock of cutlasses from Accra, sharpens them, and retails them to the farming communities to weed their farms. He is 35 years old, married and the father of two children. All his children are currently in school in the community where they live. He has been in this business for 20 years now and has lots of experience. He requests this loan to buy a bulk supply of cutlasses to meet the demand of the farming communities.

Stephen is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Nkosuo’ which literally means ‘Progress’. He is the one seated in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors, etc. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan, so there is peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy cutlasses and a sharpening machine

loans.name: Guldasta

texts.en:
K. Guldasta is a hard worker and a person who takes charge. She is married and has three children. Her husband receives a very low wage and he could not handle all the expenses of his family. For this reason, Guldasta found it necessary to start a family business. Guldasta began to sell foodstuffs in her grocery store. This was the start of the business, and together they have managed to advance it. Guldasta is now requesting a loan of 3500 somoni to expand her business to be able to offer a better service to her clients, and to improve the store. Guldasta thanks you for the confidence and aid that you offer her.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. loans.use: To buy foodstuffs for a grocery

loans.name: Babayor

texts.en: K. Babayor is 57 years old and is married with two children. For more than thirteen years Babayor has been selling vegetables such as potatoes, onions, carrots, etc. His elder son helps him with the business. Babayor’s business begins in the early morning at 5:00 a.m. He buys vegetables from the local farmers at wholesale and sells them in the market. Moreover, he is trading in a market that is known among people because of its attractive prices. All this allows Babayor’s business to generate a stable and considerable income for his family. Today, Babayor is planning to purchase new, fresh vegetables to sell in order to increase the range of his produce. For this purpose he requests 4,000 Somoni. Having a positive credit history with IMON, Babayor promises to repay the current loan promptly as he did the previous loans. The well-being of his family is in your hands. loans.use: To increase the range of his vegetables

loans.name: Gulrukhon

texts.en: K. Gulrukhon is 46 years old. She is divorced and the loving mother of two children. Gulrukhon has been running her business for about sixteen years. She sells underwear and lingerie. Her trading place is located in the local market. Gulrukhon has received one loan from IMON already and has proved herself a reliable client. Today she requests 1,000 USD which she is planning to use to enlarge the range of goods she sells. Gulrukhon thanks everyone supporting her and promises to manage the loan accurately as usual. loans.use: To increase the range of goods she sells

loans.name: The Key Group

texts.en:
Florence started her trading business in the community market close to where she lives. She is a petty trader who sells food items like tubers of yam, fresh tomatoes, fish, onions, peppers, etc. on a table in the community market.

Florence is now 38 years old and is married with four children who are currently in school. She has been stuck for funds to make business progress due to the economic crisis in the country. She wants to use the loan to buy an increased stock of assorted foodstuffs to make increased sales and income to support her children’s education and her business growth. She would be grateful for your assistance. 

Florence is the leader of a trust bank group called “The Key”. She is the one seated in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors, etc.

loans.use: To buy an increased stock of assorted foodstuffs

loans.name: Saiyora

texts.en: N. Saiyora is married with two children. She is a private entrepreneur who works in the central city market selling women’s clothing, offering a large variety of women’s clothing at reasonable prices. She has been in business for thirteen years. Saiyora has benefited a lot from a year of partnering with IMON International. She now needs a loan of 4,000 Somoni to re-stock her inventory and purchase clothing wholesale for the autumn season. She believes that the sphere of market trade where she works is a promising niche and will continue to grow and develop in the future. loans.use: To purchase clothing wholesale for the autumn season

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 27-year-old barber and the father of two. He runs his business in, and lives in, the Mukuru slums of Nairobi.

James has been in this business for nine years. He has requested his first loan of Ksh 50,000 to start a hair salon. He desires to educate his children to the highest level and to start a business for his wife. James describes himself as hardworking and jovial.


About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To start a hair salon

loans.name: Sitora

texts.en:
S. Sitora is 21 years old. She is not married and living with her parents. She has a tailoring business at tailor shop. Her business is sewing  women national dresses. Her workmanship is very good and she has a good eye for design. She is very organized and with a good head for business. She has had this business for 4 years and this is her second loan from IMON International. With her loan, Sitora is planning to purchase new modern fabrics. Help this family with improving the quality of their life by contributing to the growth of Sitora’s business. They will sincerely thank you for it.

loans.use: Purchasing fabrics for sewing national dresses for women

loans.name: Philippians Group

texts.en:
Lydia is married and is the mother of three kids who are currently in school. She is a 31-year-old trader and currently lives with her family. She is a very hardworking woman who works very hard to support her husband in taking care of the children.

Lydia has traded in garment cloths and lace materials for three years now. Lace material is very useful in room and office decorations. She treks to Kumasi to buy her stock of goods.

For lack of adequate working capital, she buys only a small stock of lace materials and garments cloth and sells through hawking (going door-to-door). For this reason she requests loan support to make business progress. She believes the loan will enable her to grow her business to the expected level. She hopes to use part of her profit to provide her children with a quality education.

Lydia is the leader of a trust bank group called “Philippians”. She is the one sitting in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors, etc.

loans.use: To purchase lace materials and textiles in bulk

loans.name: Rano

texts.en: U. Rano is 45 years old and is married with three adorable children. She sells perfumery and cosmetics in the store that she rents. She has been in this business for sixteen years. Rano dreams of expanding her business and opening her own store, establishing contacts with the constant suppliers of well-known products. Rano and her husband are working hard in order to have sufficient funds for educating of their children so that they become highly-demanded experts in future. Today Rano requests 1,000 USD in order to purchase new perfumery and cosmetics such as hair color, nail varnish, lipstick, etc. with the purpose of increasing her range of goods. She would like to thank everybody supporting her and promises to repay the loan in a timely manner. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To increase the range of goods she sells

loans.name: Sarvinoz

texts.en: Sarvinoz is a sharp, energetic entrepreneur from Dushanbe, Tajikistan. She started her own clothing business four years ago and has since been building a successful enterprise. She has a good location in the market for her sales and creates an attractive display of clothing for passing customers. Sarvinoz is a divorced woman with two children. The income she is able to make is a help to her in supporting her children with proper education. Sarvinoz has requested a loan of 3,000 Somoni so that she can purchase a new clothing inventory. This loan will allow her to increase her income by having the right clothing available to meet seasonal demand. For more than a year Sarvinoz has proven to be a great loan client with IMON International. We are glad to have this new opportunity to continue assisting her with her business. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. loans.use: To purchase more clothing to meet seasonal demand

loans.name: Mellisah

texts.en:
Mellisah is a 28-year-old mother of two school-going children. She operates a salon and a cosmetics shop as well as charcoal sales and the sale of ready food. She has been running these businesses for the past four years.

Mellisah has requested a loan of Ksh 60,000 to enable her to enlarge her business premises and add to her stock of cosmetics. Since joining Faulu Kenya Limited, she has bought four rooms in the slums and managed to educate her brother through the profits raised from her businesses. She desires to educate her children and build her family a home away from the slum. She describes herself as loving, diligent and jovial.


About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To enlarge her business premises and to buy more cosmetics

loans.name: Lany

texts.en: Lany E. is from the village of Manticao, Iligan City. She is 46 years old, is widowed, and has four school-aged children. Lany owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Lany joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Kwadwo

texts.en:
Kwadwo is 50 years old and is married with three children. Currently all his children are in school.

Kwadwo runs a chemist (pharmacy) and sells various kinds of drugs in his neighborhood like blood-tonics, pain-killers, malaria drugs, etc. He has been in business for fifteen years now and he is the only person who supplies pharmaceutical products in the community. His pharmacy is registered to operate by the Ghana Pharmacy Council.

Kwadwo wants to use the loan to buy an increased supply of drugs and to include items that are frequently demanded by his customers. He hopes to raise a good income to take care of his family. He would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy an increased supply of pharmaceutical drugs

loans.name: El

texts.en:
El L. is 32 years old. Her husband, Sen, is 33. El and Sen have been married for many years, and they have 3 children who are still in school.

Sen spends almost all his time selling charcoal throughout the nearby villages. El grows rice on a plot of farmland that was given to her by her parents. She harvests and sells her rice crops twice a year.

El is seeking a loan in order to buy a buffalo for both her farmland and her husband’s delivery service. She dreams of someday sending her children to college.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo for her farmland and her husband's delivery service.

loans.name: Nigor

texts.en: Z. Nigor is married with three children. She sells nice, quality fabrics for national dresses in a big local market. Her family actively helps her with her business which she started about eighteen years ago. Nigor would like to ask for a loan of 3,700 Somoni to increase her inventory which will help supply her until the autumn season. She believes this timely investment will help her generate additional income and increase the family budget. We think Nigor’s responsibility and strong character will assist her with the current loan repayment. loans.use: To purchase new fabrics to increase her range of goods

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is 56 years old and is the mother of three children, ranging in age from 15 to 20 years old. Her eldest child and youngest decided not to continue their studies toward college, one after high school and the other after elementary school. Rita's last hope is with her second child, who is now in her second year of college. Rita tries her best to grow her business in order to finance her child's college education. Rita's husband is her assistant in running her own business. 

When Rita joined ASHI in 2004, she had a loan to start up a business and was able to raise pigs. After raising several pigs and selling them, she has been able to start a general store that she is expanding. She wants to fill up her store with commodities needed by people in their village. The loan she requests now will be used to purchase canned foods, beverages, and rice. 

In the years to come, Rita wishes to have more loans to be able to expand her general store into a mini grocery store that sells a lot of things people need every day of their lives. She hopes to stabilize her business for her two children to take over since they are college undergraduates.

loans.use: To purchase goods

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is 40 years old she is married and mother three children. Currently all her children are in school in the community where they live. She is sells smoked fishes and grocery products. She buys stock of fish from Yeji in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. She prepares and serves her customers with very tasty and good quality fish and because of that many customers buy from her stand. She requests the loan to upgrade her stock of fishes. She dreams to give her children quality education through the proceeds from the business. She would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy more stock of smoked fishes and dried fish.

loans.name: Barno

texts.en: E. Barno is married and has two grown children. She owns a little place at the central market in Djabbar Rasulov, Tajikistan, where she sells various types of clothing. Some of the advantages of her business are: variety, consistency, and affordable prices. She has been working in this business for ten years. Barno is always seeking to grow and develop her business and improve her entrepreneurial skills. Currently she is requesting a loan of 3,000 Somoni to purchase more goods to sell. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family’s financial situation. loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Revelyn

texts.en: Revelyn T. is from the village of Mialen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 35 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Revelyn owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 1,200 PHP a month. In 2009, Revelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian F. is from the village of Pan-ay,Clarin,Misamis Occidental. She is 37 years old. Lilian is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Lilian owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Lilian has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lilian joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilian is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Lilian from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mamur

texts.en: K. Mamur has a minivan which he uses to provide transportation services. Having attended to this business for fifteen years, he has gained much experience. Initially he rented a car but, after time and having made certain savings, he bought his own minivan. The business is stable and generates the main and considerable income for his family allowing improvement in their living conditions. Currently Mamur’s minivan needs some repairs. That’s why he needs a loan of 3,000 Somoni to purchase spare parts. He thanks everyone supporting him and promises to repay the loan with accuracy. The well-being of his family is in your hands.
